3.description: I ordered the Orange Chicken. Very simple meal. The chicken was not chicken. I do not know what it was. I asked my husband to try it to see what it was. He said it was a tiny piece of dark meat breaded with lots of bread. . Well to me it tasted gooey. Sort of like it was wet. I am assuming it was old. I do not like wet bread or dark meat. There is no wonder I did not like it. The meat was orange the color for the marinate. That way nobody could tell the difference of what kind of meat it was.  What happened to me here yesterday is the reason I do not like trying new places. In the end I was out $7.45 and still hungry *violin plays*.

1.description: I love this place. Not too far, good food, quick and affordable. There are some items on the menu that's either hit or miss. I would not recommend the Orange Chicken, Sweet & Sour Chicken or the Shrimp with Lobster sauce, but everything else here is pretty spot on.

2.description: This is the ONLY place in Chicago I will eat Chinese food from! Have been a very loyal customer for over 10 yrs and recommend it to everyone. Swear by it!

0.description: I can't believe I am the first to review this because this is the best chinese food on the south side!The food is fresh, large portions, cooked perfectly (not too much oil) and the menu is diverse. I love the seafood fried rice. You can hardly find it in any other city.Great food and delicous smoothies!!!

4.description: Chicken noodles soup is very good if u have a cold.....

3.description: Absolutely addicting donuts and donut holes - don't miss this place!

1.description: I had heard about this place from a buddy of mine's  nephew , he said the donuts are close to old fashioned in roseland . he sure was RIGHT  !!!    i went in there  11 / 24 / 2015  and  I  got  2  glazed donuts , they were ssoooo  good  ,  I will be back to try the other flavors , and i'll spread the word .

2.description: I have been to D&D around 4 times.  They have one of the best donuts.  The glazed donuts is to die for. They are similar to Old Fashioned Donuts in Roseland.  But fellow Southsider's  we now have a closer place to purchase one of the most delicious donuts in Chicago!  The owner is so nice.  Yesterday she gave us a sample of the cake glazed donut hole.  OMG, was that good, I was sorry I had already purchased my 6 donuts.  Then she showed us the donut bun her husband developed. I can't wait to have a hamburger or sausage sandwich made on one of these rolls.  Please support this fantastic additions to the Southside of Chicago!  You won't be disappointed.

0.description: Went in one early afternoon during this past summer to get a small cone, but the the ice cream machine was down for maintenance. Thank god it was!The lovely woman behind the counter offered me a free freshly made doughnut to try, it melted in my mouth immediately! SO SO GOOD! Her husband was in the back making fresh ones and i got a chance to say thank you to him as well.This place is amazing!! Best doughnuts on the southside hands down! and much closer to me than Old Fashioned Doughnuts all the way in Roseland

1.description: Still stymied over what to get Mom this weekend? A box of candy may seem a little tried-and-true, but if your mother (or you!) has a sweet tooth, there's no better way to satisfy it than with a hand-picked selection of chocolates and other treats from Cupid.Its locations on Chicago's southwest side, Oak Lawn (4707 W. 95th) and Orland Park (9420 W. 143d) serve up a delightful array of truffles, cremes, and hard candies pre-boxed or by-the-piece. So far so good...but what REALLY impressed me was the wide variety of reduced-sugar and sugar-free treats. I had very "slim pickings" at Margie's and Fannie's when shopping for a diabetic relative last Christmas. But here, just about all the offerings  come in both "regular" and diet versions; the latter are made with "natural sweeteners" and taste as good as their traditional counterparts.Cupid Candies passes both the taste test and the "gas test" - as in, "Is it worth spending the money on gas to get here?"You bet your bon-bons!

2.description: Nice folks and good candy off the beaten track but right on Western Ave. Stop in.

0.description: Stopped in the other afternoon because I was in the area again and my wife's birthday was coming up.  Stopped in and Hazel helped me.  Really great lady!  Super service.  She couldn't have been nicer and more helpful.  The candy selection is incredible and she put together a one pound box of everything my wife likes.Most importantly the candy is great!  Old school candy store and the candy is made right in back.  Always super fresh and some of the best turtles we've ever had!  Ask Hazel for her recommendations if the selection is too tough.  She made some great ones for me.Park right in front on the sidewalk.  If the door is locked just knock.  They might be in back so be patient.  The wait is worth it.One must have on a warm day is the dark chocolate covered ice cream bar.  I don't like dark chocolate.  Anyplace but here now.

3.description: Forgot to give me my coleslaw (love my slaw, huge no no in my book), out of tarter sauce, breading was unflattering. Rubber ish chicken. Took almost 30 mins to get mine and my gals order ready.

1.description: You must have to be the most ignorant,low class, no customer service having individual to work here. I have this place 2 stars because the food is pretty good however, the customer service is horrible.I am a customer service driven individual and they don't meet standards.When you walk in the lady in the front taking orders always looks like she hates being there.I ordered chicken today and was criticized for asking for more  lemon pepper. Really?!?!Surely  minimum wage does not qualify you to be a doctor or food critic!!!!As the ghetto lady sprinkled more lemon pepper on my wings.*thump* "diabetes"*thump* "there goes high blood pressure "I was shocked!! O.k. Let's be clear, if you are ordering fried chicken, healthy eating is the last thing on your mind.I will not be patronizing this location again!!They can change the name as many times as they think they need to. They will continue to have problems until they find quality staff

2.description: Food is good, Jumbo shrimp & lemon pepper chicken are delicious, but the cashier here is ghetto, rude, & has no skill for any kind of service. Fortunately it's a fast food spot & my expectations aren't that high.

5.description: I used to treat myself on Fridays after a hard work week to some greasy spoon eats.  I had stopped because I am constantly being drilled by my Doctor to loose some weight.  But this past Friday, I threw caution to the wind and stoped at Sharks for 4 wings (instead of my usual 6).  I guess they did me a favor because, I was do disappointed I started to take them back.  I have never in my life seen chicken wings that tiny, it was ridiculous, 4 wings equaled maybe one and a half wings.  So never again, Harolds is up the street, they give you bread and coleslaw, at Sharks you get just chicken and fries.  For the best wings, try the Wings on 83rd& Halsted, southeast corner!

6.description: They cook pretty good here, for fast food..I usually get the catfish and the fried oysters... uh...when I'm not on a diet..lol

0.description: I normally don't eat Shark's; the standard blue glare is unappetizing, not to mention that my prior experiences with {other Shark's locations} have been generally disappointing.So the only reason I tried this one was that my wife had bought some chicken there for a party, unbeknownst to me.Wow, I was amazed. The chicken was fresh, cooked perfectly thoroughly and had the just right (read: minimal) amount of oil to the batter and meat.But I was still not willing to go for the fish based on previous experiences (I've seen the kitchen!...again, at other locations). However, my wife insisted.Second time: "Wow, I was amazed". The catfish nuggets were fried to perfection, the portions were astoundingly generous, and even the fries and white bread were tasty!I'll be back again. And I'd suggest you check 'em out!Also, as an aside, the lobby is very clean and it's pleasant that the staff isn't behind bullet-resistant glass!

4.description: Wish I could give 2 1/2 stars......Dropped in on a busy friday night without phoning ahead.  Ordered a small catfish dinner.   I waited for about 20 mins.  I am not complaining about that but the clientele were something else.  I felt sorry for the employees that have to put up with them. It came with your standard fare of fries and two pieces of white bread.  The four pieces of catfish looked very generous when I opened the box.  First I noticed that they left all the bones in.  I was disappointed but then I figured what the hell,  there's four good size pieces of catfish.  The quality was very good and tasted very good for the first two pieces.  The last two pieces were essentially useless.  It really did seem like they battered up and fried the tail.  There was no usable meat on them. The place was very clean though.  You can tell the care about appearance. Kudos for that. So for the circumstances I had with them I would give them 2 1/2 stars.  Even though the pieces that had meat on them were pretty darn good.  I cant forget about the other HALF of my meal.  Maybe one day I will try them again.  I ill try another type of fish or maybe the chicken.  And definitely phone ahead on  the weekends.  It would be an advantage.

3.description: An institution in the area.  Obviously, you can find much bigger stores if you are willing to drive 30 minutes, but for being 5 minutes away, not a bad store at all.  I like the little layout of, "Fun and non-offensive in the front of the store, raunchy in the backroom." It's far less intimidating that way instead of a burly bouncer asking for an ID at the door as he sits next to the hardcore raunch.  My only complaint is the pricing.  I'm well aware of the cost of smut, but really, with the internet entertainment being free and convenient, 40 bucks for a dvd seems pretty high.

1.description: One of my favorite store to shop for my vibrators. I am a single girl so I have to keep myself occupied lol.

2.description: Me and my boyfriend came here to purchase a new toy to spice things up. We found one that we liked and the lady took it out of the package to turn it on and show us it had different levels of vibration but she did not hand us the toy to personally check it out ourselves. We decided to check out and when we got home I went to turn it on and within about 10 seconds it died. I opened the bottom to change the batteries and it had cum scum in it. Literally dried up flaking off hard old cum in the bottom part that you screw on. Then I noticed the black string that is connected to it was all filthy... I have never in my life been so grossed out. Then come to find out a friend of mine has done a return there! If you flirt with the girls and you're cute they will take your items back! This is fucking disgusting and I will never step foot in that shit hole again!

5.description: Looking for something creative to do at 4am when you are feeling lonely and depraved?  Check out the selection of adult book, movies, toys and general collection of pornographic material found here.  Not your typical movie/smut house, for it's actually really clean, and there are no creepy guys (or girls) just hanging about looking to pick someone up.  And the best part, you can go whenever you feel the need.  It is open 365 days a year, 24 hours a day.   Holidays included.

0.description: This is the first adult store I've ever been to, so needless to say, I was a bit apprehensive. However, when I walked in, it looked more like a gift store than a sex shop. The nice girl behind the counter was very welcoming and guided us to a back room with all the toys and videos one could ever want.  Amazing things about this place are:1) the prices ( everything is soooooo cheap)2) selection- they have lots of things for all types of people3) "the girl behind the counter" was nice enough to give suggestions while not trying to sell you the most expensive item.You can have a conversation with a knowledgeable salesperson about adult toys just as easy as asking about batteries at Radioshack.  Love this place!Diverse clientele too!

4.description: The last time I was in this joint was about five years ago, my driver's license that allowed me smokes and porn. So where did I go? Here.Classy? nope. When I first entered a gigantic phallic object was pointed my way; a sign of things to come. The place is clean, not many customers in the day time. Decent selection, though I must add, I can't compare it to much. Absolutely more than any 7-11. Anyway, they offer the typical gag gifts as well as clothing and videos. Location's pretty tricky. Basically, you're on a hope and a prayer to go southbound on Cicero from 4pm-6pm.Open everyday, all day.

0.description: This place has some of the tastiest pizza sauce ever! Whenever I wait too late to eat this place is always open. They know me as "the girl that don't eat meat; very friendly and fast phone ordering. Unfortunately they have some of the creepiest delivery guys. One time he pretty much invited himself into my house...I almost offered him a glass of water. I guess I should stop ordering so late.

3.description: I dont usually  write bad reviews but this left a bad taste in my mouth. I ordered some food and noticed there was something missing. I proceeded to call them and tell them that something was missing but they swore up and down that everything was delivered. When they finally admitted they messed up they still proceeded to ask for me to pay for the missing item, although i paid the full amount and also gave the delivery guy a 6 dollar tip for his troubles. I dont know what they think is ok but if they treat their customers this way then they will never get a order from my family again. I'm sorry to say that this was the place i chose to eat from. I hope everyone else dont get stuff missing in their orders. Crap service, ok food, even worse employees if i could rate this place a zero i would.

1.description: Just got a italian beef ordered and it was the most bland no flavored italian beef ive ever had. It was hard to eat, no flavor, and really dry.

2.description: Grew up in this neighborhood and this was a great neighborhood bar and pizza joint.  I stopped back in here last weekend and they completely remodeled the place which to most is probably a good thing but I don't think it's for the better.  Too bright and sterile and about 10 too many TVs.  Not the comfortable bar and pizza place anymore.  Too bad.

5.description: Just moved into the Burbank area ( from Chicago !, pizza heaven) and I've tried so many places with ok results but then I hit this place ......hands down-  is the best ! And they are fast !! 40 minutes for 3 miles. Found my new spot.....finally. Only glanced at other reviews, don't let the bad stuff stop you from trying this place, it's great.

6.description: Ordered through Grub Hub. Food arrived on time but the entire pizza was super BURNT. Black on the bottom and the crust was super burnt crispy. I ordered a large pizza and 2 large fries. The fries came in 1 bag of what looked like 2 small bags put together. Ok?? And the fries had no salt or taste to them. They were soggy and terrible. Will not order from this place again. I was very disappointed since we just moved into the neighborhood and have yet to find decent pizza. :-(

7.description: I have been going to Angie's pizza for YEARS.  This is the "go-to" place for a quick yummy bite to eat.  You can usually find me ordering the Chicken Ceasar Wrap for delivery.  It is one of my favorite "hangover" foods.  YUMMY.  Although, I eat it probably at least once every 2 weeks.  All of the men in my life love their beef sandwiches - grinder style.  Their thin crust pizza is also to die for. I  have never left Angie's upset.  Although, the patrons seated at the bar can be somewhat juvenile and bothersome.  In conclusion,  I LOVE THIS PLACE!

8.description: The first time I ordered a pizza the owner and phone person wanted to argue why I wanted my pepperoni on the side.  I called back 5 minutes later to confirm I was getting thin crust and he told me no one orders that, it was my responsibility to ask for it so I was stuck with whatever he had made for me.  When my finance picked it up he said Oh, so your wife was the "*B".  The pizza was pretty good but not what I wanted.  Tonight we ordered a pizza giving it another try since I like the sauce.  We ordered it with "light cheese".. the darn thing was a cheese ball, the cheese sweat into the thin crust making it saggy.  I could only eat the 2" close to the edge.  Again, not getting what I wanted.  The owner is the son of an original owner and very unprofessional.  A lesson in cooking and customer service would be helpful to the longevity of this establishment.   On a side note, my super sweet loving senior mother in law worked here for many many years and said this guys total  A**.

9.description: Excellent food.  Laid back atmosphere.  Reasonable prices.  I once saw "Walk The Line" there with a friend and had a blast. What more could a girl ask for?

0.description: Great food here. You wouldn't guess from just looking at the place. Looks like a typical bar/pub, but they have GREAT Italian food here. I'll stick with the pizza review since that is what I know best.Their crust is very crispy on the outside, but breadlike on the inside---light and airy. It would probably be good by itself. It comes in thin and regular thickness, and stuffed. The sauce is tasty and rich. I've heard some say too salty, but...to each his own. Their sausage is very tasty too. They always leave a good 3/4 to 1 inch of crust on the outside, that puffs up with godness. The other toppings are okay, nothing incredible.Two things make this place really good:Timeliness and attitude.I live about 3 miles away and get my pizza in 25-35 minutes delivered. Eat there, and it's even quicker.The folks there are great, generous and friendly.Give it a try.

4.description: Friend recommended this place. Ordered pizza with sausage and peppers. 3 peppers on the entire pizza. 3 peppers!! I guess that's why no one was there on a Saturday night.

1.description: I like this Aldi, prices here are really fair, love the generic versions they have too. It's really quiet & peaceful as well so you can do your shopping really peacefully. There's always plenty of people in the store, the cashiers are really friendly. There's a weird rent-a-cop chilling by the exit but still i've been coming here for years and will continue coming.

2.description: I'm definitely an aldi girl.  Mainly because I'm cheap.  They have most basic grocery items for a fraction of what you would pay at jewel or most other grocery stores.  Most of the things they carry are generic items but I think they're just as good as the brand name stuff.  They even sell wine! The reason I gave four stars instead of five I'd that sometimes the lines get really long and if you can't find something it's hard to find someone to help you.

0.description: Love this store! Clean and organized and incredible deals. We bake a lot so this store is a lifesaver. Can't find a better deal on flour, sugar, milk, eggs, cream cheese etc. Great prices on nuts we use for baking as well, a bag of pecans is $2.99 here and double the price at local grocery stores.Be prepared to do things a little differently though. Have a quarter ready because you need to put one in the shopping cart. Don't worry, you get your quarter back once you return your cart. Genius isn't it? People want to get their quarter back which eliminates the need for and employee to gather carts and helps keep prices low. You might find yourself walking up to the register and find no one there. Don't worry, the cashier will come around in a minute or two. Aldi pays they employees very well, but has them do multiple jobs. When the cashier has no one in line, they sneak off for a few minutes to straighten up the store and restock items.Also, either bring your own recyclable bag or  you can buy a bag at the register for a mere .10. You will also bag your own groceries, there is no bagger. Love that they encourage people to bring in their own bags, another smart way they cut down on overhead and keep prices low!This is a great place to come for toys as well, the selection may not be huge but you can find some incredible deals. Especially around the holidays. They also sell random seasonal items for a good price, so well with popping in here on a regular basis. Don't be fooled by the low prices and think it's low quality. They are just very smart and efficient about running their business, cutting down on unnecessary over head and know how to keep prices low while paying employees well. They also happen to be owned by the same parent company as Trader Joe's which us my absolute favorite grocery store!

1.description: I felt like I was getting stalked by a white lady or manager. She was like a half.  I left everything and walked out. And didn't let my daughter can a product to check the price. Smh never going there just because the way she made me feel.

2.description: So, I recently moved from the suburbs into the city, and simultaneously didn't have a phone for a short span of time. Naturally, in this span of time, my medication came up for renewal.I know my doctor, she knows me, she's told me previously to never worry about getting refills on this particular medication, because it's a daily required dose without which I become very, very sick. In fact, within three missed doses, I start to enter a violent withdrawal state that I can only describe as being like the flu plus insomnia plus weakness plus mild electrocution.Knowing this, I set up a prescription transfer to a pharmacy a block away from my new place. This CVS gives the new pharmacy the wrong doctor's info, and me being without a phone, am unable to get a hold of my doctor to get things straightened out.It's basically a downhill shitstorm from this point involving another terrible CVS location on the north side. As of today I've been without my medication for ten days, am sick and miserable, but have a new phone and am getting my script filled at Target, because CVS can eat a bag of dicks.

0.description: Cvs was able to resolve my problem with the insurance and my doctor in a timely manner.

1.description: Yesterday I was too OUTDONE 2 Properly Blast A.P. Deli on 79th like they needed to be !!! That will be my last time going to pay $10 for a ""REALLY"" SANDWICH! Ten dollars really for a toddler portion of meat really!!!!??? They used to be wayyyy better! Smh! REALLY!??? #wheresTheRestOfItWhoAteTheMeat??!

0.description: I ordered the pizza w/fries with mild sauce for lunch for the first time... It was fresh and Hot...I'll definitely go back for this quick meal under $5

1.description: Small, old fashioned, clean, reliable Chicago hot dog and hamburger joint. The fries are always good, and the shakes are awesome. Also some nice tables for sitting outside.

2.description: The bomb!!!

0.description: Yum! True drive-in food!! Deep fried Polish sausage? The place is spotless and help as sweet and as a bug!  Had a turkey burger and Cooper, our dog loved the chicken nuggets. Real chicken, no minced up ground up crap.  If we have time, we'll be back.

3.description: An okay Burger King. There's an usually large amount of fast food in the area but this is a solid choice for a burger.

1.description: I give this place 1 star because it stinks like old man sweat in their. I don't understand how the workers don't smell that. I work close by that bk and the only times I go in their to get sum food is when am close to passing out from hunger. But seriously tho do something about the smell in their. It stinks!!!!!!!

2.description: Ef this place they have horrible service. There service is slow. As they overcook the meat

0.description: Older BK but I'm sure the neighborhood doesn't mind. Nice people...manager was making people work--which is good to see...kept clean

1.description: This is a pretty good Mexican place. After moving from West Lawn we wanted to find a good Mexican place. But like all Mexican places that try to do everything, nothing stands out as amazing. The ceviche was kind of fishy and bland. The enchiladas Rojas were great. Steak taco was just ok. Salsas were excellent. We were super happy to hear the delivered. We are in evergreen and when we called and asked about delivery to our address there was a lengthy discussion in the background about if they'd deliver to ius or not. They said they would but when the delivery man came he said "sorry but we won't deliver this far again." Once he left we noticed they forgot our tiramisu which they DID charge us for.

9.description: I tried this place out last night due to the great reviews.  I ordered a carne asada dinner and tortilla soup for takeout.  The food was amazing!!!! The presentation was beautiful and every morsel was so flavorful.  I can't wait to dine in next time!!

12.description: I like Q Sazon!I ordered food to go a few months back, and the torta was delicious - it was unique... different.  I can go anywhere for a regular torta [well, not anywhere], but Q Sazon uses a different approach, different ingredients. Today I ordered food on GrubHub, Pork stewed in a green sauce with poblano peppers, black beans and rice.  That was tasty! We also had a steak burrito, and they use a different cheese in theirs than the typical shredded cheese other spots use.  Their black beans are really good to -  love dipping chips in beans.I only gave it four stars, because the tortillas that came with the pork were good, but they were not fabulous.Also, they put extra care into wrapping the food, so that it arrived hot.  Oft times, when one orders food for delivery, it can tend to be warm or even luke warm, and I always end up heating it up.  I was very pleased with this meal.I believe it is also BYOB, so, check it out.  I intend to take a crew there for a night out, as I would really love to support this establishment and see it succeed.

21.description: Ehhhh . It's ok. Has a lot of potential but they definitely need to step their game up. It was ok but not sure I'd go back.

16.description: The only thing I like here is the torilla soup. This place has the smallest burrito I've ever seen and even if I'm the only person in there ordering, it still takes 30 minutes to get my food. I sat down once with my boyfriend and recieved our food at different times. He ordered a dinner and got his rice and beans first, then I got a taco, then my soup and finally our food. It's not worth the wait.

17.description: Talked coworkers into ordering carryout from here about 6 months ago after my wife and kids tried dining in on a week night. When we sat down only one other table was seated. Our waitress welcomed us and was attentive, pleasant and helpful. I ordered a few different tacos, the wife chose enchiladas, and kids ordered tortas. My son's Hawaiian torta was huge and he loved it. When we were finished with our dinners, the hostess came and asked if we were first time customers and comped us a delicious plantain dessert. We regularly have taco Friday at work and this is fast becoming the 'go to' local joint. People love the homemade chips and guacamole. I hope more folks give QSazon a try, the food and service are definitely worth it. (I have eaten tacos from at least 12 places on South Pulaski between 47th and 87th, QSazon is a contender)

10.description: Great Mexican food spot! I had the Torta Cubana and it was delicious. They also have really good chips & salsa. It's a little bit out of the way, but it's worth the drive.

5.description: The special Guacamole is a must, fresh and tasty. The Sope was incredible. The tortas were also good. The plantain Fritos dessert was not as good as it looked. The plantains were not ripe and so the dish was a fail. The coffee tasted like Maxwell House, not Mexican coffee.

11.description: The online ordering system has some flaws when it comes to adding condiments to your food but the food was delicious and fresh! The customer service was great as well!

3.description: This place is honestly delicious. Stopped by here randomly while working and had a great experience. The food was cheap and of amazing quality. It came with complementary chips and salsa as well as soup. The server was great and very kind. I got the steak burrito and it was the bomb! Had plenty of guac in it too with no extra cost. Definitely going to swing by again when I'm in the area.

0.description: I really enjoyed eating at this place, however they are a bit low on service. I'm not sure if it's because they are fairly new but overall they have amazing food, fresh ingredients and a calm atmosphere. I recommended if you aren't in a rush.

20.description: I tried this place about 2 weeks ago. I have driven past there many times since it opened this summer and had been curious so my sister and I went for a Sunday lunch. Items on the menu were very reasonably priced! Greated with some chips and salsa at our table. Wish they gave a bigger bowl of chips, because that salsa was GOOD so i just kept asking for chip refill! The salsa had a smokey taste of roasted chiles and reminded me of my grandmothers recipe. We ordered the ceviche appetizer.. which was also pretty good and a nice size portion. My sister ordered a torta which i tasted and it was also good. I think there might have been some sourcream or different (mexican) cheese that was  on there but it was still good. I ordered some tacos de pastor which were tasty and a decent size, unlike other taco joints that give small wimpy tacos. Also ordered a sope of carne asada which you could tell was freshly made. It was a little thin for my liking and reminded me more of a huarache but still very very tasty! The overall presentation of the food was EXCELLENT! Made me feel like i was eating somewhere near Wicker but with cheap prices. It is well prepared food which actually is -Authentic- which other places proclaim, but this place actually lives up to! I like this place and it is definitely my choice for Mexican food now, I even have plans to go today!  Try this place out! You wont regret it!~Yum..................... :)

19.description: Ehhhh . It's ok. Has a lot of potential but they definitely need to step their game up. It was ok but not sure I'd go back.

2.description: We found this place on grub hub. Our first order took a bit a long but definitely worth it! We have tried the burritos, tacos and tortas and all of us have been completely satisfied.  My youngest even loved that they served grilled cheese lolWe have since ordered 6x and will continue to do so

18.description: You could easily pass it without noticing it other than that it's next door to the parking lot for a very famous pizza place. The food was very tasty and delicious. We ordered the chicken enchiladas verdes and the sauce was so good. It was the perfect blend. We also had the steak and nopales huarache which was equally tasty. By far the best thing we had were the platanos Fritos which were amazing and only 1.69. Definitely will go back. All this food, 1 drink and a chicken taco and the bill was 24 dollars. Perfect!

13.description: Very clean restaurant and the best shrimp taco I ever had. The carne Asada is outstanding as well. The special guacamole was awesome. Definitely will be going back.

4.description: Can't believe anything this good exists in this neighborhood, to be honest.Ordered takeout one night just because it was nearby and new and I hadn't tried the place yet. Ordered online. Went to pick it up in about 15 minutes and they had it all ready. Place looked pretty nice, nobody really in there at the time (probably because it was 9 at night on a Tuesday).But anyway, the food! I don't have high expectations of places way out on the edge of the south side, but this place was seriously good even without that in mind. Probably the best Mexican food I've had in Chicago. Actually, defintely the best Mexican food I've had in Chicago.Tried the campechano burrito because it sounded too good to pass up, and I was right. I don't usually go for burritos since they're usually just a pile of beans and lettuce and sour cream in a tortilla, but this one was legit. Could barely finish the whole thing but I definitely wanted to.The guacamole was great and there was a lot of it for the price. The chips were good (multicolored, too - made from white, blue, and red corn tortillas, I guess). And one little thing that stood out for me: their salsa verde is definitely made with avocado. I've only ever seen that in California, and it's way better than the stuff in most places in Chicago.I'm going to make this my new go-to place for Mexican takeout.

6.description: This place has great food with great pizzaz! Totally good MEXICAN food with a totally modern, funky feel! I have had tortas, burritos, and you MUST have the platanos dessert!!! To die for!!!

15.description: I have driven past this place and finally I'm eating here! Love the special guacomole & aguas frescas. The waiter was so nice & professional. Definitely, I will come back soon!

7.description: Small little place. I got the breaded steak torta. It wasnt bad just all bread little meat. Its cheap meat so idk why they couldnt add more. It was good for what was there and cheap

8.description: I was completely iffy about this place. I know good Mexican food so I didn't want to try a place I knew nothing about. I had my food delivered off of grub hub it said it was going to be an hour wait it was more like 35 minutes.  My food was great. Fresh, hot, flavorful amazing food! Would totally order from again and highly recommend!

14.description: Oh boy am I full! I've got the itis. Not your run of the mill mexican restaurant. Oh the flavors and heat from the diablo shrimp made my nose run in a beautifully reddish brown sauce. Y'all didn't give me enough bread to sop it up. The octopus & shrimp cocktail was saucy and crisp with it's silky texture.  Also, I ordered frescos de jamaca X 2 were fruity and sweet, not cloying my tougue. Delivery on line at work....priceless!

3.description: I preordered here one time and they didn't even get my game. They also refused to refund my money. This manager is the worst, he is pushy and rude. He also buys products from walmart to resell at an inflated price. His employees even have tax exempt cards that say church of play n trade so they can avoid paying taxes when they buy their scam products.

1.description: I never had any problems personally with the people that worked there. I only come to this place as an alternative to other game outlet stores. I also like how they carry retro games which is another reason why I come here. Wait until emulators come out! They try to pressure you into a membership you'll never use. The games are a bit expensive. This place scammed my friend into upgrading his hard drive on his PS3 from 120GB to 500GB and charged him $250 with data transfer. OUTRAGEOUS!

2.description: Step inside of here and you'll think you're buying a used car.  The owner is very shifty, shady, and sketch.  SSS.  Which also translates to $$$ because that's what this place is, a RIPOFF.  But hey, to their credit, pretty much ALL Play N Trade's are.  If you thought it couldn't get worse than Gamestop, look again.  Gamestop may try to upsell you some new preorder or coverage, but this place takes the cake.   I feel like I'm in Agrabah haggling over rugs.  AND I DON'T EVEN WANT TO BUY THE RUG.They had a brand new Animal Crossing New Leaf Nintendo 3DS XL for almost double the price, the day it came out, but said they were sold out of preorders.  So basically they pulled a Gamestop, and just marked up the price.  Even Gamestop will at least sell it to you for it's original cost if no one picked it up.Steer clear. Some of these places might have some deals, but it's not worth stepping into this one.

0.description: Never had any problems with be employees like others mention here. Have you ever known one of these places NOT to be a ripoff? I like that they have retro games but the selection is totally lame, it's essentially all the shovelware unplayable games for nes/SNES/genesis. There was like ten copies of the little mermaid for nes and the wanted $9 for it! I can buy an amazing nes game like  metroid for $2 on amazon, why would I pay more for less.On top of this the store just reeks! I think it's because they leave their food garbage from lunch rotting in the trash behind the counter.

3.description: I went to this Harold's tonight and the customer service was horrible and the chicken was mediocre.  I will continue to drive out of my way to go to a Harold's within the city limits.  I called in my order and waited 30 minutes after paying for them to call my number so I could retrieve my food.  Eventually I asked Lataisha if my food was ready and she comes back with the food ( it had been sitting for who knows how long) and I say I've been waiting here and you guys never called my number.  She then tells me Jasmine called my number and I tell her no that didn't happen because I've been listening.  She then snatches the food telling me I will get new chicken and saying that was completely unnecessary.  I don't know which part was unnecessary me getting horrible service or me acknowledging that I got horrible service, I'm assuming it was the latter.  I then asked Jasmine if there was a manager and I was informed they were not in.  How does a business properly run with no manager on duty?  I asked for their names and that's when things got crazy.  Jasmine asked what did I want on the order of "fresh" chicken and I told her and she told me she didn't know and I "didn't have to do all that".  Once again I don't know if "all that" consisted of answering her question or not.  However I never once yelled or cursed, I as the paying customer who never asked for a freebie was verbally insulted by people who I was paying to provide a product.I do know this place needs a complete overhaul of staff and correct policy and procedures to correctly deal with customer complaints and they could also enroll the staff in lessons on speech and maybe reading lessons since reading the ticket was such an unbearable task for them.  There is another Harold's across the street and a Red Snapper around the corner, if I wanted something close to my home I would choose one of those but they do not have an online presence so it would take a bit of an effort.

1.description: The mild sauce isn't the same as the other Harold's off 87th and Sangamon. I ordered the wings with salt pepper hot sauce and mild sauce they just put mild sauce on it only. I waited a half hour for the order when it barely had any customers.

2.description: I had heard a lot of hype about Harold's, and I had very high hopes when I stopped by here for lunch, but unfortunately I was let down :(I thought the lady at the counter who took our order was pretty friendly. I went with the 1/4 chicken with dark meat and fries. It was actually a pretty good deal for the chicken, fries, and a drink as a lunch special! I thought that the chicken was alright. It was anything I'd right home about, so I was pretty underwhelmed. It was definitely still gooood, but it definitely didn't live up to the hype in my opinion. It left me longing for Popeye's... Also, the fries weren't very great either.I may be back, or maybe I'll try a different location, but I'll probably just try somewhere else.

5.description: I stopped, in at this location and got home to find a staple in my food. I called, and a young lady answers the phone and seemed non concerned about what I just told her. The bag wasn't stapled so, why was there a staple in my dry chicken and half sauced fries? They've totally lost me as a customer. No apology, for it happening or offer to give me a credit. Just a bye!

6.description: The food was great!!! I ordered the 4 wing meal but I was shocked at the $6.50 price tag (but I'm cheap). The service was subpar. The orders were totally mixed up and at one point I thought they were calling out random numbers. About 30 minutes into my wait they started calling numbers higher than my number which really aggravated me. I guess I'll keep going to my favorite Harold's this one needs more experience.

0.description: First time I've ever seen a live band playing in a chicken shack, while water is running from the ceiling.

4.description: The food is never disappointing here. The gizzards are the best around. The wings lack flavor but if you put lemon pepper on them it makes up for it. The only reason they're not getting 5 stars is the wait time. Every time we came here to order we had to wait a good 15-20 minutes.

0.description: Great flower shop.. The only thing is that the employee was in a hurry.. She wrapped my flowers and threw them on the counter.. She must have been a temp or something .. The owners where there but obviously she didn't care.  Didn't say anything since I needed to get home and was not in the mood to fix someone else's problem.. Happy V Day! Saturday 4:15 pm.

1.description: This location is rather decent. No major issues stand out. Its clean, organized, kinda slow but service is adequate to the numbe of customers.

2.description: Everytime I walk in, it smells horrendous. I only go for a bag of chips or some cashews every now and then. Customer service is ok. But that smell is atrocious and needs to be dealt with.

0.description: Love this place, always very friendly, the staff remebers you by name, they dont mind when i have a cart full, and a fist full of coupons, I love them, the pharmacy staff is always very helpful!

1.description: DPE Inc - Jose -We love our Zumba shirts and we couldn't of have been any happier ! Very professional and he had patience with us going over our design order . We had an emergency order and he was able to accommodate in a timely manner! They really saved us :) very economical . Our Zumba pretty n pink event was hit and everyone loved the shirts ! We had some great reviews !!! You guys rock !! Definitely will be calling you back for more business !!! Thank you soooo much !! Zumba instructor - skyylevel maribel chavez !!!

2.description: These guys are great. Jose the main person I spoke with was more and willing to bend backwards for me in a pinch. I needed some tees done by the next day, and he delivered. I can't say this will happen every time but it did happen for me. More than satisfied and so great Jose and the team there did what it took to get me product. They even went as far as to do color changes to make the tees better looking. Which was also nice of them. I will definitely bring them business and I will go back. Everyone was nice and no hassle at all. People please support your local business. For reasons like this. It makes me happy to share. Please go check these guys out. It is definitely a good thing and job came out great. Thanks DPE much appreciated customer.

0.description: So if I could give a better rating I would, this place is the spot for custom work, I'm a up in coming designer and obviously on a budget and had to find a place that does great work for a even better price, this is the place, the guys here pay attention to detail provide exclusive apparel and work with you to bring your dream to life, from this point going I only do custom work with these guys you should too..

3.description: Receive excellent customer service from Everardo and the store manager. Can't say enough about Everardo who helped me until I had everything I needed.   Back and forth to the storage room smiling politely and friendly all the way. Hats off to them. I had a beautiful event for 50.

1.description: Went to party city today to get balloons for my daughter's 8th birthday and they were pretty much out of EVERY balloon I wanted....the staff didn't greet me and they were NOT friendly I also needed help due to the change of their store's layout NOT one associate helped me even after I stated I couldn't find any thing ..... It would be a big fat lie for me to say I will never shop at party city it just won't be this location ..... I only gave two stars because at the end of the day I compromised   and found nice balloons that will make my big girls day!

2.description: I'm seeing a trend with places in the Scottsdale shopping area...stores that were complete dumps a few years ago have really made a turn around.  I remember last time I was in Party City the place was a mess but they're cleaned up the store.  I thought it was cool that they even have personalized graduation stuff for the local high schools already made.  (Queen of Peace obviously being the best.) I'm giving 3/5 stars because the line was long with only one cashier working and their prices are kind of high.  Even though the dollar tree across the street is a dump, their party supplies are much cheaper.

0.description: my favorite stop for affordable party and holiday decorations.

4.description: This is your typical party store where you can find everything under the sun to throw a party.  Except..... they discontinued and no longer carry those big keg buckets.  How can you throw a party without one of those!?  I am very disappointed.  - 1 star-1 more star for long lines and not enough cashiers.

1.description: The Good: The ham. It's the classic honeybaked ham that I grew up with. They claim to be the original and I suspect they are. They also have good coupons online. The Bad: Driving all the way to Ford City to pick up the yummy ham.The Ugly: The side dishes. I had a coupon for 3 free "sides"  with the purchase of a ham. G-R-O-S-S!! I served them today (xmas).  Salty, fake cheese, made all our tummies hurt. Just gross. Bottom Line: Go for the ham. Avoid everything else.

0.description: In a vast wasteland of sub par food fast food options a beacon of light in the distance. Lo is it mattsons? Toysrus? No behold the glory that is the HoneyBaked Ham company. Upon entering find yourself greeted by the kindest purveyors of that cloven hooved animal which we are so pleased to put in our bellies.Well I wish for the sides and to go items were available in their lunch boxes with this sandwiches, the BBQ bacon stack a ham sandwich did me just fine.

1.description: This place is just pretty mediocre. We got a gyro, fried fish and cheese sticks. Cheese sticks were good. Fries and fish were just a soggy oily mess. Gyro was just kind of bland and greasy. Nothing was like inedible or made us sick, but it wasn't very appetizing either.

2.description: Taste great for a fast food place. The gym shoe sandwich is delicious! Try a frozen lemonade while your there! Definitely coming back soon!

0.description: This place is great for a fast food restaurant. There homemade beef and turkey burgers are amazing. If you like your burgers fat, go for a double patty. And they also use real rib eye for the Philly's,  haven't had a cheesesteak this good in along time. Definitely my new spot to eat.

Nice clean environment. Friendly staff, & respectful patrons. The snack bar is a great touch! Always professional & prompt. Ms. Hollywood is my beautician of choice she gets me in & out no matter how late I am for my appointment! She's versatile with her styles whipping up fabulous styles with weave or natural hair. I've found my new hair home.

3.description: One of the few Arybs in the Chicago area this place always gets my attention when we past by the food not that bad. The roast beef sandwiches Arby's serves is delicious and this one is no different. PS they have a drive thru.

1.description: Mouth-watering Mozz stix!It's been eons since the last time I patronized an Arby's, and I rarely eat junk food, but lately I have developed a weakness for mozzarella sticks, my fave being from White Castle. Well a craving hit & with no nearby WC, I ventured through Arby's drive-thru to gamble on their mozz stix which come in a 4 or 6 piece pack as opposed to 3, 5, or 10 at WC. It took nearly 5 min to receive my single 4 piece order. I don't qualify that as "fast" in my book, but as the woman gave me my bag she warned me to be careful because they were just made & very hot to justify my wait. She was right, these stix were piping-hot indeed & the perfect ratio of crispy breading, just enough to encase the overflowing, ooey-gooey, melty mozz cheese. (I hate when I get mozz stix that are almost all fried shell & little cheese inside). In other words, these mozz stix were worth the wait & the calorie bomb & get 5 gems (can't vouch for the rest of the food here) & were effin' good & give my fave White Castle ones a run for their money, and if I'm faced with the 2 drive-thrus side-by-side, I'm gonna be in a pickle!

2.description: Open 24 hours!  The have the best fast food curly fries, and cheese sticks.They may not be fast, but it always comes out hot and tasty!The staff has always been friendly and make sure you get what you ordered.

0.description: I love arbys. I stop eating at a ton of fast food restaurants but arbys wasn't one of them. However they discontinued the cheese and bacon potatoes triangles. Broke my heart.

4.description: I love Arby's and my companion loves tool shopping.  I think I devised the most perfect plan.  We go tool shopping at Harbor Freight and then we can get Arby's from across the street.  I must be a genius.  All went well, I got my beloved Super Roast Beef Sandwich.  My roast beef was cold and apparently the worker at the drive in window had very touchy hands.  Oh well, this won't really stop me from wanting to try this again.

28.description: Took me long enough but I finally came to terms with the facts:(1)My head is fatter than anything on God's green earth. (2)Fabio's stylist armed with the Mjolnir of shears couldn't do anything to make my hair look cool/sexy/awesome/hip/not-lame.Thus, blind to price, I chose Yehia since it's right across the street from my swinging pad. Here's the scoop: Showed up at 10:45 for my appointment, and I was greeted by a cavalcade of oddities. Reading material? Spin, N'digo, and the Lake Forest Academy Viewbook 2009. Given those choices, I obviously went with the Viewbook which is why I now know more about the competence of the girls' field hockey team at LFA than anyone (parents included) would ever care to know. Hat's off to you, ladies.My stylist? Quite mum this one was. Gave him my usual, stunning opening line about not knowing what to say when a stylist asks me how I want my hair done. Imagine...Stylist: How do you want it done?Me (bumbling): Well my first instinct is always to say, "shorter," but--ha!--you can't really cut it longer, can you?crickets...crickets...cricketsSo I guess it's time to retire that tired bit, but I'm not happy about this development. After bumbling through what to do with my absurd mop, we embarked on a twenty minute experiment in silence, awkward moments where our eyes met in the mirror and I quickly pretended to investigate the ceiling, and hair cutting. You know what struck me as terribly odd? My stylist kept borrowing tools from a comrade. Shouldn't he have his own tools? Has he not earned his stripes yet? What gives, man? Besides these oddities, Yehia did hit the mark at times: My hair doesn't look atrocious, the price was reasonable (20 bucks), and the place is right at my doorstep. I'll probably go back but it won't be with gushing enthusiasm.

1.description: The only plus to this place is that they're fast. You won't wait all day just to get in the chair or leave out. I went to Mohammed for a couple of years. He's nice and does a great job with styling layers but cuts too much hair off length wise. My hair grows fast but never progressed past nape length the entire couple of years I went to him. Had to stop going to him. If you want your hair to stay short-medium length, then he may work for you. Otherwise, I'd choose another stylist.

39.description: i've gotten my hair done here before and they did a great job for under forty bucks. i havent been back due to my schedule but i plan to pretty soon

9.description: I walked in to ask about their services and everyone seamed like they were high, the boy at the desk didn't even want to take off his ear phones when i approached him.I asked how much a QUICK trim and style would be, that's all. and he sat there and kind of laughed and said "i don't know" how do you not know how much your services are?!i then asked if they had a student discount and he laughed, finally someone else came up and i asked him "how much for a quick cut and style" no wash (i was in a rush between work & school)he said $40 which i am not able to afford as a college studenthonestly i think this place is a front, they were all sitting around acting really weird

29.description: The second time I visited, my hair was box-dyed brown.  I asked to go blond.  I chose a relatively ashy medium shade.  They foiled me, covered the rest of the hair, and then I sat.  In total, i sat FOR FOUR HOURS.  They plied me with Starbucks, funny stories, and reassuring looks, but at no point did my stylist or anyone else suggest I was in for such a long adventure.When I left the salon, my hair was a very very pretty, very very light blond.  I received wild compliments over the next couple of days.  I was very happy, and forgave the marathon.  UNTIL THE ENDS OF MY HAIR STARTED TO FALL OFF LIKE ASHES AT A BONFIRE!It's supposed to be an Aveda salon--healthier for your hair?  I had to cut some of the ends myself so I could go to my business meeting without little bits of hair all over my shoulders.  As a result, I now have stupid-looking pseudo-bangs and the back layer is still fried.My roots have grown out to the point that I need a touch-up and am at a loss as to where to go.  I'm thinking I'll have to get a bob to get rid of all the brittle/dead ends, which bums me out b/c I'd like to keep the pony-tail option through summer's end.I'm pretty bummed b/c the location, people, atmosphere, and price are right.  I just can't have my hair falling out :(

23.description: If you have CURLY hair, go to Emad.  Emad understands curly hair and knows how to cut it.He is the only stylist cutting my hair from now on.  My hair feels light and sexy after I leave Yehia.

5.description: I have been going to this location for 14 years! I may take breaks and try other things but I always come back. My stylist is Misch who is amazing and always makes you feel beautiful, if he is not available then ask for Ahmed he is so nice and very talented as well. Misch recently did color after Ahmed talked me into and and I haven't stopped getting compliments! I have never had a problem. I even get all my waxing done here. My waxing person is Val she is AMAZING! I get Brazilians, brows and lips and you cannot beat the price and precision. If you are looking for an all in one stop shop this is your place. I love everything about it!

31.description: 0 stars!My experience was awful.  It wasn't just that my hair looked awful; but the fact that everyone kept saying how straight, beautiful and lively it would look....WTF?I went to the Oak Park location.  The staff was very friendly; however, I could immediately tell that they knew NOTHING about AA hair.  Yes, the blowdryer was hot but my hair is natural and that is definitely not enough to straighten my hair.  My hair was still moist at the scalp and neckline when some really old man attempted to curl it with the old school stove curlers.  He parted a couple of big pieces and turned my hair under really tight after I told him I wanted it straight (he probably didn't understand me considering he didn't speak english).  The edges and roots were soooooo nappy and the style looked like a JCPenny doo.  This was a complete joke and wasn't worth the $45 (no tip for flat ironing my hair wet)!  Whoever said bone-straight, silky etc.  has never been to Detroit and had a real satin press and ceramic curl!Maybe it was just the location IDK, but I left pissed, $45 lighter, damp scalp, and had to go home and do my hair.Oh BTW, parking sucks!

25.description: I have been going to Yehia's for about 2 years. I have used a few of their services. I have had my hair relaxed by Mohammed who just rocks!! My hands and feet done by Burt (she is awesome!!) and my hair washed by Marcus, Mish and others. I love this place and will go back for more!!

12.description: It is hard to find a good stylist that does a good job on your hair AND knows what they are talking about. I have natural hair and when I go to the hood to get my hair done it looks great but they can't tell me how to take care of it. When I get someone downtown that can give me great ways of keeping my hair healthy, they unfortunately can't get my hair the way I want it (my roots straight as well). Emad was able to do both, provide advice on how to manage and treat my hair AND does a great job. This is the recipe to make an excellent stylist!

37.description: I've had the best and the worst here. The best: have Jessica do your eyebrows and any waxing needs! My natural brows look like I am the love child of Bert and Ernie and Jessica makes them look fantastic--and only for $12! So, definitely get her! As far as other stuff goes, I got my hair done here for my headshots and they curled it into Shirley Temple curls! Depending on the hairstylist, there can be language barriers (I told my guy I wanted it straight and nice big, soft curls at the bottom. He said he totally understood but made me look like a Texas beauty queen). I also got an overpriced manicure there and it was mediocre. Anyway, moral of the story: Jessica is the best person EVER for waxing (she also does a bunch of skin care stuff--fantastic)! Go to Yehia for her, but steer clear for other stuff.

21.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

16.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

17.description: If you have natural hair please avoid..Or you will regret it!!  Worst experience ever!

10.description: Mish has done my hair many times.  I  have very short natural hair that I wear blow-dried.  He takes good care of my hair and is excellent with cutting and styling.  I would recommend him for long or short hair and for either natural or chemically treated hair.

11.description: Mish did an awesome job although I have to say I found the price a bit high in comparison to other salons who have provided the same service. I'm natural and very very curly so my hair won't stay straight very long so paying nearly $100 seemed ridiculous to me. However, the service was quick, the salon was clean, and the music was jamming. I may go back one day but not too soon.

26.description: This is what I get for being spontaneous and stubborn, and insisting on getting a haircut even when my usual, beloved Daniella's wasn't open.  I'd walked by this place a few times, and because I never looked closely and only saw a bunch of Aveda ads, thought it was an Aveda salon.My hair was getting way too long, so I just wanted it shortened to shoulder-length, with some layers. A reasonable request, I thought, and not too complicated. Who could mess this up?Yehia can. Apparently, "shoulder length with layers" to my stylist meant "a short bob with shoulder length pieces."  WHAT?  He chopped away so fast that I didn't even realize how short he was cutting, and by then it was too late to salvage my hair.  My head has split personality disorder now - half of it wants to be a bob/pixie cut, and half of it is a terrible shoulder-length trim. It kind of looks like a longer, punk-rock mullet. I didn't even know what to say at the end. "You fucked up my hair"? "This looks terrible, I'm not paying"?  Instead, I just got out of there as fast as I could.  When I came home, my husband called me "Poof Head."Thank god it's hat season.

27.description: Yehia is my eyebrow waxing go-to in a pinch. There are better salons out there, but when I can't get into anywhere else or happen to be in the area, it's where I go. Not the best, but it'll do.Shaping is $15, cleanup is $12. Just make sure when you go, they know which you need and they don't try to convince you otherwise.

35.description: If there was a zero star rating, i would give it to this salon.l rang in to make an appointment to have a shampoo wash. l made sure the receptionist understood that l wanted a stylist who knew how to take care of black hair and she recommended a stylist named Mohammed. And so, appointment made, i got in my car,paid $10 to park in a lot closeby, got in the salon,the receptionist asked me to sit and wait,  l waited for about 5 to 10mins and decided to ask a random stylist who and where Mohammeds station was, he heard me ask and turned around, he then signed to me to come to him(l thought that was rude,although he was working on a client, l still thought he could have been courteous),he asked me what l wanted to do and l told him a shampoo wash, and he just carried on with his client and said he does not style black hair, speaking under his breath and not even looking at me like l wasn't there, and he then just pointed to another stylists and said ask her if she'll take you on. What an ........... At this point l was boiling.l walked over to the other stylist knowing there will be a very small chance that she could fit me in, asked her and she said no she could not .And so i stormed out of there.That was my first time and definitely my last time.Could not believe l had wasted my precious time driving all the way there, paid for parking and then to be spoken to so unprofessionally by this uncouth stylist, was to say the least, deplorable.What you need is professional etiquette.Spend a day in Van cleef on Huron and clean your act.

8.description: Just got my hair done here last Saturday. I made an appointment to get my hair dyed and styled, before I went back home for spring break. Unfortunately, I am completely disappointed with my results! When I called to make my appointment I made  sure the receptionist new that I was coming in to get my hair ombré to a grayish blue color! She set me up with a guy named Mish , and when I arrived and showed him the picture, he told me he would have to reschedule me! I couldn't be rescheduled b/c I needed my hair done that day! I had a flight the next mourning!  Long story short, he took me in , and I got a completely different hair color than I expected. I was near tears when I left the salon. I hated the color or colors!!!! My hair is pink orange purple and just Ughhhh!! I now have Multi  colored hair b/c he failed to evenly distribute the dye throughout my hair! I honestly can't express how upset I am, and I paid 130$ for the worst dye job of my life! DO NOT GO HERE TO GET YOUR HAIR DYED!!!!!

0.description: I am a Yehia's fan. I've been going to the one in the suburbs since I was in high school. I was very skeptical about Emad doing my hair since he was using the ceramics, but it turned out Emad did a great job doing my hair. My hair stayed flat and straighten. I have thick hair as you can see in my profile picture and a lot of hair. Hair tip: Remember ladies, It's all about the blow drying technique. If your hair isn't blow dried properly expect a hair fail. Your hair will puff up in 5 minutes.

38.description: Don't like the place. It's too creepy.

20.description: My experience with the stylist Marketia has been professional, courtesy, and a great stylist My hair has never looked so good.  My biggest concern, or should I say gripe is the shampoo assistant Brandy. I had an appointment last week that included getting my hair colored. I informed Brandy twice that I wanted a dark brown color and she said okay.  I sat and waited about ten minutes until she got everything together.  Brandy then proceeded to put a white product on my hair that I was not familiar with, so I asked her what is was, she stated that she didn't know. I then informed her that the product smells like a chemical and asked what chemical was she putting in my hair? She stated that she was not putting a chemical in my hair, I told her I could smell the sulfur and peroxide and she was indeed putting a chemical in my hair.  Brandy responded by saying she didn't know anything and was just doing what she was told. Really!?  I was shocked and very concerned that one of two things was going on (1) Brandy knew what the product was and just refused to answer my questions or (2) she didn't know what the product was and was doing as she was instructed.  Either way that's bad customer service, if you ask me.  This establishment or any other consumer establishment is based on relationships, honesty and integrity. If those characteristics are lacking then your business will suffer. So, after the chemical was put in (developer) she put in the color. I asked her was the color dark brown and she said yes. I informed her that it appeared to be black and she stated it was a very dark brown.  To make a long story short, I asked her three times about the color of my hair and when she was blow-drying it, told her she colored my hair black and she repeatedly denied that she colored it black. Brandy colored my hair black even though I did not want my hair black, then she insulted my intelligence by lying about the chemical and color.  I do not want to be bothered with someone like that.  I remained calm, professional and courteous, and even tipped her $5.00, but I don't plan on having her in my head ever again.   Hopefully, the shop as more than one assistant! Just because I don't possess a cosmetologist license doesn't make me a fool.  In fact, I have too much education, too many degrees to let someone make me loose my temper because they are incapable of telling the truth!

19.description: Yehia is my eyebrow waxing go-to in a pinch. There are better salons out there, but when I can't get into anywhere else or happen to be in the area, it's where I go. Not the best, but it'll do.Shaping is $15, cleanup is $12. Just make sure when you go, they know which you need and they don't try to convince you otherwise.

33.description: I had a bad initial experience with the service there. Its not that they are not friendly, its that I had a photoshoot and made a special appointment and the hairdresser went on a trip and he didn't call to cancel with me until I called him. So luckily enough, I found another hairdresser the same day.Next, I returned because I know they can blow my hair dry afterwards. I asked the hairdresser to return my hair to its dark color and brought photos. He just brought out a mix and got to work. It didn't return to my color so he had to explain AFTER THE WORK was done that he was apparently acting in my best interest. What made it worse, I don't think he had a good eye for what brown would best suit my skin color- it looked like a wig. A girl even asked me, "Is that yours???"  Anyway, I returned upset and at no charge I was handed around the room for color, dry and then, the owner himself took the liberty of layering my hair! Do you know how long my hair takes to grow??? My holiday, my friends said my hair was wrecked. Weak from color, a cut that didn't suit my curly hair and i just had to wear it back everywhere. I'm still trying to moisturize what's left. But come on!!! The cut was aweful but one feels so bad because they are so darn nice while they are wrecking your life. You just go home and cry but while saying goodbye, you think they deserve a tip. Here is a tip: Go for friends and not for your hair!If anyone knows a hairdressing place that with a customer service strategy that listens, educates and asks permission about what they plan to do- and who actually knows black, mixed, latin hair- I would be happy to hear from them. Yehia's is a friendly place but they will smile and promise you donuts while coloring your hair an unmatching color and cutting the rest off giving you no notice at all.  Their new motto should be: Go for friends, not for hair.

2.description: I went to Yehia last week and Ahmed did an amazing job with my hair. I needed a lot since my sew in had to be taken out. He took it out and made suggestions and washed and trimmed my hair. I appreciated that he showed me how much he was cutting. Great service at a fair price.  This was my first time there but I'll definitely be back!

34.description: yehia is a business that i've been able to count on for the past 16yrs. i've been to a number of locations over the years. this is my fave. being black and having natural hair isn't a crime here...if you want to wear it straight they won't try to pressure you into chemically altering it. i dont wear my hair straight ALL the time, but i know that when i do i can count on it to be gorgeous if i go here. i like the stylist ayemen...i highly recommend him and the shop in general. i've never had to wait when i go in and have never been displeased. check em out it won't break your pocket book either. my only criticism is they are SERIOUS about the blow dry...a little too serious...they can some times make it so straight that if you like to go back and forth from curly to straight...that may be hard b/c the "straightness" often stays after you wash...

32.description: If you want bone straight hair this is your place.  They charge $45-55 for blow dry, press and curl.  They get you in and out really fast.  I will warn you though they use A LOT of heat on your hair to achieve the silky bone straight hair you desire.  If you go too often your hair will become very dry and brittle over time and you may need to chop it all off and start growing it all over again.  Oh and if you get your hair colored here and you have very dark hair... and you want lighter hair. They will use a bleach to get the results you want but I don't think it's too healthy. Overall, my recommendation is if you have an event or you can't get an appointment with your regular stylist then go here.  But I wouldn't make this a regular place...your hair will not stay healthy here.

18.description: It's the best place in town for a blowdry. I have very difficult curly hair and Emad works his magic every time I go there! If you want an amazing blow dry that last for few days ask for Emad.

13.description: From beginning to end, this was a wonderful experience. I was greeted when I walked in the door and the guy asked who was my normal stylist. I told him it was my first time there. Right away, he told me to sit in the seat to get my hair washed. The woman was very respectfully the whole time asking me was the water too hot or cold. She even apologized to the fullest when a "splash" of water hit my eyes. Next, I was put under the steamer. I chatted with hair washer and asked what she would recommend I get since our hair was the same length. She suggested a few styles and I chose one. She offered me some water and I politely declined. I was handed off to a guy who blow dryed my hair. Didn't take long but it hurt a little if the heat was on too long. He offered me water as well. I still declined. Finally, my stylist comes over and introduces himself as Mish. He wanted to know where I usually get my hair done. I told him I wanted to try some new and convenient to get to. He finished blow drying my hair. He asked whether I wanted a lot of volume or not. When I say I felt like a princess afterwards that's an understatement. My hair was so bouncy and shiny. I thanked him for his service and gave him a tip. I will definitely go to Yehias again. I love the fast and efficient service provided. Thank you.

4.description: By the look of the place, it's nothing special.  Not a high quality spa. It's not classy or polished. My rating is purely based on their work.  They do a great job with hair.  I have had a mani, pedi, hair and eyebrows done here.  They are very nice and I've been going here for probably 10 years now.  I drive an hour just to get my hair done.  Love it and have recommended a million people!!!!

24.description: If I could, I would give this place 0 stars. The walls were dirty and there were old plastic carts (the ones used when hair is colored) haphazardly left with old dried out dye against the wall at the back of the shop.  The colorist barely spoke to me, started the highlights an inch away from my roots and because he didn't check whether or not my hair had previously been colored, managed to turn it orange.The stylist interpreted a "trim" as "please chop 4 inches off half my hair and leave the underneath hair long". This made my hair look like 2 different styles on one head, an ear length bob and then a longer style underneath.  By the time I realized what was going on it was too late as the damage had already been done. When the hair was being dried I felt like crying, the highlights were awful and so thick that I looked like a zebra, and the cut was akin to a mullet. While I was there another woman getting her hair dyed started yelling that her head was burning.Needless to say I ran away from this place and will never go there again.

6.description: I live a few blocks away. Emad cut my hair like an artist. I was extremely happy. Have received nothing but compliments. My only criticism is the shop is dirty. It needs a good cleaning. The staff is very friendly. I am going to try a mani pedi next time.

22.description: I always go to Albert!!! He is my stylist and he is fabulous, enough said!!!!! He does all types of hair and has great conversation. He will not let you leave the shop until your hair is up to the level of perfection he holds himself too! I also go here to get my Brazilians done by Valerie and she is amazing, her expertise and technique is amazing! I have been going here for the past 3 years...never disappointed!!!

15.description: I absolutely love how Elliott styles my hair! He is also a phenomenal colorist.

40.description: This is the "new" Yehia - i.e. a sexist excuse to make men stop going to the old Yehia, which still maintains a predominantly female clientele.  The barbers are nice... but freakishly religious.  Two Orthodox "Passion of the Christ" loving Christians work here.  I guess that's tolerable for a nice $15 haircut and shave in the loop.

7.description: When I first walked into Yehia my hair had become damaged as a result of me wearing weave.  I only had a limited time to get everything taken care of, because I had work later.  Not only did they take down my extensions, but they were able to style me as well, all before I needed to leave for work.  Their deep conditioner and other products make it a fantastic experience.  Now I'm a regular customer and I go to Emad because in my opinion he's the best. Emad is very attentive of his clients and is meticulous in his work.  If you're thinking to go make sure you request him, you won't be disappointed!

36.description: I will never patronize this place again. They use ENTIRELY too much heat and actually severely damaged my natural hair. They are not well-versed in dealing with all the different types of textures of African-American hair. My hair is fine and doesn't need that much heat and I told the stylist this repeatedly. Still, my hair was literally fried. It smelled like smoke and was so damaged that I got double my refund back. Yehia himself had to take care of it. I really do not recommend this place for any African-American woman.

30.description: My experience here was awful.  I wanted to get my hair colored black and just a wash and blow cut after that.  I walked in and once I checked in and put on a robe, I was lost.  No one came up to me so I just went over to my sister who was getting her hair pressed while I waited for someone to come up to me.  Finally someone approached me and asked what I wanted done.  I told him I wanted my hair colored black and he was like, "Really?  Don't you think that's too dark?"  I'm black woman with medium dark complexion.  How would it be too dark??  Well, he ended up talking me out of it and just dying it a dark brown color.  So another guy came up to me and colored my hair and toward the end got color on my blouse!!  A big glob fell on the collar of my blouse and yes, they were concerned and he tried to get it out but it was to no avail.  I could tell he wasn't that comfortable dying hair.  The only competent person was the person who washed my hair.  Once I got out of the chair the first guy came back and and finished styling my hair.  He was saying how dark it was and how good it looked.  Of course it looks dark!  It's still wet!!  So he's drying my hair and putting the dryer so close to my scalp he was practically burning me.  When he was going over my hair with the flat iron, he was curling his hand under and spritzing hair spray.  I asked him not to curl it under because I didn't want to look like a 12 year old girl.  And I asked for no hair spray because I wasn't going to be washing my hair the next day.  I have African-American hair and I only wash it about once a week.  So he did it several more times after I asked him not to, so pretty much the damage was done.  I looked like I had a bowl cut.  And he takes me to the mirror to show me how dark it is, but it still looks brown to me, the same color it was when I walked in.  So pretty much I paid for color where there was no difference and to look like a little girl.  And my sister has natural hair and all they did to straighten it was to blow it dry with a hair dryer.  You need more than that...at least a pressing comb.  And come to find out, Yehia was the one styling my hair.  He never made any introduction and there was no communication while he was doing my hair.  If you're the owner or the manager of a place, at at least be personable and make your clients feel welcome.  I'll definitely never go back and I advise everyone out there not to go either.

3.description: I am due for a hair cut and unfortunately it's too expensive for me to fly from Toronto just to get a hair cut :-).  I decided to give this salon a chance based on reviews and I was happy with the results.  They applied a deep conditioner that made my hair smooth and soft.  Mish was the stylist who cut my hair and he did a great job!
