He could have done a quick trim but took the time to let me know that more of my ends needed to be trimmed so my curls look better.  The overall experience was nice and would recommend this salon to anyone.  From what I observed they are capable of working with all types of hair which means they are talented.  I'm in Chicago often and I will be back soon! This place is worth a try if you're looking for a quality salon with friendly staff and affordable prices!

14.description: I visited Yehia almost a week ago. My hair still looks GREAT! Mish did an excellent job. His assistant's were kind, friendly, understanding, and they listen to your concerns and questions regarding your hair. 5 stars goes to his team of assistants as well. Great customer service. He clipped my ends perfectly. Not too much & not too little - still have the length I desired plus my hair looks healthy. It's JUST RIGHT! I love Mish. My next hair appointment will be with him that's for certain. I must add I watch other clients leave from their stylists' chair very pleased & happy. I believe besides just Mish there is salon full of qualified individuals that know how to make their clients leave feeling replenished and recharged.

3.description: People don't go there! My husband and i went there for a dinner buffet, got a food poising from the fish, I didn't eat the fish and I was fine! But he got huge poising, high fever and his whole body is full of red spot!! We have to go to hospital right away!! DON't go!!!!

1.description: This place is pretty good. Some of the food here isn't that bad at all but it always seems pretty duty.

0.description: How much do you regular eat at MacDonald's ????????????????I paid $6.30 after tax eatting at this buffet place.Food is a little salty. place is a little greasy. But Judge for yourself.They accept take out too.

2.description: I was once a fan of this place many years ago, in fact we were regulars and we were one of the first families to go there when it opened I believe in 1997, but that was then and this is now. Not the cleanest of Buffets any longer. I mean, you have kids as young as 3 serving themselves and putting food back (umm that's where I draw the line). I just don't get how parents let their kids run amuck inside an establishment anyway. Just doesn't make sense. Although it has been "remodeled" it really doesn't matter. If the food is brought out in little heaps and they wait till people are scraping the containers than I think we have a problem Houston! I don't really care for the Asia Buffet any longer, but once in a while, I do pass by to see if anything has changed, and not to my surprise, it hasn't.

5.description: always full of a lot of families & older people

6.description: Update! Today my companion and I were joined by an uninvited guest--a COCKROACH crawled along the wall toward our table. Needless to say, we left quickly--roaches out in broad daylight indicate a huge problem with pest control.  Worse, we notified the cashier, who just shrugged and said "Sorry." Obviously we were not the first people to have this appetite-killing experience. I can no longer recommend this restaurant. Too bad.Update to the update:I let the restaurant know that I posted the above caveat, and the manager called me right away, apologizing profusely.  She explained that the place was just treated for pests and that sometimes, immediately after insecticide is applied, roaches emerge from their hiding places. I know that's true, according to my friends in the pest control business. She also offered to comp my friend and me lunches on our next visit. I doubt I will be returning, because I don't think I will ever be able to eat without worrying about their "problem," and maybe I should have insisted on a refund. But I think she was sincerely upset and tried to make restitution, which is what counts. I guess the lesson for the manager is that people can and will tell others about their experiences, and it will reflect, for better or worse, on their business. Therefore, it's important to train employees to handle this sort of complaint. And the lesson for me is, the next time something like this happens--go to the manager/owner on site ASAP and politely explain the problem. The cashier's reaction was almost as off-putting as the actual roach.  Yech.

7.description: My limited time working at the new office in sunny Scottsdale (not AZ) has proven a couple of things.1) Suburbia has spilled back into this southwestern strip of the city along Cicero Ave. with all of the chain stores and strip malls leading all the way down to Southwest Highway.2) The people in the area are very nice in general.3) If you are looking for buffet heaven away from the bright lights of Vegas, you can't do much better than Scottsdale.Now I haven't tried any other buffets other than this one (there are seemingly about 10 of them in this small area), but if the others are nearly as good, then my preconceived notions about poor quality of food at buffets here in Chicago should be thrown out the door.Here you will get a very American version of Chinese food, along with a hodge-podge of other American buffet staples like mac 'n cheese, chicken fingers, pizza and so forth.The thing about this place is that their dishes are consistently pretty good!  Considering the cost involved (about $8 for lunch) and that they offer a lot of different kinds of seafood, I think it is a great deal.The prawns are a great deal in themselves.  If you like tearing into the whole-bodied prawns and can't get enough of them- come here.  For $8 you can gorge yourself on as many as you can handle!

8.description: Oh boy....here I am writing a review for an Asian buffet....located in a suburban mall....The end of the world is fast approaching.That's a FACT.So does this place really deserve 4 stars?!? Not quite. But I want to push it up because really this little hole in the wall (ok, it's a figure of speech - it's actually quite big) does a pretty good job in its category. So....oomph.....move a little bit......up......a bit on the left....THERE.Here you go. 4 stars!!After hearing rave reviews about it from someone (clue: we share the same address) I decided that I wanted to give it a try, just to say that I had had lunch in Scottsdale. So after a few stops in a couple of glorious furniture stores, losing my phone, finding it at a store counter and calming my racing heart - we pushed the door, paid the $7.95, chose a table and started working our way.Traditional fare but a few things worth mentioning:- wonton soup- mussels in black bean sauce- onion prawns - gigantic and whole (yep, with the head. Love tearing them apart!) and most of all, perfectly cooked. A small miracle in a buffet!- crab legs- salmon on the plank (not very Chinese, sure, but still delicious)- steamed asparagus- octopus with chili peppersProbably not worth all the way down there but if you find yourself around for whatever reason (and I am sorry for you, really), a nice little spot to stop by.

9.description: I ate here about a week ago. It wasn't that bad. I don't feel it was worth 10.00. The place was very  clean.  The food wasn't that bad. I had sushi it was pretty good! All you can eat sushi! Yummy. I would visit it again, but only for lunch. It was cheaper!

10.description: This place was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at near Midway Airport.  That's the only reason I went.  All in all, you would be better off starving than spending $10.50 eating at this place.  It's no different from the millions of other Asian buffets; probably worse...

4.description: all the Chinese buffets in the area all have one thing in common....The quality of food is diminished. Was a fan of this place for years, but the last two times have found low food temperature and old food on the line. Complained to the cook, couldn't understand me but brought me fresh  hot crab Rangoon. Just sad how prices go up, but quality goes down.

0.description: Food came 2 hours later, and was ice cold.. will try again and see if it was just a bad day

58.description: Vito and Nicks pizza is amazing. I have been going there since I was a small child. Nothing like their pizza. We have had plenty of family gatherings here. Service is always pretty bad, but the pizza is great. You just don't go when you're pressed for time or really hungry because it always takes forever (because the servers are so slow, and kinda rude). My dad always says, you just have to expect the servers to be slow and rude, then you're not disappointed. As an adult I still come here, but would come more often if they made their servers be more on top of their game. And nicer! Also, this would mean people getting in and out faster, instead of being there for hours, which would make them more money! Btw, they're cash only.

56.description: Not sure of where I heard about this place, but it was definitely worth the trip.  I had it bookmarked on my phone and we really wanted some good Chicago Deep Dish pizza.  The wife gave me a look when we realized that it wasn't Deep Dish, but we gave it a try anyways.  The best thing I remember is right before we were half way done (that 12" is big) is the wife saying "I'm impressed"...which isn't easy for a true New Yorker...We had the Vito & Nick's Specialty pizza...highly recommend this place

29.description: Paid another visit to Vito & Nick's and it was even better the second time around! This time my boyfriend and I came in a little after lunch on a Monday and it wasn't as busy as our first visit. I thought that this visit was definitely a lot more enjoyable. It wasn't as crowded and loud, we definitely got to see this place in a completely different light and we liked it! Same server as before and she was definitely a pleasure! And as before, the service was pretty impeccable! There were customers at the bar, and 3 - 4 other tables, it was like we had the place to ourselves and it was nice! Pizza is still pretty on point! My boyfriend and I like to order our own Large Pizza's, he's a meat lover and I'm a Veggie hugger. This time around we ordered Mozzarella Sticks and French Fries while we waited for our pizza. It wasn't long for our appetizers to hit the table and just as we finished those our pizza was came out one after the other.Pizza was definitely on point, just how I remembered it, and plenty to take home!I should also mention, the pizza is pretty amazing as leftovers Hot or Cold! YUM!

42.description: I love my south-side institutions but this place just doesn't do it for me.  I have never understood the hype surrounding it, it's definitely a dive that makes pizza and has crazy people working there. If that's all it takes in someone's book to be awesome than this place is the bee's knee.  The pizza has good potential but the crust has always been raw flour tasting and under-cooked.  I would take Rosangela's over this place any day of the week.

23.description: OMG! We traveled so ridiculously far to go here and let me just say it was worth all the hassle. I can't stop thinking about that crunchy, crispy pizza. It was so delicious. The staff was attentive, but I promise the pizza is worth the journey there. Just don't forget they are cash only restaurant.

47.description: Chicago's best thin crust pizza, reading the reviews it's very clear that this is the place, has been on many lists as one of Chicago's best pizza places. Going over the Yelp reviews on BEST PIZZA in Chicago, I find the ratings inaccurate and misleading. Only two locations south of I-55 made the top 100, Vito & Nick's is 136. Sorry Yelp, Chicago is one of the greatest cities in the world for pizza, you need to come up with a better way of rating pizza places here.

8.description: Well after months of wanting to visit this establishment, I was sorely disappointed.  The only reasons they got the two stars was for the cracker crust.  Yes, it is thin, yes it is crisp, and yes it does stand up to all the toppings without folding in a mess of sauce and toppings. BUT no the service was horrible.  Took 20 minutes for the menu.  Then took another 20 minutes for the ONLY waitress there to take our order and then ANOTHER HOUR for our pizza.  It was good, but not worth the wait, the staff, the dirty tables and to top it off, when we got out bill the pizza price was three dollars higher than the menu price, which respectfully said in fine print "prices subject to change without notice".  In other words, we can do what we want but we do not want to have our menus reprinted with the correct information.  The topping on the cake was we asked for a box to take the rest home only to have our pizza wisked out from under us and returned in a BAG, seriously one piece on top of the other just the way it should be RIGHT??!?!!!I remember a family place near Midway years ago Santucci's on Cicero and 62nd I think.  Now that was pizza and service.  Really miss them.  But from now on--this is a pass.  If the sign says open for business, they should be ready to serve their customers.  It was 2 in the afternoon so it was not a mad rush!!

31.description: Well it appears if you're not from around the area you get served last.  We are here on business and were craving Chicago Pizza.  This place had high ratings so we gave it a go.  We sat down and first had to wait about 1/2 hour to get the waitress to our table.  Then at least three other tables sat down a long time after we did.  They all received their pizza before we did and the waitress tried to tell us they ordered before us.We ordered their house special pizza and it was just a pizza.  Perhaps it's a local thing, but I dislike it a great deal when they cut the pizza into appetizer size squares.  It is a pain and a mess to eat!  Sad news I could get this quality pizza in California and that is not a good thing.Last issue it is a cash only establishment.

34.description: I saw this place on Chicago's best and decided to try it out. I order the "famous" beef pizza, it was not what I expected. Not the best pizza in town there are better places. Cash only sucks its 2015 everyone uses plastic.

16.description: I checked out this spot after I saw it featured on the food network. The pizza was good the sauce wasn't too spicy and settled great. I will order here again. The chicken zingers were good and I'd like to try more appetizers. The overall cost is cheap. Bring cash when you visit.no cards accepted

13.description: I'm a sucker for family-owned, neighborhood establishments.  While Vito & Nick's has been on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and is on numerous "best of" lists, it still retains the feeling of the neighborhood pizza joint.  When you see pictures of the original owners and their wives--resplendent in their 40's-era tuxes and wedding dresses--it feels like something of legitimate interest to the patrons, not kitsch or hipster atmospherics.  To put it simply, this place keeps it real.  If you don't believe me, ask "Lee" the lady holding court at one of the tables who chats up nearly every customer who walks by--and finds out your story if she doesn't know you--while eating Frango mints!  She was a waitress there for something like 50 years and is pure Chicago.  If her accent doesn't make you smile, nothing will.The ambience is nothing fancy--it could be the 60's inside--but it isn't obviously trying to evoke anything.   There is Old Style on tap (what else are you going to drink)We had the Special--which is basically an everything pizza and the Italian beef.  The Special was good--the ingredients were pretty quality.  What really makes it is that the crust is quite nice.  It is crunchy like a cracker--not really what I'm used to, but I appreciate its simplicity.  The Italian beef was amazing.  The contrast between the rich beef and the plain cracker crust was entrancing with every bite.  I could eat that all day.   I totally fell in love with this place and will certainly be back.   I hope to see Aunt Lee when I go!

11.description: I saw this place on a list of America's top pizzerias and I heard it was featured on DDD, so I was extremely excited to try this out. One of my coworkers spoke very highly of this place, so we made the 40 minute trek from Hyde Park (DURING TRAFFIC!) to try this place out. I must admit that my expectations for this place were really really high. I mean Guy Fieri liked it! I ordered their house special - peppers, onion, and sausage (it's the house special, so shouldn't it be extra special?), and it was pretty good. The crust was phenomenal, very crispy, and almost like a cracker.The sausage was not my favorite however. My friends got the sliced beef with hot giardinera, and they seemed to enjoy it.As much as I enjoyed it, I don't think it was worth the long drive. If you happen to be in the neighborhood, you should definitely stop by here.

39.description: Best pizza in the world!!!! Nuff said... I've been eating this pizza for over 50 years, since their original location. Cash only, yes, slow service, yes, but it's a fantastic pizza.

37.description: The service and prices here are amazing.  Cold beer, attentive staff.  First class all the way.  The pizza is OK.  Not the best you'll have, but far from the worst.

0.description: If you want to travel in time back to the 70s take a trip to Vito and Nick's.The original location has carpet on the walls, dim lighting, and limited glassware.  (But no need to worry, they have plastic glasses as backup.) They are still a cash only establishment.The pizza crust is cracker thin and the sausage is legendary.  It's not your typical thick Chicago pizza.  If you're in the mood for a classic south side staple stop by Vito and Nicks and don't forget your cash.

38.description: Burnt pizza. Pick up. Early arrival.  Brought home. Called back and complained. Business didn't care. Gave some B.S.  excuse.   40+ years of customer business. Didn't offer any compensation. Talked to management without resolution .  Called back again....talked to another manager,  said we could drive back to get another pizza,  30 min round trip, instead of a free delivery. Will never order from this location again. Terrible management.  Rude service.  I give this place no stars whatsoever.

51.description: Wow! I thought I was going to have a great pizza experience,... Was I ever wrong. I had to get our table water. Then they where under staffed at lunch time. So I had to order my beer at the bar. The waitress never came by to ask my friends if they wanted something to drink( cause they are black) I am white so she only directed any conversation towards me. I wasn't paying for the meal my two black girlfriends where!!!!  You all white pre-judgmental jerks are an embarrassment . And the food was BAD 2nd worst tasting and constructed pizza I have ever had. I have been around the US eating food. This wasn't worth it at all. Nasty pizza! And my water cup still had soda stuck to the sides, you all can keep you dump pizza join to yourself.

27.description: Went there last night with some friends.Haven't been there in 30 years.Was almost like time stood still.Pizza was outstanding,service was a little slow but understandable...the place was packed.if you haven't been there,you need to go.This is truly a Chicago neighborhood place,forget about downtown go here.You won't be disappointed.

32.description: Called to order a pizza website says they close at 1am without letting me speak the person who answered just blurts out they are done for the night. It was only 11:45 pm and I was picking up my order

54.description: Pizza is good but a bit pricey. Jalapeño poppers are to die for! Good food but my waitress was less than flattering. She sat down at a table and ate pizza while my mother and I were waiting for a box and bill... even stared at her.. still no movement. Awkward.  And she lied to me about the beers they had because the woman behind me ordered the stella cidre, which is specifically what I asked for.. but I'd definitely say take ur yummy food togo.

48.description: When it comes to THIN crust pizza, this place does not disapoint!  I have both dined in and carried out.  I am an all about the crust kinda gal! The crispier the better.  This place definitely served that up!  The first time I came here I dined in, it wasn't super busy, but we did wait quite a bit for our pizza and I will mention that the lady who took care of us was a bit on the rude side.  She seemed familiar will many of the regulars and was very friendly with them, us on the other hand, not so much.  Either way...it didn't change the fact that the pizza was pretty damn good. Since the first time we dined in, I've carried out many times and the pizza is always consistantly good.

44.description: This pizza is amazing! Service is always good and so is the food. Good pizza, people and drinks!

24.description: Very simple review:  Cheese and Sausage pizza is perfect.  I love the thin crispy crust. I enjoy both dining in and taking out.  I have yet to be disappointed.

7.description: First visit to Vito and Nick's Pizzeria on 8433 S. Pulaski. They looked very good when featured on the Food Network . Ordered pizza to go. It was burnt. We called to lodge concern and was told no way was it burnt. We will not return.  The one star rating is being generous.

49.description: Good pizza, sucks it only takes cash...I don't go there often because of that.

40.description: We FINALLY made it after months of wanting to try the "number one pizza in chicago"!!! We were not disappointed!! The place was packed. I mean packed!! The hostess came to take our name and said the wait was around 20 minutes or so. We agreed to wait and went to stand in the front but then the bartender, Ann Marie, invited us to take a seat at the bar. She insured us that it wouldn't take so long but we were welcome to have a drink or appetizer at the bar. She also offerred to serve us our pizza right away if we would rather eat at the bar. My husband and I obliged and she seemed genuinely happy to take care of us!! Made us feel right at home and answered our 20 questions about the pizza without making us feel stupid or like we were wasting her time. All this while she ran up and down the bar to serve all the other customers and smiled through the whole ordeal. Our pizza was great, the beer was cold, but the service is why we will return!!

53.description: This kinda looks like a hole in the wall dinky old place to me upon walking in. You're greeted and then you sit where you want. Our waitress was nice and kinda explained the menu to us while we waited.What we ordered:Breaded Mushrooms: GoodWing Zings: Delish, It comes w/ bbq sauce (I'm from KC so this bbq sauce just wasn't, and some kinda sour cream/ranch dip thing that was good!)Mozzarella sticks: Good!Pepperoni, Cheese, Sausage & Mushroom, and Italian Beef Pizza!! all goodBut my favorite was the Italian Beef Pizza, I don't even know how to explain what it taste like but its so good, their crust is crispy and crunchy when you bite into it and the sauce is not over powering! Just what we needed the first night in Chicago!

30.description: Service sucks and probably the pizza too

46.description: Been visiting them for many years. Cash only and the thin crust pizza is awesome. I always burn the roof of my mouth from the first piece.

1.description: Paid another visit to Vito & Nick's and it was even better the second time around! This time my boyfriend and I came in a little after lunch on a Monday and it wasn't as busy as our first visit. I thought that this visit was definitely a lot more enjoyable. It wasn't as crowded and loud, we definitely got to see this place in a completely different light and we liked it! Same server as before and she was definitely a pleasure! And as before, the service was pretty impeccable! There were customers at the bar, and 3 - 4 other tables, it was like we had the place to ourselves and it was nice! Pizza is still pretty on point! My boyfriend and I like to order our own Large Pizza's, he's a meat lover and I'm a Veggie hugger. This time around we ordered Mozzarella Sticks and French Fries while we waited for our pizza. It wasn't long for our appetizers to hit the table and just as we finished those our pizza was came out one after the other.Pizza was definitely on point, just how I remembered it, and plenty to take home!I should also mention, the pizza is pretty amazing as leftovers Hot or Cold! YUM!

55.description: vito and nick IS THE BEST PIZZA IN CHICAGO..love love this place. there pizza has not changed since I was a kid.its always great !!!

9.description: This kinda looks like a hole in the wall dinky old place to me upon walking in. You're greeted and then you sit where you want. Our waitress was nice and kinda explained the menu to us while we waited.What we ordered:Breaded Mushrooms: GoodWing Zings: Delish, It comes w/ bbq sauce (I'm from KC so this bbq sauce just wasn't, and some kinda sour cream/ranch dip thing that was good!)Mozzarella sticks: Good!Pepperoni, Cheese, Sausage & Mushroom, and Italian Beef Pizza!! all goodBut my favorite was the Italian Beef Pizza, I don't even know how to explain what it taste like but its so good, their crust is crispy and crunchy when you bite into it and the sauce is not over powering! Just what we needed the first night in Chicago!

26.description: Self seating, cash only establishment ...pizza was just ok not worth an hour and a half wait. Waitress /bartender was clearly over worked and very apologetic but I value my time especially on Christmas Eve. Needless to say this was my first and last time eating at Vito and nicks

25.description: The pizza is to die for, prompt friendly service too. Just remember to bring cash, I had to run across the street to the atm.

12.description: First visit to Vito & Nick's and I'm a fan for life. Love the cracker-thin crust. We tried the House special, the Italian beef and the special Egg pizza with crispy pepperoni.  The Italian beef was our favorite. Great service. Cold pitchers of Old Style. And nostalgic, family atmosphere. What's not to love? And Rose is fantastic. Made us feel right at home. If only we had a Vito & Nick's in Kansas City ...

59.description: I won't waste any time describing the ambiance because let's be honest, this place is all about the food. While there we had the calamari and a meat thin crust pizza. The calamari was a bit bland and lacked any real flavor. Quite disappointing. And the pizza was honestly just ok. It came out hot and fresh, but it just lacked any distinct character. You could replicate this pizza at any decent pizza restaurant. I really wanted to like this place and affirm that it was worth all the hype. But it was just ok.

21.description: People and staff are pleasant. However, A definite signs of coordination are lacking. We go out for a lot of different work hard and never had a problem with people coming and going and separate bills. This establishment charged me $119 for four glasses of wine and one sandwich. They tell me it was not their problem that people left and didn't pay for their drinks.I think it is their problem if they are unable to coordinate who's drinks are on whose! My Friend and I were the last people to arrive and ordered  two glasses of wine and split an entree when I questioned the bill for $119 they tell me it was not their problem that other people that had arrived earlier didn't pay for their drinks before they left. Really? How is that my fault. They actually had the gall to tell me that I needed to call my friends and have them come back and give me money to pay for the rest of the bill! Appalling!

17.description: I've said it before & I'm not ashamed to say it again...I am a pizza whore.  I love it, and love trying all of the different crusts, sauces, toppings, combinations.  While I do prefer wood fired pizza to any other - I have thoroughly enjoyed other crust / dough variations as well. This place was featured on Triple D awhile back.  I enjoy watching Guy and he sure knows how to make everything he shoves in his face look mouthwatering delicious.  Does this mean that all restaurants featured on the show provide exemplary food & service?  NO. IT. DOES. NOT.  And Vito & Nick's is a fine example.Crust is more of a 'cracker, wafer thin, crispy, well done' type.  Different, and pretty good by it's own right.  Sauce, decent & little thicker, not the 'fresh or light' kind.  Topping, I really really really really wanted to try the egg, but unfortunately it was not offered the night I was here.  I've had eggs on pizza before and enjoy that oozing yolkiness....provides another dimension.  So instead ordered the mushroom / sausage.  Took awhile before receiving it....patience is a virtue they say.  My pizza overall was tasty, homemade sausage had really good flavor and not greasy or fatty.  We also tried the fried smelts.  Don't find this often, so I liked that it was a menu item.  They were just OK.  I've had better, and frankly couldn't eat more than just a few...other's at my table agreed they weren't the greatest.The interior of this place is on the grungy side and service was 'meh'.  This is NOT traditional Chicago style pizza if that's what your looking for.  I give this joint props for unique crust and a satisfactory pizza experience....but I wouldn't go out of my way to be reacquainted with this pizza again.... TIP:  don't believe everything you hear & see on DDD!

10.description: Great food!!!Its like having friends over and hanging out in the basement...fun, comfortable, go there!!!

5.description: Seeing this place in Chicago's best and the mouth watering thin pizzas, I had this place bookmarked for months now! Finally we got the chance to visit this place last weekend on a Friday. Of course we should've known the place was packed! The waiter told us that it'll take an hour to seat us, and being hungry, I decided to order carry-out as they said it'll take only 30 mins. We got the italian beef and crushed pepperoni and eggs. After bringing the food home, when I first bit into my pepperoni+egg pizza, it was just so SALTY! I could barely taste the flavor over all this salt. Same thing with my italian beef. I'm not sure if this is how it's usually served or if they just mistakenly put salt on ours twice, but with such high anticipation, this place was a big let down for the taste of oversalting my pizza. I really want to give this place another try and try their sausage. Maybe we'll go on a less busy day and try to find a seat.

3.description: No kidding, I haven't dined in there since...1971??? I don't think anything's changed since then! Anyhow , they serve a great cracker thin crust pizza, generous with the sausage that's tasty and not greasy at all. (I've ordered their carryout many times in the interim!) Wait for the 'za to cool down a bit before diving in...it's sliced into small, 1-2 bite pieces, which makes it really easy to get carried away and eat a bunch of it. Okay beer selection, the menu said small glass of OS on tap for a buck. (Large was a buck and a half.) There's a big enough lot for parking. Service OK. I don't think we should  wait another 40+ years to go back. : )

35.description: I checked out this spot after I saw it featured on the food network. The pizza was good the sauce wasn't too spicy and settled great. I will order here again. The chicken zingers were good and I'd like to try more appetizers. The overall cost is cheap. Bring cash when you visit.no cards accepted

19.description: I grew up not too far from here but didn't pay a visit to nick and Vito's till I was older. The service is great. The beer is old style but they also have mixed drinks and wine. The pizza is delicious and crispy unlike any other pizza place I've been to. My favorite is the Italian beef pizza. The giardinera is a bit mild but you can add crush pepper if you like it spicy. My recommendation is to go on a weekday. Weekends are jammed pack and you will be lucky if you get to wait 30minutes.

28.description: I gotta say, I'm not the biggest thin crust fan, but Vito & Nick's has some pretty darn good pizza! My friend and I got sausage, green peppers, and onion pizza, and it was delicious! Something about the way the toppings were minced, and the cheese was gooey... makes my mouth water just thinking about it! The inside feels like a diner - got a bar with TVs, some booths, and some round tables. Feels broken in and homey, just the way I like it. If you're looking for a no frills break from deep-dish, try Vito & Nick's!

45.description: Seeing this place in Chicago's best and the mouth watering thin pizzas, I had this place bookmarked for months now! Finally we got the chance to visit this place last weekend on a Friday. Of course we should've known the place was packed! The waiter told us that it'll take an hour to seat us, and being hungry, I decided to order carry-out as they said it'll take only 30 mins. We got the italian beef and crushed pepperoni and eggs. After bringing the food home, when I first bit into my pepperoni+egg pizza, it was just so SALTY! I could barely taste the flavor over all this salt. Same thing with my italian beef. I'm not sure if this is how it's usually served or if they just mistakenly put salt on ours twice, but with such high anticipation, this place was a big let down for the taste of oversalting my pizza. I really want to give this place another try and try their sausage. Maybe we'll go on a less busy day and try to find a seat.

33.description: This place is great!  Went for lunch on a Friday.  We ordered their house special pizza, all-you-can eat smelts, and salad.  Everything was excellent!  The first round of smelts was so huge!  I took most of it home, so forget seconds.  The service was wonderful, even during lunchtime on a weekday.  No problem with the adjacent parking.  It was our first visit, and we didn't know we could seat ourselves, but aside from that, everything was perfect.  This place is a real gem and a keeper.  We definitely plan on going back.  It is not in our hood, but we will find reasons to go back there for sure!  Absolutely loved it!

43.description: I don't see what all the excitement is about. The pizza is average, the service was slow and being cash only is inconvenient. I got the Vito's house pizza; thin crust with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers and onions. It wasn't bad, it just tasted like any other thin crust pizza. I deducted a star due to how painfully slow and inattentive the waitress was and the inconvenience of having to pay in cash.

2.description: The service and prices here are amazing.  Cold beer, attentive staff.  First class all the way.  The pizza is OK.  Not the best you'll have, but far from the worst.

18.description: If you're looking for a fancy and upscale pizza joint, this sure isn't it!If you're looking for a quality delicious pizza in a welcoming comfortable setting.... This is the right place!!!I prefer to go in the afternoon because it's less crowded, but who am I kidding, this pizza is worth a wait too! Lol

41.description: Pizza is great!!! Since I tried it we have been ordering pizza from here every other week (yes, we don't cook in house lol). The only reason I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because they don't deliver.

52.description: Order large thin crust sausage and small thin crust pepperoni. Couldn't tell how many slices because it's cut up into squares. Pizza has great flavoring. Pepperoni has a spicy kick. Sauce is on runny side but may be nature of thin crust. Friendly late night service. Not sure of Yelp hours but Saturday kitchen closes at 10:30pm.

50.description: Went here when I visisted Chicago last winter and I'm still thinking about how good it is. I've eaten a lot of pizza in my life and Vito & Nick's is near the top of list. We tried 3 different pizzas, Pepp and Saus, Italian beef and Gia, and Garlic and I think Spinach, all 3 were amazing. I do think I liked the garlic and spinach one the best. I'm not familiar with Old Style but I drank a pitcher along with the beer, also fantastic. My buddy wore a Cubs hat into the place which is an apparent no no...and people stared at us like we were aliens for about 5 mins... Other than the Cubs incident everything was flawless. This is what a pizza place should be.

4.description: I gotta say, I'm not the biggest thin crust fan, but Vito & Nick's has some pretty darn good pizza! My friend and I got sausage, green peppers, and onion pizza, and it was delicious! Something about the way the toppings were minced, and the cheese was gooey... makes my mouth water just thinking about it! The inside feels like a diner - got a bar with TVs, some booths, and some round tables. Feels broken in and homey, just the way I like it. If you're looking for a no frills break from deep-dish, try Vito & Nick's!

6.description: I'm sorry we went here because of the hype on triple D that's all it was pizza had no flavor!! Yes crust was paper thin but everything else had no taste. I usually do not eat pizza due to my clean eating lifestyle but I wanted to try it for myself. And no this is not the reason it had no taste because I was with 6 other people that said the same thing. Don't waste your time! I don't understand why they were even on Triple D!

22.description: Never a disappointment!! Love, love, love their pizza!

15.description: 5-star rating is for the excellent thin-crust pizza and memorable experience. V&Ns is cash only so be prepared. It is a casual, no-thrills dining experience worth sharing with anyone who loves homemade thin-crust pizza. Make the trip- you won't be disappointed!

57.description: The pizza is good, but nothing to rave about. The place is clean & the staff is nice. The interior is just really dated & I feel like I'm too young to be in there & I'm 28. It just as an elderly person feel to it, maybe because of the interior. Either way, it's close to home & not too bad.

20.description: Haven't been there in years, think it's time for a visit. Just plain good ultra-thin pizza. Can't argue with ANY of their ingredients but I think the sausage is extra special!!

36.description: One of the best thin crust pizzas in Chicago.  Cheese is just right, crust is crispy, and sausage is delicious.  Doesn't get much better than this.  A real treat.

14.description: The pizza is to die for, prompt friendly service too. Just remember to bring cash, I had to run across the street to the atm.

1.description: Why do I bother?I've been here before, never been impressed.Thus my expectations were low and they did  not fail to disappoint. How is this place still open?No greeting, wandered up and down the aisles trying to find items. No one asked if I needed help. When I  finally found one of the three items I needed, I waited at the counter for easily like a minute and a half while the manager was 10 feet away stocking the shelves. There's no way he did not know I was there. Finally because the security guard or some some guy says 'this man's waiting', the manager comes up and checks me out.  There were two other employees chatting nearby, all within eyesight, none of whom helped when I was at the register. Astounding. This place is terrible.

0.description: I come here to get a snack or something to drink, but I am starting to really notice that their patronage has gone down since CVS stopped selling tobacco products in their stores so many are going across the street to Walgreens to buy cigarettes. I was very disappointed when they took out the Bank of America ATM because that's how I was able to get quick cash since there's no BOA nearby and when you're on the bus you have to ride down to Halsted Street to access the bank branch and ATM. This particular location is situated just at the corner of west 79th Street and Western Avenue just a few yards from the bus terminal. Be wary sometimes because homeless people hangout in front of the store which is a nuisance to people coming in and out of the store being harassed for change and even at times followed by these folks. The downside is that this place is not 24 hours like some locations are which is not helpful to the people in that community who may need to get a prescription filled or need something for a cold or whatever. It's also overpriced since some items in there are some you can find elsewhere for cheaper and they have an issue of keeping things stocked because I would come in and people who were regulars would ask for specific things and the staff would tell them they would have it in stock at the end of the week and sometimes that's hard to believe when I came in there twice looking for my favorite $1 bag of sour cream and onion chips and they didnt have any in stock for a good two weeks. I would say save yourself the added stress by passing this place up unless you really are desperate to get something right away instead of going to your regular place where things are relatively priced a few dollars and even cents cheaper.

3.description: Went here for some batteries, juice, & a tank. This place has a ton of variety to choose from. Also very knowledgeable staff. Bien the (Asian guy) really knew his stuff I bought a mod & it just wasn't working right & he fixed it right up for me. Thia she helped me out with juice & she really knew what I liked from a brief description of what I gave her. Great shop I will definitely be doing business here in the future.

1.description: Great place! I've only been into this Vape312 a few times but they treat me just as well as the one in the city that I'm used to going to but now I got an option much closer to me! Best part about it is the staff is some of the friendliest people, they're bar is huge and the seats are comfortable at the bar. They def took the time with all the details here. The couches are comfy and the distance board for cloud comps and the pool table tops it off. Love this place and plan on making it a regular stop for my Vape shop list!

2.description: The clouds hung low when I walked through the door. Reminiscent of a bowling alley after an entire evening of league play back when you could still smoke in public. Nice low mellow lighting. Super chill atmosphere. Some very relaxing looking couches and a pool table in back.If I were to envision what a vape lounge should look like this would be it. They stock and display their e-juice like fine wines in a rack. And yes, they stock some nice flavors. Bought some new hardware here and they were very knowledgeable about it. Friendly staff too. I just might be to old for this scene though..I still don't really get the vape lounge concept. Its not a bar, restaurant or club. Seems like there is a lack of activities to do in there. I do my vaping at home or in my car. I don't need a social scene to vape.

0.description: I love the feel of the shop, always re stocking on new hardware that everyone always wants. Keeps the options always open and wide. Great staff, makes you feel welcome and want to stay and hangout. Bien is also a savage

1.description: Finally on the south side trying out my bookmarks, & had to check them out! I viewed the menu online so I knew what I wanted.  Walked in and noticed there's not much dining room and IT'S FREEZING IN HERE, I THINK I WAS FROST BITTEN!!! I ordered 2 jerk shrimp dinners with yams, cabbage, & mac & cheese, red beans & rice, 1/2 white chicken only, & added a lobster tail to my shrimp dinner. Should've known the order was gone miss something on my order!  We sat at the table at waited, & waited & waited. After an hour our food was FINALLY ready, I had gone to the car because I was too cold to continue to wait in there. Got the food & they missed my cabbage and gave me mac and cheese which I don't eat,  but I wasn't gonna go back and wait another hour for cabbage! Lolbs They also thru in 4 wings for the wait. So I was happy.OMG THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS!!!!! I was so stuffed I didn't think I could drive home!!! Them yams!!! Baby them yams!!!! My food was well worth the wait. ALL OF IT!!! I'm sure I'll be back. I'll call in 1st like I saw others doing..

9.description: What can I say about this restaurant that hasn't already been said?I ordered two jerk chicken dinners (one all white meat, one mixed) and both tasted amazing. I ordered the cabbage and mac and cheese as sides, which were phenomenal. The cabbage was seasoned to perfection and soggy. The mac & cheese tasted how mac & cheese should taste - full of flavor and authentic cheese (not that stuff from the box some places pass off). My chicken was spicy although not spicy to the point I couldn't enjoy it. I like that they didn't drench it in any additional sauce. The chicken is served on a bed of beans and rice so technically you get three sides with your meal. The restaurant itself is small, with some seating though not much. It's more of a get it to go place. Good luck trying not to eat it on your way wherever you are going. Lastly - customer service was on point - courteous, and made sure my food was ready right on time. I will be back, whenever I'm on this side of town.

12.description: Very good!  a lot of food, however would have liked on more shrimp for the price... Good flavor a little pricey,  I've been 4 times and each time consistent.

21.description: OMG!!! This place is amazing ! Delicious good food. Like home cooked ... The seasoning is on point! I had the jerk chicken and the oxtail with candies yams, green and fantastic mac and cheese. I will recommend this place! Can't wait to go back and try some more delicacies ;)

16.description: Been meaning to write this review for a minute. Some of the best jerk chicken I have had. Jerk chicken is one of my favorite foods so I know when I come across some good jerk. I usually go to jerk villa on 79th halsted but I didn't like going that way anymore. So thank goodness for this spot. Good location also. Jerk chicken taco, jerk nachos, jerk dinner, cabbage, macaroni and peas n rice are really good n flavorful. And one of my favorites is the jerk chicken hot sauce, love it. Yes it's hot! Haven't had the jerk lobster yet but I heard its good too.

17.description: They were friendly and helpful!!!! Delicious down to the cabbage! Highly recommend this place. But expensive for serving size!

10.description: I had the pleasure of visiting Caribbean jerk palace today to grab dinner for my family.   I ordered a jerk chicken dinner w/ yams & Mac & cheese for sides, jerk taco (because I never had one) and a 4 piece wing. All I can say is OMG!!! Chicken was seasoned to perfection with just the right amount of heat. The jerk taco was amazing!!!!! It was served on a super soft pita, which I loved. The sides were decent. Everything was reasonably priced (total was $21 and some change). Wait time wasn't long at all...approximately 15 mins. And the gentlemen were kind.   This is my new go-to place for Jerk!

5.description: Today was my first day eating here. Real talk, you have to wait a good 30 minutes. But it's all good, because I know people that cook it at home, and they take that long , maybe 45 minutes, to cook that chicken real good. Lol. The food here is good, and they give you a lot for $11.50. The jerk wings, Mac  n cheese, and steamed cabbage is a real good combo. I took some home and smashed the last of it. I do recommend I it.

11.description: Caribbean Jerk Palace was really yummy. We had salmon, catfish, chicken and oxtails. The salmon was a little dry but still good, everything else was amazing. Sides: Mac & cheese, plantains, cabbage, sweet potatoes and red beans and rice. All the sides were great! We tasted a little bit of everything. So much food I'll have lunch next week. Oh and the service was good too! Kinda slow, so ordering ahead us best. Good food takes time though. They gave me a free beef patty for my wait. It was just good to see young black men doing something positive like running a successful business. Run don't walk to support them. You will be glad you did!!

22.description: They were friendly and helpful!!!! Delicious down to the cabbage! Highly recommend this place. But expensive for serving size!

0.description: I had there jerk lobster tail. I was blown away by the flavor.  I will be coming  back for more

20.description: Was craving jerk chicken and plantains and this little place took care of that. It was home made food for a fair price. Small place, clean, and very nice staff. Good for carry-out orders!

19.description: Never been a huge fan of Caribbean cooking, mostly because i don't care for peppery hot seasoning (although my friend who talked me into going here loves it and thought the jerk chicken delicious and on the mildly spicy side), but this place opened my mind to the rest of the joys of this cousine.  The curry chicken was tender, moist and flavorful.  The short ribs were well-balanced between sweet and mildly spicy.  The ox tail was full of flavor.  My favorite was the red beans and rice that served as a bed for all the different meat dishes and the roasted plantains that were full of sweet charred goodness.  The greens, cabbage, and greenbeans were all delicious treats and will satisfy the pallets of any healthy version soul food fan.  The service was friendly and all in all, it was a fantastic carry-out feast for my household.  Can't wait to try the seafood dishes.  We'll be back soon!

2.description: Palace?  NOThis is somewhere closer to ordering food for a poorly equipped camping adventure, and doing it from within a JAIL CELL.... seriously.  You're ordering food from someone behind BULLET PROOF GLASS, and then after a lot of screaming and fighting noise from the back, your food is given to you through a slot in the window. (And there's a lot of other crazy stuff that happens too)  It would almost be good enough for camping, but they don't have many of the basic utensils; like plastic knives, straws for drinks, etc....  It is not easy to eat lobster with a flimsy plastic fork, especially if you can't cut it.  I guess that they expect that anyone that "would" be a customer is taking the stuff directly to their home.   I asked them if they had plastic knives or straws...... NOAnd then, considering that fact that you've been forced to forgo certain utensils, be prepared for the fact that there's nowhere to wash your hands..... AND they don't provide a "wet napkin".  I looked at the pictures and noted that this seemed to be a carry-out.  BUT... I called and asked if they had tables and could accommodate 4-5 people.  They said YES.  In fact, when I showed up, they said "Oh, you're the guy that called us and asked about seating".  I was sort of OK with the fact that the seating was sparse, but they didn't exactly tell the TRUTH.  I figured that I would sit in the car if absolutely necessary.  But not having the necessary plastic utensils is not excusable.  And.... when you spend $90+ you sort of expect to at least have access to a washroom.  We ended up asking the barber shop a couple of doors down if we could use their rest room.  Then, make sure to wear a coat because they don't heat the waiting/ordering area where you "may" choose consume your food.  It is very uncomfortable.... and the pictures posted on YELP are very complimentary, especially with regard to lighting.  This place is very very rough.....  OK, so here's how it goes.....  You order your food, you wait 30 minutes and THEN they tell you that they're OUT OF CERTAIN ITEMS...... and that's after you've already WAITED 30 minutes and PAID for your FOOD!!!!!!  (It would be nice to know that BEFORE being made to wait for 30 minutes)  But the fun doesn't end there!!!!  Then you still end up waiting another 20+ minutes!!!Now even further insult to injury, they forgot some things in our order.  (lobster tail)  They did "make good", but that was ANOTHER 15 minutes of waiting.  In general, they were out of many things on the menu and we showed up at 6:45 pm on a Tuesday night.  What happens on a Friday night?  During your wait, beyond the fights that you hear coming from the back, you also get to witness the customers coming in the front door that are generally pretty angry!  One lady comes in and says "Don't you answer your phone?  I called 17 times!!!".  And many other customers come in saying the same thing.  Then another guy comes in and says "I ordered my food 45+ minutes ago and you say it will be at least another 20 minutes!?!?!!?"  Then he says "I WANT MY MONEY BACK because I can't wait any longer".  (I don't blame him for being so angry.)With all that said, the men running the place were polite and the food actually was "OK".  It wasn't great food, just OK.  I'd give the place 3 stars based upon food quality alone but all the other factors make this a VERY ROUGH experience.

18.description: THEE BEST JERK CHICKEN PLACE IN CHICAGO! This is a new place, and before I tried Caribbean Jerk Palace, I've tried Jerk Villa... I've even stood in that hour long line, I've tried Jerk Kitchen, Irie Jerk and Uncle Joe's Jerk, but none, none, have come close to Caribbean Jerk Palace. The mac and cheese tastes so southern with REAL cheese, the cabbage is seasoned to perfection and the chicken is juicy not dry, and the extra sauce is definitely hot and jerk. Love this place. I wont go anywhere else. Keep up the good work and you'll have a long term customer here.

13.description: I really wasn't a fan of jerk chicken until I discovered this restaurant. Food was seasoned to perfection. My chicken (with and without sauce) was absolutely delicious. My sides of Mac and cheese with Yams tasted like my mom use to make. Service was fast and courteous.  Thanks again yelpers for a great tip!

4.description: Really good food. Seasoned perfectly. I've had the chicken, catfish, nachos (w/Doritos), shrimp, lobster tail, taco, yams, Mac n cheese, rice and peas and cabbage. I typically like my cabbage firm and spicy as there's is a little softer and sweeter. Do expect to wait as the food is cooked fresh. The establishment is fairly new so the place does look rough but I'm sure in time it will be upgraded. They do have a lot of business flowing in. Only a few chairs and high tables. The guys are all very nice. Definitely try the yams! You won't regret it.

6.description: Slow as hell I thought I would starve to death waiting for this food definitely gotta call ahead  which I told someone to do but they didn't listen talking bout they didn't know what they wanted...the cashier taking our order was a retarded weed head we order two shrimp dinners one with Mac and cheese and yams and one with cabbage and yams a lobster tail and a 1/2 white jerk dinner took him three four times to get that right and they still messed my order up no cabbage just Mac and yams for both dinners we was so hungry we didn't even care they did give us wings for our wait which was greatly appreciated this is some kick ass jerk nice and spicy I didn't even use the jerk sauce everything was delicious no complaints there tell me why I went to the barber shop to get a lining I come home looking for my left over and my yams were missing??? Wtf  .......Best jerk spot gotta check em out but call first...

15.description: Was craving jerk chicken and plantains and this little place took care of that. It was home made food for a fair price. Small place, clean, and very nice staff. Good for carry-out orders!

7.description: Sooooo I've been here a few time for a regularjerk chicken  dinner.  The first time no problem it was great.  The second time they forgot half my order and i got all the way home and it did not have shrimp inside, after i specifically asked did they put it in there and the response was yes. Ok whatever got the shrimp and everything was fine.  Then i secoded to use them for catering......a big no no and disappointed. The order was supposed to be ready at 1230, ended up still waiting almost an hr for my food. Finally get the food and carry it to the car in the box ot was in and cabbage juice all down the front of my jacket. WTF.......Get home and ppl started to eat the chicken and ot was not cooked all the way through. Good luck with so called management.

8.description: More than a 4 but not quite a 5...so 4.5This place rocks! It is NOT Haitian, but it is real good Jerk. And guess what Yelpers?! ~ no meat in the veggies Yeeaaa baby ~ veggies are veggies! What we ordered:Beef short ribs with cabbage and plantains Curry chicken with greens and sweet yamsMixed plate with shrimp, salmon, chicken wings, and lobster tail with Mac and cheese and cabbage Wanted to order green beans but they were out... The beef short ribs were delicious... They were fall of the bone tender and not super fatty like beef ribs have a tendency of being. Loved that the plantain wasn't greasyThe curry was flavorful and the chicken was tender.. The greens is where a star was lost... The greens had too many stems making them a bit too bitter. The yams were yummy; not too sweet and nice big chucks. The shrimp were a little too hot for me to fully enjoy. The chicken wings were tasty, the salmon was seasoned beautifully.. it was not fishy and cooked perfectly! The lobster was a standout... I was nervous that it might be over-seasoned... It wasn't, I throughly enjoyed it! I was impressed by the mac and cheese... Jerk places NEVER have good mac, quite a few restaurants can't pull off good mac; the Palace delivered, the mac was creamy, cheesy and seasoned well. The cabbage was delicious and soft without being mushyAll in all this place IS a Palace in an area of dilapidation! I will be happily eating there again!

3.description: I ordered a $8.50 two piece jerk catfish lunch and came home to find two of the scrawniest, sorriest pieces of catfish steaks I've ever seen and for the price it was hardly what I would call a meal. No lie. These lil' funky pieces couldn't feed a fly! I should have just kept on going down the road and went to Jerk Villa even if their service isn't the best, but at least I get what I pay for.

14.description: I ordered two combination (jerk lobster tail, shrimp and chicken) dinners. My boyfriends plate was good. His lobster was firm and his cabbage was good but my food was disappointing. My lobster was soft and mushy and my plantains were to ripe which made them soft and saturated in oil. The mac was okay and the rice and peas would have been good less that Hot gravy. The harddough bread was good but when my boyfriend asked  "what are those." I knew something was wrong because we eat fried plantain often. So he should've known they were plantains without asking.  I'm glad I tried the food since it was on my list of places to try. I just had a bad plate of Mushy food so spicy I couldn't enjoy it.

1.description: I went there this morning to get some breakfast for my family.  I was excited when I got there because they were doing a survey in the drive thru where you got a $2 gift card.  Score.  So I took the survey and gave them good answers because everything was going great...until I got home and realized my entire order was wrong!

0.description: It took 10 minutes to get my bacon, egg & cheese bagel. The people there were vary rude and obnoxious! And they didn't even apologize.

1.description: Nasty attitude,cashier Karla if that's her name didn't  even greet me when I said hi looked like she didn't even want to be there. Why do they hire these useless people that just want to collect a paycheck and make shoppers not want to come back.

2.description: This is a horrid store.  It gives a bad name to a really great company.  We went here today, 12/7/2013.  Not only is this store small, it's a miserable experience with poor management.  The store was packed for no real reason, but that's of course not their fault.  What was their fault was the filthy floors and baseball and other cards and boxes all over the ground at checkout, and the 20 minutes+ it took to checkout!  I counted at least SEVEN people who worked here yet nothing was getting done in a prompt manner!  There were four checkout lanes open and being used, and the dozens of people in line waited forever for a store WITH EVERYTHING PRICED AS A DOLLAR to checkout!  The credit card machine took about 2 minutes to take my payment that usually takes seconds.  To top it off, the parking is packed and sucks as well.    If this store was any slower, it'd automatically turn into a molasses factory!  Never again.    Please go to the Merrionette Dollar Tree instead, it's fast, neater, and much, much larger!!

0.description: Yeah this place is kind of a dump.  I go there because it's close to my house and I have a few items I but there regularly.  The line is always long and the place is always a mess.  The employees are rude too.  I used a basket once when I was in there and after I was done putting my items on the counter I put my basket on top of the other baskets that were next to the counter.  The cashier was like that's not where they go, huffed at me, and moved the whole stack of baskets by the front door.  Sorry lady, the other five baskets must of thrown me off.

1.description: Best salon ever!! Super clean, and very friendly staff. Thikk Nikk has been doing my hair for 7 years so where ever she go I go, and this is by far the best salon! I have my favorites of course... Thikk Nikk & Peggy!

2.description: I want to like this place so badly!I went to Savad's sometime last year and had Sharita do my hair. She did an excellent job and I didn't have any issues with it. For my next weave, I decided to go somewhere closer to home and ended up overpaying and getting a terrible job that ended up taking 7+ hours but that's for another review.I decided to come back to Savad's in the hopes that Sharita could do my hair quickly for graduation but she was completely booked. She referred me to another woman named Rochelle who I then called and scheduled an appointment with.I got a full head sew-in take down(not done by Rochelle) which was quick and didn't hurt at all. After my wash and braiding I was sent to Rochelle's station to actually get my hair installed. From the time I sat down to about when I was halfway finished, I saw about 3 women get full head sew-ins from Sharita. My hair ended up taking TEN HOURS. I was not aware that I was referred to a hairstylist who did not have extensive experience in sew-ins and I do feel that I should have been warned before I booked the appointment. One of the main reasons I decided to drive up to her shop was so that I wouldn't have to sit in a chair for so long as I have a....um..deficiency of fatty tissues in the buttocks area and joint issues. Shame on me for not asking, shame on Sharita for letting me sit in her shop ignorant.Overall the job done on my hair was ok but I really didn't want to spend my entire day in her shop. If I get desperate enough to come here again, Sharita has to be the one to do it.

0.description: What I think is unfortunate about so many reviews is that people have a tendency not to give POSITIVE reviews. So here's one for Savad's/Sharita.*****DISCLAIMER: I do NOT work for or WITH Savad's or Sharita in Any way. I have been a client of Sharita's for a few years and I hate to see anything but good reviews about because I know her work well. The pictures I added are from her website*****I've been a client of Sharita's since 2009. I was referred to her by a friend. I've been wearing sew-ins since 2005, and I've had many different stylists and methods done on my hair.What I will tell you is that I have NEVER had a sew in as wonderful as Sharita's. Period. My hair is so believably real that even people that KNOW me have to take a double take. I've had 22' inch hair in my head UNLAYERED, and people on the street thought it was growing from my headFACT: Sharita is EXTREMELY fast at sew-ins. For my most recent install (3/8/12), I arrived at 11am and was out the door at 1:30pm. This includes wash/condition, braiding, sew in, AND there was 1 person ahead of meFACT: The ladies in the salon can get loud. They do have a tendency to laugh and speak loudly to each other.FACT: It is BEST to make an appointment with Sharita. Although walk-ins are welcome, regardless of if you've had your hair done by her before, she WILL refer you to someone else if she's booked. NOTE: She is the fastest in the salon at sew-ins, so you're pressing your luck if you get referredFACT: Sharita cuts tracks towards the TOP of your hair in order for it to lay flat.FACT: Sharita does have phone conversations with other people while you're in her chair. The volume in which she's talking depends on the day and conversation. I've never been bothered by it.FACT: Unlike most women that must find one stylist for sew-in, one for cut, another for color, and one for styling, I can firmly say that Sharita can do ALL of the above. I was skeptical when I FIRST went to her in 2009, but on my second install, I was made a believer.FACT: If you stick with her, your hair will GROW. From November 2009 to October 2010, my hair grew over 9 inches. My hair was 1" below my ear when I went to her initially and it grew to 2" above my bra strap. WHAT TO EXPECT WITH SHARITA FOR A SEW-IN:- Call and make your appointment- When you walk in to her area in the back of the salon, say hello and Denise will wash your hair (assuming you don't require a take down)- Ja will blow dry and braid your hair (That girl is GREAT at braiding. She's fast and the braids are SMALL so the weave absolutely lays flat). Sharita will ask where you want your part (assuming you're not using a closure) and if you want your edges out. She'll part, Ja will braid from there.- Sharita will call you to her chair when it's your turn and she'll have you thread needles as she sews- When she's done sewing in, she will ASK you if you want her to layer it, if you want a blunt cut, curls, etc. She will also SHOW you what hair she has left over.- Pay using cash or credit, FIN!All in all, you may or may not be bothered by the other ladies in the salon. You may or may not be OK with waiting if you have people ahead of you. All in all I will GLADLY endure ALL of the above in exchange for the QUALITY and SPEED of her work. AMAZING Sew-Ins!!!

3.description: I was only able to try the cornbread dressing & greens. The dressing was actually made from cornbread & not some reinvented version of stovetop stuffing that a lot of so called soul food restaurants have decided to cut corners by using. The gravy was had bits of turkey when I tasted it I immediately sighed. This is as close to homestyle as you're going to get. I can't wait to stop in again & get a full meal!

1.description: Never. Ever. Ever. Again.Ever.

2.description: My daughers and l went sunday after church and was disappointed. There are so few soul food restaurants so we are always looking. The short ribs were not seasoned, macaroni tasted as if it came from a box and i won't elaborate anymore on the rest. We'll keep looklng.

9.description: Definitely going back. I don't live anywhere near this place, but I sure wish I did. My husband and I were in the area today and had lunch here. Baked chicken (moist, yum), collard greens (best ever), black-eyed peas (good - high praise considering Wallace's in Garfield Park has ruined all other BEPs for me), cornbread stuffing. Heaven. We sat at the table looking at the remains of our meal for a few minutes and talking about how we wished there was somewhere to lie down for a nap right then.The staff were exceptional - friendly, welcoming - and the food so so good. Maybe it's an unfair stipulation, but 5 stars if they can make their BEPs like Wallace's.

10.description: Get yourself down to Dan's Soul Food & Bakery. We decided to eat there because it was close to a veggie-friendly restaurant that we were looking for; that place had closed, so we walked a few storefronts to Dan's. This place is nearly perfect. I had sides of lima beans (terrific), green beans (very good), greens (terrific), and cornbread stuffing (a few bites for me the rest for David (husband) because I was saving carbs for dessert--but absolutely excellent. Glad I did because banana pudding, complete with a Nilla wafer on top has made my list of foods David should feed me when I'm in the nursing home and can't feed myself. They've got cobblers and cakes too. David had catfish and red beans & rice and greens. Also on the menu that night were baked chicken and turkey legs. They also have pot roast and roast beef and bunch of other things that meat eaters like.Melvin, the cook and our waiter, gave us extra cornbread when I told him I was going to wrap up our extras in a napkin to eat for breakfast.  We were the only folks in the place most of the time (coming back from Midway around 5:30pm on Friday) but Melvin and a woman working there were setting up for a 9pm buffet, so the place must have a (micro)-local following. Even if the place had been busier, I get the feeling that the service would have been as kind and friendly as it was when we were there. Melvin learned how to do all the cooking from the previous owner, and he clearly knows what he is doing. This place is a gem and you should check it out today.

4.description: Really enjoyed dining in here!!! They have a nice selection of soul food favorites.Place is nice and clean.I recieved really good service from them.I liked their homemade cranberry sauce.Waaaay better than that storebought stuff.Thank God for Yelp that I was able to find a good decent soul food restaurant that AGAIN I never knew was there.ADDING IT AS ANOTHER ONE OF MY SPOTS!!!! I'd like to add its in a nice neighborhood too.

6.description: I have been here a million and one times and I almost always get the pot roast with mashed potatoes and gravy, macaroni and cheese,  green beans and corn bread. The food is always delicious and the staff is always friendly.  I've had the catfish, the desserts and everything is great.

11.description: Good service poor food not good at all good for first time soul food eaters or the ones that cant cook nasty

5.description: Great food good service ( with a smile )  very reasonable prices !!!! You won't leave hungry !!!

7.description: So after circling the block 5 times and almost giving up, we found Dan's. There sign must be missing, but my guess is that they have a serious following and its more word of mouth.I walked in and I don't know where to start. They have smoked turkey wings, baked chicken, smothered chicken, and all types of goodies. I ask the older woman behind the counter were the greens made with meat and she said "baby, i only use turkey in my greens." I am in heaven! Then I asked was her cornbread made with meat and she said no! Cha-ching! Now you non-soul food eaters may be asking what's up with all the questions. A lot of soul food cooks use pork in everything and I don't eat it. As times are changing so are people's "seasoners" and they are opting for turkey which is awesome!My friend and I opted for the smothered chicken with cornbread, greens (made with smoked turkey), and mac n cheese. Now my friend originally wanted the short ribs, but she said she sold the last one right before he arrived. While some may feel jaded by this, I think its pretty awesome that you sell out of food because it says:A) I cook based on needB) Your food will always be freshNow that means you have to get here a bit earlier to ensure you get your favorites. Now what sucked is that if you do get there closer to closing, they may have to make your dish from super scratch. We had to wait 20+ minutes on our food, which is fine because its fresh, but when everyone who comes after you leaves before you, it can be a bit of downer. What's that mean for you -- don't go there starving. Just right before starving!Food review: The greens were fantastic. The cornbread with homemade cranberry sauce was tastttttty! The mac was okay and the chicken could have been spiced more, but all in all.. a tasty meal at a good price!

8.description: Service is very, very, slow.  Manager response does not exist.  Went to dinner there on 7/20/14, the restaurant was not crowded.  Two people were finishing dinner.  We were a party of four.   The waitress sat us down and proceeded to go on the other side and fill take-out orders.  At that point we should have left.  10 minutes later she came back to take our orders.  She specifically asked if we wanted all our food to be served at the same time. We stated yes.  15 minutes later, she returns stating they were out of dark meat, we accepted the choice of white.  When the food came she stated chicken was coming right up.  It came 20 minutes later we were all finished. Meanwhile, she was running back and forth, trying to do everything and forgetting most things,  meanwhile another couple came in and were waiting.  We discussed the reviews posted on YELP.  When we asked to speak to a manager, we were told, he was coming, then he was busy, and finally he had left the building.  The food was decent, black-eyed peas were tasteless, like out of a can.  Asked for peach cobbler to go, was given a container of it. (It was ice cold).  The fastest response I received was my check.  I am a proponent of supporting black-owned businesses, this place needs to get it together.  But it was real trifling of the manager to not respond to our request.

0.description: This was my 1st time trying this place.... I must say very good. I would definitely go back, I ordered the BAKED CHICKEN DINNER. It came with dressing and two sides, so I got the Mac n cheese and Collard greens. Very nice size portions, the Mac n cheese was delicious, so was the dressing and gravy. The chicken was well seasoned and greens good but could've been a Tad bit more salt. Its a sit down restaurant as well, which is nice. Happy I found a good soul food restaurant in my area. Ill be going back and telling my family and friends about it.

28.description: Cheap prices. Always packed. Cash only. They will special order. Even better it's less than a block from my house!

1.description: Kenwood has always been the place to go for liquor if you happen to find yourself on the Southside. And i've been to their other location many times. So when I found out they had another location I had to check it out. It took quite a while before I actually got the chance to go to this location but I am glad I finally was able to get here. I must say I am very glad I did, not only did I realize this one is closer to me than I originally thought, but they seemed to have a slightly bigger selection than the other. And the best part about it no city tax, yeah!  Now being that I had more to get done that day, I didn't get to peruse the variety as I might've wanted to, but I did see that they have quite a variety to suit everyones tastes. Whether you're a wine drinker or you fancy liquid spirits, you're guaranteed to find what you are looking for here. Now like other reviewers have stated the parking lot is very small and compact, and can be quite a traffic jam when it's full. But it's hardly a deal breaker considering.I am looking forward to revisiting this place when I have a bit more free time. This place definitely has the potential to be one of my go to spots.

9.description: **Cash only**I love this liquor store. The prices are crazy cheap. The staff is always asking if you'd like help and they have helped me pick out various gifts that have always been well received. I just have to constantly remind myself of the cash only thing. There is an ATM inside though if you forget.

29.description: Amazing prices and Russian Standard Vodka!!

23.description: OMG! This place is like Toy's R Us for adults! We actually like the new one in Homer Glen better and go there now that it is open. Their everyday prices are better than any other. Yes, they beat the hell out of everyone, even Binny's. Also, if you can't find what you are looking for here, it isn't available anywhere. Saturdays they always have tastings which is great, but it really makes the store crowded. Believe me when I say, this is worth the drive, regardless of how far away it may seem!

5.description: No parking even though they have a decent lot.   It sobusy.   I feel like I walking through  a cattle run.   Iwould rather go elsewhere with low prices.   There are many other stores in the ares.

31.description: This place is fantastic.  First off, they only accept cash, but they do have an ATM in the store.  Prices are cheap, the selection is HUGE, and the staff is very helpful when you're trying to locate something.  It's not glamourous, but it's a liquor store.  The lines were absurd on New Year's Eve at about 4:30, but that's my own fault for waiting until then to go get booze.  Parking is a bit tricky, but there is street parking so if the lot's full, it's worth the walk rather than waiting to get a spot.

25.description: I grew up in the southwest 'burbs. My parents used to buy booze from Kenwood, so for the last two years we headed to Oak Lawn to pick up some beer for our holiday party. By "we" I mean myself and my girlfriend. The last time we went, we were told they did not accept state ID's as a valid form of identification. That is not legal. Even so, we went in this time and I decided to purchase the alcohol because I have a valid driver's license. I handed the cashier my license, and--with serious attitude--she demanded to see my girlfriend's license. I said she has a valid state ID, but doesn't drive. She said she could not sell a 27-year-old woman and her 27-year-old partner a 12-pack of beer because she does not have a driver's license? That is NOT legal. The cashier tells me it is an Oak Lawn policy. That is false. It is an ILLEGAL store policy. Also, I find it strange that no one else I know has had that problem. I never pull the "homophobia" card--but I'm pulling it now. We were CLEARLY discriminated against. Also, their cash-only policy is suspect. I feel like if this place were even mildly investigated--there would be some dirt. I've seen better alcohol prices at Jewel, and I really hope the Village of Oak Lawn does something about their illegal and discriminatory policy. Kenwood will never see a dime of mine--or my family's--money again. I also plan on being very vocal about my experience there.

12.description: I came here with my friend who had been coming here for years and said it was an inexpensive place with a very good selection. I figured why not? So we walk in and the lady and the older gentleman were very nice and friendly, and the selection was indeed good.After we picked out our beers, we went to go pay, and that's when things went downhill. My friend was ahead of me and went to go pay, and when he was carded he gave the nice lady his state ID. That's when this short gentlemen rudely interrupted and said "We only take Driver's licenses". I butted in and asked him "Really? It's a valid ID though".He offered no clarification, no explanation, he just rudely stated again "We only take driver's licenses", not even looking us in the eyes.I'm sorry, but we're not there to drive a car, we're there to buy liquor. A state ID is more than adequate for this purpose, as it is a state ID that proves your identity and age, and is accepted everywhere else.Then a couple of days later my younger friend in her mid 20's who always gets carded everywhere we go bought liquor there and said her state ID was just fine, so either the rules are flexible for some people, or the guy decided he was having a bad day and took it out on us.Either way, Mr. Napoleon Complex and the lack of accepting credit cards outweighs the savings, so I'd rather take my business elsewhere.
