However I do want to thank the lady and the older gentleman, as well as the stock person roaming the isles though for being nice at least.

37.description: This place has a huge selection of wine beer and liquor.  If there is something out of the ordinary that I am specifically looking for than most likely they have it here.  The prices are reasonable and did I mention that they have a huge selection!  This place can get very crowded and they do not have a very big parking lot.  Your best bet is park on the side street.

21.description: Great prices, great selection.Just make sure you have no one under 21 in your car. They have people patrolling the parking lot and the nearby street, staring into your car to make sure you don't buy for underagers. Creepy and annoying, but.Oh, and they don't take credit cards.

16.description: Great prices, great selection.Just make sure you have no one under 21 in your car. They have people patrolling the parking lot and the nearby street, staring into your car to make sure you don't buy for underagers. Creepy and annoying, but.Oh, and they don't take credit cards.

17.description: OMG! This place is like Toy's R Us for adults! We actually like the new one in Homer Glen better and go there now that it is open. Their everyday prices are better than any other. Yes, they beat the hell out of everyone, even Binny's. Also, if you can't find what you are looking for here, it isn't available anywhere. Saturdays they always have tastings which is great, but it really makes the store crowded. Believe me when I say, this is worth the drive, regardless of how far away it may seem!

10.description: I love this place. From the helpful staff down to the whole retro, neighborhood go-to, kitchy vibe, this store makes me so happy!As for the parking complaints, well.  The small lot is often packed because of the selection and prices, duh!  I find the occasional minor inconvenience completely worth it. Denise in particular is always super helpful and knowledgeable, especially regarding wines.  She'll help you find what you need and send you on your way with a smile.  And yeah, I've come across a curmudgeon or two in the establishment as well.  I get a kick out it, I think it adds to the charm.  If you expect corporate prices and stale, disingenuous corporate customer service, then be my guest and grab your overpriced crappy beer at Jewel.  They now accept credit as well as cash, though I didn't mind when they didn't.  I just moved from Chicago Ridge to pretty far north of Kenwood, but I plan on making trips down to this store now and again.  I think this spot is really endearing, down to the blinking lights of their 50s sign out front!

11.description: It's like a miny Binny's. Half the selection (which is still extensive especially given the size) and more often than not even lower prices! I've found handles of Johnny Walker cheaper at Costco and a few beer cheaper in Binny's but for the most part it's the cheapest game in town. Cash only.Parking can be tough.It only seems to get busier at night. The Police drive around this block frequently so you know stuff is going down regular in the vicinity. I feel like I'm starting to reveal too much about myself now that I'm reviewing Liquor stores. Let's just say I've been to a few.

26.description: I don't get the hype.  I've been to this store twice now, and always have a bad experience.  Parking is a nightmare, it's VERY hard to find anything, forget about needing to ask for help, and as for prices, really, compare around, it's nothing special.  I wasn't aware by any sort of signage at all that they didn't take credit cards, which was a massive inconvenience.  Overall, that big of a hassle to save maybe a dollar? No thanks.  The logic of driving that far out of my way and wasting that much gas to save pennies just doesn't make sense.For my buck, I'd rather go to Stadium Liquors in Burbank.

27.description: Kenwood has the lowest prices of beer, wine or spirits anywhere. Well worth the trip to the south suburbs. As a matter of fact people come from as far away as Ohio to take advantage of the prices. Be prepared, the place is small with a great selection. But it can get very crowded and the parking lot gets hectic especially around holidays. And bring cash, they don't take credit cards.

35.description: Great prices and good selection...Very crowded during the holidays , not enough parking..I need to  pickup some Patron'..

8.description: I think everyone in the SW burbs knows that Kenwood is the place to go for liquor - the cheapest prices around.   Seriously, they beat everyone on prices.   You see people leaving this place with cases and cases of beer, wine, spirits.   You don't just come here to pick up a 6-pack....you stock up.The place isn't big.  The aisles are not big.  The place is packed tight with as much alcohol as possible.  It is almost impossible for 2 people to be in aisle at the same time.  There are workers everywhere - trying to keep the place stocked.   Beer is flying off the shelves, stacks, friges as fast as they can stock it.  The prices are that good!Parking kind of sucks - they have a lot, but it is not big.  People are parking down the street and across the street.    I try to come at 'off' hours, and never on weekends.  Can't beat the prices!

0.description: Its been said before and it will be said again, this place is a true gem. Anywhere that has dolly's as well as carts is clearly a winner. Sure, the parking lot is small and the place is crowded. I don't know what size parking lot you're expecting from a Cicero front corner store that is surrounded by residences in the back, OR, why you'd like your liquor store to be a ghost town. Its busy because its cheap and has good customer service. The lot is small because the neighborhood is old, as is the location. I myself kind of enjoy the entrance where you're greeted by every dirty 30 they've got in stock, including Strohs (which is awesome fyi).They do this so you don't have to carry the really heavy stuff halfway across the store (or so I imagine, thanks for thinking of me Kenwood!) Once you've made it past the college carry-alls of Natty Ice and Keystone you're embraced by the well stocked aisles of wine, liquor and beer. Sure, it doesn't have quite the breadth of offerings like Binny's, but it also doesn't occupy an old bowling alley, so instead of crying about it, why don't you go brave the small parking lot and buy an entire trunk full of booze using their dollys so you don't have to come back as often...

20.description: Hands down, BEST prices and BEST liquor selection in town (...or around town.)  However, the parking lot is a joke.  Only holds a couple dozen cars and the parking situation makes you feel like you're going to hit a patron or another car regardless of which way you try to maneuver your vehicle.  I typically park in the residential side streets to avoid the lot altogether.  Would also be VERY nice if I could use my debit card or a credit card because I usually stock up, spending way too much to cover with the little amount of cash I usually carry.  I had to blow the dust off my checkbook cover the last time I was there because I didn't have enough cash and they wouldn't take my card.  Alas, even these things don't keep me from shopping there though, the prices are just too great.

19.description: This place is an experience. It's like watching an elaborate cuckoo clock of booze-- a small, perpetually crowded, filthy, bizarre cuckoo clock of booze. The cashiers look like they should be in a police lineup. The stock boys struggle to keep bottles on the shelves as what seems like the entire south side takes them away. I was here once on Christmas eve, and someone managed to get on the store intercom and started singing My Country Tis of Thee. Nobody batted an eye.In all seriousness this place has a wide and cheap selection, but getting it can be a complete ordeal.

33.description: + Low, low prices+ Huge Selection+ Generally friendly and helpful staff- Insanely busy around holidays- Not nearly enough parking especially on holidays. (I once had to park on a side street two blocks over west of the store and walk.  I made the mistake of letting my dad sucker me into going there on a Friday before a holiday weekend.)- They only take cash, but as long as you know that before you get there it's not a problem.Despite the negatives this truly is a 5 place.  It is well worth the trip.

2.description: Kenwood is a suburban gem! The Good: * Prices here are the lowest around, no city tax since you're in the burbs! Yes, even better than any Binny's.* The selection here is tits. Looking for something you can't find anywhere else? These people probably have it. I've never been disappointed by not being able to find what I went in for. * They always have samples. Now I do have a qualm about this because it's always things that everyone already knows about. Jack Daniels, Malibu, etc. If I'm going to be persuaded into buying something, I want it to be new and exciting! Whatever.The Bad * When you enter, it's hard to navigate through because there is an overwhelming amount of product stacked like a corn maze at the entrance. The Ugly* The parking lot. Ughhhhh it's awful. Obviously The Bad and The Ugly are not serious enough to dock any stars because this place is amazing.

34.description: Best and cheapest liquor store ever.  Holy fuck.

32.description: Low prices and great selection. My only qualm with this store is that if you go on a weekend or holiday, the parking lot is ridiculous! People always coming and going - which is a review in itself!

18.description: I grew up in the southwest 'burbs. My parents used to buy booze from Kenwood, so for the last two years we headed to Oak Lawn to pick up some beer for our holiday party. By "we" I mean myself and my girlfriend. The last time we went, we were told they did not accept state ID's as a valid form of identification. That is not legal. Even so, we went in this time and I decided to purchase the alcohol because I have a valid driver's license. I handed the cashier my license, and--with serious attitude--she demanded to see my girlfriend's license. I said she has a valid state ID, but doesn't drive. She said she could not sell a 27-year-old woman and her 27-year-old partner a 12-pack of beer because she does not have a driver's license? That is NOT legal. The cashier tells me it is an Oak Lawn policy. That is false. It is an ILLEGAL store policy. Also, I find it strange that no one else I know has had that problem. I never pull the "homophobia" card--but I'm pulling it now. We were CLEARLY discriminated against. Also, their cash-only policy is suspect. I feel like if this place were even mildly investigated--there would be some dirt. I've seen better alcohol prices at Jewel, and I really hope the Village of Oak Lawn does something about their illegal and discriminatory policy. Kenwood will never see a dime of mine--or my family's--money again. I also plan on being very vocal about my experience there.

13.description: The prices here are the lowest I have ever seen in my life.  The selection of alcohol here has everything you need.  The workers here are very knowledgeable with all types of alcohol (there are different wine and alcohol specialists).  They also have a good amount of sampling going on during the weekends.The only downside is the store and parking lot is a bit small, so it does get a bit cramped.  Last time I checked, they still don't take credit card.  Aside from that it's still worth it as I'll drive 20 min from my home to shop here.

4.description: Apothic Red Wine always on sale for $6.99 - everywhere else in the area the same bottle goes for $9.99 and up. Thank you Kenwood! Insane selection of craft beers and wines. It takes a few minutes to make up your mind with all of the options, which is a good thing.

24.description: Update - they take credit cards now - woo hoo!  Fantastic prices (especially on wine) but the layout of the entry and 1st aisle as well as the parking lot are both a large pain in the butt.  There is a 15% discount on 6 bottles of wine - not just a case!  I am the "Northside" supplier of various cases of wine due to the fact their prices are $3.00 per bottle lower than Binny's - lol!

6.description: This place has always had the best liquor pricing in the area. The parking lot is tight, but there are additional spots on the side street as well as about a dozen spaces on the north side of the building. The few problems I had with Kenwood several years ago have been addressed: they now accept credit/debit cards and their craft beer selection has grown immensely. Plus sometimes they'll have crazy-low pricing on overstock.

22.description: This place is an experience. It's like watching an elaborate cuckoo clock of booze-- a small, perpetually crowded, filthy, bizarre cuckoo clock of booze. The cashiers look like they should be in a police lineup. The stock boys struggle to keep bottles on the shelves as what seems like the entire south side takes them away. I was here once on Christmas eve, and someone managed to get on the store intercom and started singing My Country Tis of Thee. Nobody batted an eye.In all seriousness this place has a wide and cheap selection, but getting it can be a complete ordeal.

15.description: I come here for their craft beer, which they have gotten much about about organizing in the past year or so. They have the best prices in the neighborhood as well as a  great selection. My only complaint is that they keep practically none of the good stuff in the fridge... not the end of the world.  Oh yeah, and cash only is kind of a pain. However the prices here definitely make the trip here worthwhile, instead of George's, who sometimes charge $3+ more for a six pack than Kenwood does. Their beer guy knows his stuff as well.

7.description: PRE-NOTE: Paste this into your youtube browser, NOW! Händel Messiah - Hallelujah ChorusDo eeeeeet! Only this song will justify the feeling I had this past Saturday when I sauntered on in to Kenwood *It'sall good!") to stock up on some holiday spirits. After plopping down an obnoxious amount of alcohol on the counter and waiting to hear the death toll, I strained my shoulder while taking out the giant wad of cash I had extracted from my bank's nearest ATM. While I was taking in a deep breath in preparation to pull it from my wallet, I noticed a strange blinking device on the counter with a small computer screen and what seemed to be a swiping strip for a credit card. ..in Kenwood?!  I stared for a moment, captivated as people behind me started to angrily grunt to express their dissatisfaction in waiting an extra thirty seconds. I finally spoke to the cashier, eyebrows furrowed in confusion.Me: "...the hell is that?!"Cashier: "Six weeks now."Me: "What?! It's a Christmas miracle! I'll hang onto these Benjamin Franklins, if you don't mind sir...I'll take full advantage of this!"The cashier looked at me in confusion, though I'd like to think he was in awe of my personal discovery. I've been griping about Kenwood not having modern payment options since 1999! I nearly kissed him before swiping up my booze (Which they packed lovingly into a nice, easy-carry box.) Skipping out the door, I bid a Merry Christmas to the stock boys, whom stared at me with equal confusion. They do then, were in awe!Merry Christmas and happy shopping!

36.description: Are you throwing a party or are you a beer connoisseur? This place is awesome. It is the cheapest liquor store with the largest selection you will ever find. If you live south or can be near this store, it is worth the drive. You can buy in bulk and get an even better price on wine and champaign.

30.description: The hard liquor prices are the best I've seen anywhere. The tequlia selection is extensive as is the whiskey, scotch and vodka. The beer is the best priced around and there is a good selection. The wine selection is something I've looked at, but  have never bought anything, it is a very basic  selection.   The champange prices are very good as well,  again the selection is basic.We stopped in last Saturday night at about 9:50 p.m.,  and as usual it was packed. I have never been here when it isn't  crowded or packed. Bring plenty of cash.

3.description: Best selection of liquor in the area. You name it, they got it. Amazing, never-ending variety of liquor, beer & wine. This includes the high-end items like Don Julio 1942 & Shafer one point five select cabernet sauvignon. Very small parking lot, only park here if you can magically maneuver your car! Wine gift bags also sold here for you last minute gift givers.

14.description: Go-to place for liquor in this area! You won't find any other place that's cheaper than Kenwood. The downsides: it's usually quite packed (especially on weekends) so parking is a pain, space inside is pretty cramped and for as long as I've been coming here, they only take cash. However, what I love is that we can find anything we want here and we're paying less than what you'd pay at other grocery & liquor stores. My husband's favorite bargain here: they sell bundles of Monster (24 cans in all) for a seriously discounted price.

3.description: The pizza here is very good. Big slice quick. Prices are amazing. Plus I think Mario from super Mario bro's is the owner.

1.description: Worst place ever. Not only was my order all wrong but the guy I talked to about it was a complete asshole. They charged me extra for something I did not get and he didnt do anything about it. Also my pizza was not even cut right. I had to cut basically the whole pizza myself. Pizza was ok but the service here sucks. They put me on hold about 4 times. Dont recommend.

2.description: Call me a critic, but I wasn't a fan of Conte's. I came in for a slice and left disappointed. My friend who lives in Scottsdale suggested it since he knows how much I enjoy pizza. Considering it's on what I call "Pizza Road" (the area of Pulaski between 79th and 87th), I expected it to compete with places like Vito and Nick's or Waldo Cooney's. Simply put, it didn't. I left disappointed and I really can't see myself returning. I give this place two stars because the service was friendly. I can't give an opinion on the rest of the food, so please know the entire review is based on their slices. Maybe one day I'll try them again, but for now, it doesn't seem likely.

9.description: This place is awesome... Pizza is good.. But my favorite item are the buffalo style whole chicken wing I've had them 3 times this week... Pizza slices are always available and there a decent size....

10.description: You know Ive never had this places pizza however I have had there burger and fries. It was really good. They make it fresh for you right there takes about maybe 5 minutes but its worth it. This place has a small store front with a small amount of seating inside. Id call your order in ahead of time and just pick it up, because once you walk in it can be very cramped feeling. Especially when you get more then yourself in there. walking sideways and maneuvering around people to get out can be a hassle. BUT the food is worth it! have and will continue to recommend this place. Also note they do have delivery available for a 2.00 charge.

4.description: Better than most pizzas, at an affordable price!They are usually punctual with their estimated delivery time, unlike most that always take longer than what they say. Recommendable!

6.description: Pizza was really good.  Had special where I could get 1 topping jumbo pizza with these 7 huge wings and a liter of rc. All for $20. Ton of food for price.  Very happy.

11.description: The pizza from Contes is actually pretty good, my family and I have ordered from Contes on more than one occasion and have always been pleased I'll give a perfect raiting when i try something other than the 'ZA Way to go Contes keep up the good work!

5.description: The pizza is decent when ordering but the pizza by the slice is better $6 for 2 slices fries and a pop is one hell of a lunch special cheese burgers and chicken sandwiches are good also

7.description: Shoutout to Monica the cashier for being awesome. I know this a pizza place but I have to rave about their chicken nuggets, for some reason they are da bomb! Perfect breading and always crispy! Good and fair prices will always be coming here!

8.description: I absolutely love the pizza from here! It is the best pizza place to me for now, I haven't tried out Veto & Nicks pizza yet. I recommend their spicy fries and vegetable & pepperoni pizza! You will not be disappointed! The food here might seem somewhat pricy at first, but trust me, it is worth it!

0.description: The best fried chicken anywhere! Always perfectly prepared and crunchy but not greasy! Try it tonight

1.description: Food: I had the mini tip and Steak sándwich OMG the Steak reminded me of our Chicago style steak hoagie...the bomb with peppers cooked right in the meat bread on point, cheese comes with...now the tips i should have waited the 20 minutes cause i got the last of what they had ready...not much meat a Lil tough...Ambience: Nice Cozy seating, Nice and Clean!Service: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE! The lady behind counter was very nice when taking orders! I will try again!Get there!

2.description: Always anxious to try out a New Restaurant, also was referred by someone. Well here it goes: Taste is AVERAGE. Disappointed that the Price doesn't match the amount of food. EXAMPLE: 1 Beef Link, No Fries $4....6 Pieces of Rib Tips w/fries $5....the "Special" of the Day" 5 Wings w/Fries $5.99!!! Huh? How is that a "Special"? Every BBQ Spot I've ever gone to, Fries are ALWAYS apart of the order!! Not here, fries ONLY are included w/Dinners!!! The Owners were nice & thats why I gave it 3 Stars, if I could, I would've given 2 1/2. Sorry, but I have to say, I won't be rushing back!! On the flip side, their Fries are Homemade :-)

0.description: I love this place they have really good food and the owners are nice as well if you want ribs this is the place to go.

3.description: I have been going to Ms. Judith for about 4 years now. I have never been so happy and content with a stylist and weaveologist. Ms. Judith takes her time and makes sure you are completely satisfied with your style. Not only that, but unlike most weaveologist Judith is concerned with the health of your natural hair and not just trying to make $$ and have your real hair looking a hot mess. Her skills are the bomb.com! My weaves are always flat and perfectly styled. Not to mention I have never experienced loose tracks in between visits. On top of that she is a genuinely sweet person and makes you feel comfortable and right at home at her salon. Also the prices are are reasonable.  Especially with the quality of the sew in!

1.description: I loveeeeee Ms. Angela!! She's the Best kept secret!She always SLAY my hair, whether I want to wear my hair natural or a sew in, I have never been disappointed! Sew-ins are the best I've ever gotten so I only get her to do them. Plus she's really sweet and down to earth so it's easy to talk to her. You'll Thank me later!

2.description: After moving to Chicago about two years ago, one of the items on my "to-do list" was to find a great hair dresser. After many tries, failures( the weave shop-avoid at all cost), and several calls to other over-priced hair salons, I came across this gem, and the great yelp reviews certainly lead me in the right direction. I was easily able to schedule an appointment with Ms. Judith, who was kind and professional. I arrived at the shop with ease, and unlike many other salons she took me right away. Throughout the process she asked me exactly how I wanted my hair styled. After it was all done, my hair came out amazing, and after a long and tedious process I have finally found a great hair stylist!

5.description: It's later, and I'm thanking Abbio (previous reviewer)! I contacted the salon, and Ms. Angela was the one who returned my call.  I was interested in getting a quality 3 Part Vixen Sew-In for my upcoming vacation, so I didn't have time for trial & error.  I'm from NW Indiana & I called several chicago area salons, some were far too overpriced with not enough pics & reviews to warrant it.  Ms. Angela was very professional & accomodating.  The price is reasonable. She is a good listener to her clients requests.  At the appt she gave me a consultation of what could be done.  She delivered on exactly what I was asking for.  I have a very well done sew-in to allow flexibility to my kinky curly hair & extns. Angela has a pleasant way which is appreciated! A Gem. The location is fine & the salon's atmosphere is quiet.

6.description: I am very particular about my weave since I have been wearing weave for over 20 years. So many horror stories. However, Ms. Judith fulfilled all of my expectations as a stylist from professionalism, service and quality. I highly recommend her.

7.description: As in the previous review, Ms. Judith seemed to me to be a nice person but I was not at all happy with my weave.  First of all,  when I called I explained to her that I was a weave virgin and didn't know what type, what length, what, kind, how many packs., etc.   She was really no help at all with anything except to buy two bags, which I found out later was way too much hair for my head.   The hair was way too long for me and I asked her to cut it which she did, but it wasn't a very good job.  I spent almost $200  for virgin remy hair and I think that I might have gotten a bad batch of hair.   It tangled easily, was way too heavy and when I called her to tell her I was not happy, she told me to come back in and she cut it a little more.   After a few days I just could not stand it anymore and I called her to tell her I wanted her to take the hair out and I never heard from her.    It was a very expensive $350.00 mistake for me.  I will never go back to her again.  The least she could have done was apologize for the bad experience.

8.description: I was referred to Ms Judith by my mother in law. I  admired how her sew in looked so natural and the styles always fit her face.Ms Judith is a master weaver if you have bald spots or very thin hair she can install a sew in that will look like you were born with that good hair. Ms Judith keeps current with the styles and always offers you information on quality hair and techniques on maintenance for your own hair and the weave.Ms Judith is the go to person for that special event that is why I had her do my weave for my wedding. She is an expert stylist and she can cut any style as long as you have a picture. You can browse through books that she always keeps on hand in her shop pick out a style and walk out of her salon looking exactly like the picture.That is why ms Judith will always be my stylist and ladies if you want it done right go to fabulous hair salon and let Ms Judith make you look and feel fabulous it always works for me.

0.description: after deciding to stop cutting my hair (at a barbershop) and letting it grow, I took on the daunting task of finding a stylist to help me do that. I wasn't sure if I wanted a weave or braids for protective styling. After searching through countless Yelp reviews, I came upon Faboulous Hair. I made an appt and met with Denise. Wonderful Denise. We started out with a weave,then twists and now braids. The weave was very good,but I'm old school,so I think that the braids and twists are great. And so is she. My hair is continually growing and looks and feels good at the same time. Also I don't know how important this is to anyone else, but I always feel comfortable and welcome when I'm there. So if any one f these reasons appeal to you. Denise is just a phone call away.

4.description: I love Ms. Angela. She been doing my hair for years and I'm never disappointed. She does the best sew-ins, quick weaves, natural hair, curls, bobs, braids and ect... You name it she does it. Trust me, you will be satisfied!! Her conversations are the best and she's very professional. Reasonable prices. Can not get no better then that for me.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

0.description: This place is excellent if you're planning on hosting a big party.  They sell most things (napkins, plates, cookies, pretty much everything) in bulk.  It's nice because you don't need a membership and their prices are reasonable.

1.description: It was ok pizza ...feel like there pizza a couple years ago tasted better but I can't complain because it's super cheap

0.description: How can you not give these guys five stars? The food is not only cheap, but incredibly tasty, which is a rare thing. Their pan pizza isn't quite deep dish, but it's still amazing. The workers have been nothing but friendly and always greet me with a smile. I recommend this place to anyone who wants delicious pizza without the expensive pizza price. This place is truly a hidden gem. In a neighborhood that features a Waldo Cooney's and the famous Nick and Vito's, it's easy to understand why this place isn't as widely talked about. But don't just take my word for it. This place was well worth my 5/5 rating.

The ice cream here is great. Only place I know that does ice cream how they used to do it in the "old days" or that's what I'm told. Big sundaes, banana splits, milk shakes, malts, and turtle sundaes, etc...My personal favorite thing is the chili. It's a bit sweet compared to other chili, but it's really well done. A bowl is only $3.50; I'd recommend eating it without beans, as chili with beans isn't real chili in my opinion. The burgers, hotdogs, and sandwiches are okay but nothing special.Good place to go out with your friends after a movie or take a girl out on a date for a reasonable price.The service is always fast, but be patient if there's a lot of a seated table there is usually only 3-4 people working at a time.

3.description: It seems they do not pay attention on taking orders at all. Five times I had to reorder because they kept making mistakes. Either they brought me my burrito with sour cream when I didn't ask for, or brought it with chicken instead of steak, or brought the wrong drink. I was fed up with it that I just left without any regards to let them rectify themselves. Never again should I step foot into here. Disaster of a business. Should have read the reviews on here prior to going.

1.description: My father and I went here for lunch a couple years ago and we soon realized it was a big mistake. First of all, the tacos here are literally about the size of the palm of your hand. Second, the meat in the tacos was burnt to the point where it didn't even taste like meat anymore. And third, the price of the food is bs, for the same price I can get a real taco and a very good tasting one at Paco's Tacos (which is located on 60-something Pulaski. In conclusion, I don't really recommend this place to anyone, unless you like burnt meat.

2.description: I also don't understand the one star reviews unless someone got burned here.  I've been going to this place scores of times since it opened (the site used to be a Jr's hot dogs in the 80s).   I've never had a bad experience.  The food is fresh and cooked in front of you.  The staff is friendly.  The food is tasty.  The meat is not rubbery.  The selection is good. The horchata is flavourful.    The salsa is top 10 in the area.  What more do you want?  This place is very good, even with all the other options on the So side.

0.description: Aww man...I thought this would be my first "first" review, if that makes sense..Probably not.Also, I'm not hispanic but, Taqueria el Taco makes no sense to me, "taco reastaurant the taco?" plus the addition of English "To Go" ?? I'm at a loss for words here..Anyway,  I've gotten delivery from this place a couple times because its near the hospital where I'm at.1st time: "holy crap, they have a TWO FOOT burrito? Let's get that"  About 5 pounds of steak and beans, not much else, but hey, it didn't give me or my burrito partner diarrhea so thumbs up with that experience2nd time: TETTG: "Sorry we're closed"Me: "Really? because your take out menu says you're open till 10"TETTG: "We're closing early.  Sorry its been really hard because of the economy"Me: "Really? Because We're about to PAY you for food"TETTG: "Hold on let me talk to my manager... ok, we'll take your order"We get the order and everything is TERRIBLE, slopped together, soggy mess, tasted badI DIDN'T FINISH MY FOODI ALWAYS FINISH MEXICAN FOOD!So I dunno, we kinda feel bad for the place and some of our staff has liked the food from there, but it was just horrendous that one time, so I can't give them Yelp Love.Sorry TETTG

4.description: Wow one reviewer out of five loves this dump and he gets all whiny, OK so maybe you're not a liar but instead a person with horrible taste in Mexican food.

0.description: This is the only DD that makes dark roast perfect every single time!!! The staff is very friendly,keep up the good work!!!!!!

3.description: So I was told to get my daughter's 2nd Birthday cake from this place because it blows all others out of the water, we were going to do a simple cake from a small bakery around the corner from us, So glad we came to this place. Owner was phenomenal and we ordered a half sheet thinking more people would show instead of the 18 that showed, needless to say everyone left with a very good flavor in their mouth and ranted and raved about how good the cake was and everyone took home a giant hunk of Audreys happy 2nd Caillou Birthday Cake...Thank You and I have a bakery for life...(still cant wait to try that Pistachio cake) PS if your going to leave a comment about how great the butter cookies are, you really should leave more than 3 or 3.5 stars, in my opinion 3 stars means average...this place is a 5 star establishment!

1.description: Great service, had chocolate covered beacon for the first time and it was amazing. We ordered a cake for a baptism and it was reasonably priced and it was very delicious, everyone loved it. The owner was a very nice. We will defiantly be ordering from here in the future....

0.description: This is a tiny, (most likely family owned) friendly and cute bakery. The owner was so sweet, and helpful. I purchased the popular butter cookies, and they were so delicious! They reminded me of my childhood school treats. She's quite the talented one. They also make cakes, and other tasty pastries. Highly recommended!

2.description: There are a lot of bakeries in our neighborhood (Garfield Ridge) but nothing compares to the cakes you will get from The Cake Walk. The whipped cream is out of this world, tastes almost like ice cream. The cake layers are so fresh and delicious every time that it's worth the drive to get their cakes. I highly recommend this bakery for any occasion, you will not be disappointed.

5.description: 3.5 starsCame here because I was craving the butter cookies they served us during the CPS elementary school years. Everyone claims to know the recipe, but I am not a cook/baker by any means, and didn't have the patience to try and make them on my own.The Cake Walk is a very small establishment located between a pizza place and another store, so don't fret if you don't see it when driving by...it's there.There were a variety of pastries and cookies inside that all looked tasty, but my mind was focused on the butter cookie...and what a huge cookie it was (not to mention reasonably priced for .99 cents)! The lady behind the counter (her mom was a CPS cafeteria worker who knew the proper recipe) was very nice and friendly.I took the cookie home to warm it up, and it was actually pretty good and close to how I remembered them tasting as a kid. It had more of a shortbread butter taste instead of just butter, but still good nonetheless (especially with a glass of milk).Glad I found this place for my CPS butter cookie cravings, which I am glad aren't often due to how loaded in fat they are lol!

6.description: Amazing cakes! Not the most artistic decorations, so keep it simple. Never been disappointed

7.description: I stopped in here today and picked up a piece of tiramisu for under $4.  It was definitely the best I've had.  The owner was also very nice, check it out if you get a chance!

8.description: UGH!  This place is soooo good and not that easy for me to get to!  I wish it were closer to me (or do I as I would probably get heavy!).  Keep up the good work - cakes and cookies are delish!  Love the Cake Walk and the owner, Mary Jane, is very nice.  They have been around for a long time and I have had their wedding cakes, strawberry cakes, peanut butter cookies (sooo very good!) and their filled cakes - NEVER been disappointed!  So worth the drive (20 minutes for me, not that bad) and price (more expensive than Sams but in line with other bakeries and really - Sams cakes do not feel or taste the way their cakes do so yes, real butter and real sugar and made fresh to order will cost a little more and you will not be disappointed.  Walk over to the original Cake Walk in Chicago!

9.description: Decided to try the CPS butter cookies that other yelpers are raving about. When I got there I was met with very friendly service. Even though my children were touching everything (not the goodies, of course). The woman at the counter was very patient and understanding. So yeah they are the best. While there I decided to buy there cupcakes, double chocolate cake and the pumpkin pie. Everything looked so good and the prices were very reasonable, also. I tasted the chocolate cupcake with strawberry frosting and let me tell you it actually tasted like chocolate cake and strawberry frosting. The other cupcake was the meringue I believe not to sure since I did not ask what flavor it is. But it totally tasted like lemon to me very fresh and moist. I gotta order cupcakes from this place in the future and if there cupcakes are any indication of the cakes than I gotta order cakes, too. The double chocolate cake is so good. I right away compared prices with Sam's chocolate cake and it is the same. The butter cookies are very good and so I am a very happy customer. I finally found a place with real flavors instead of generic ones.

10.description: Everytime I order a cake from The Cake Walk for one of my kids birthdays, I ALWAYS get someone asking me "Where did you get the cake from, it is so good!" Now it's at a point where I'll get a phone call from my MIL or SIL asking me to order a cake for 'so and so's' birthday. I have to admit, I have the number programed into my cell phone! LOLNot only are the cakes yummy, but the brownies, the cookies, oh my. It seriously doesn't help my weight loss situation. The prices for the cakes (and there are all different sizes) are really reasonable too. In fact, for my last daughter's baptism, I ordered 2 cakes.The owner of the store is almost always there and she is super friendly and so sweet, along with the other lady working with her. I always come out of that place smiling!!

4.description: The whip cream cake is to die for.  I've been coming here for years and just thought I should give it 5 stars.

1.description: Billy's is out of control good. For the yuppies out there don't judge this book by its cover cuz you will miss out. There turkey Tuesday is amazing. There breakfast is out of this world I don't no how they do it but they make ham better then anyone else in the game I only wish there  were more stars to give this place it doesn't seem fare only giving 5 because there honestly on a different level

2.description: This is the epitome of a South Side Diner.  Not many of these left; you simply have to experience this place!  A very wide ranging and low cost menu, most of which is scratch made by owner Jim.  Be sure to sit at the counter so Linda can give you more trouble than you can handle -- great entertainment!  And she will remember exactly what you ordered the last time you were in.  Wonderful traditional breakfasts.  The Daily Specials are excellent, especially the meatloaf and the spaghetti.  Ham off the bone in the omelets.  No legible sign on the building at the corner of Columbus and Lawndale.  Open only on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and a half-day on Saturday.  You can become part of genuine American treasure -- you will absolutely love it.  But please don't take my seat at the counter!

0.description: Very friendly and food made to order and tasted awesome!!  Reminds me of Mel's Diner/Alice from back in the 70's

3.description: Eh, it was good enough. I had HUGE servings of food, so I was very happy to get more than what was paid for. However, the service is quite slow. I had to ask repeatedly for napkins, more coffee, butter, coffee creamer, etc. However, our breakfast was delicious and does exactly what a greasy spoon is supposed to. I really enjoyed the pancakes I shared with someone else. They are big and fluffy, not gummy, or cold or hot. They stayed warm a long time and I am really happy the food was of good quality, but the service is why I am giving two stars. I don't agree with the last person's review, the coffee was pretty bland. It was enough for me to finish the food with though.I had the southside special, which is two hot links, hash browns, and eggs. I made a good choice, but I should have asked for grits as well. Oh well!We waited over 25 minutes for a check...not good. DO NOT come here if you are in a hurry.

1.description: Just roll on by, unless you're looking for the real deal greasy spoon diner experience. Disgusting biscuits! They taste like the dough was never actually cooked but put out in the sun to dry. For what it is, it's too expensive. All the servers are older women, so there's a 50/50 chance you'll get sassed. The music is to their taste as well. Cable news, bootlegger hanging out by the register and crusty hot-sauce bottles all contribute to the ambiance. Ride down Western a bit farther and you'll find better options.

2.description: I don't know how  standard breakfast items  turn out not tasting good but it happened here. I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon, o'brien potatoes and pancakes. The potatoes were a huge disappointment. They had absolutely no flavor. The eggs were kind of runny and also flavorless. The pancakes and coffee were the only things that were done well. The pancakes were big and fluffy and the coffee had a nice balance to the flavor -not too bold but not too mild either. I know it's not a fancy schmancy joint so I guess....

0.description: Not enough people to serve you but overall a good place for some good breakfast on the go . Or just kick back and talk to the locals.

1.description: Service here is horrible. The employees are extremely rude and roll their eyes at you.

0.description: Hot and ready? No.  Pizza was hot but not ready.  We had to wait for it to be made.  I was surprised because it was around dinnertime and figured they would plan ahead.  Whatever, can't beat it for $5.

3.description: This harolds is way too pricey compared to some other harolds. I paid 7.34 for 4 wings. They also are very slow. I called in ahead of time and still had to wait roughly 10 minutes for four wings to get ready. Keep in mind I called 15 minutes prior to my arrival. The girl at the register was very pushy. I initially ordered 3 wings over the phone and when I got there she said she rung me up for 4 because it was cheaper. I'm not sure what made her feel that she was at liberty to modify my order. The only reason why this gets 3 stars and not two is because the facility is clean and the food was decent. I've still had better harolds. I'll stick to the one on 93rd and ashland.

1.description: Nice crispy chicken. The shrimp and catfish is nice and tasty.

2.description: Best Harold's I've ever been to. Good food always fresh and fast. I love this place!!

0.description: I was craving Harold's last night so I called up even though they were bout to close the lady Alicia said she would wait for us. I ordered a chicken breast with wings extra mild sauce and light salt and pepper. Came out really good flavorful and fresh off the fryer. They even threw in free frys. I definitely recommend this location it's very clean and has a nice little dine in area. Friendly staff and great food you can't lose

12.description: I had a wonderful experience the other day that I wish could happen for every shopping experience at a hardware store.  I called up Lowe's first to see if they had a part that I needed.  I wasn't sure what department I needed so I had the operator transfer me to the right department when I explained the part to her.  I told the guy in the department the generic term of what I was looking for, a double gang low voltage plate and he found it, told me the price, which aisle, and what color the box was.  I drove to the store, followed the guy's instructions, found the part, went to the cashier (no wait, which was nice), paid for the part, got a nice and friendly thank you from the cashier and was on my way.

3.description: I experienced the worst customer service here than any other location. I wanted to do a phone order and was told that they did not do that at this store. Which due to numerous purchases knew that was not the case. Manager got involved and shared the same lie. He tried to tell me that each store's policy was different from one another which was another lie because this is a corp owned chain.

1.description: I have always had good times with Lowes. They almost always have what I'm looking for except spray paint (city law prohibits them). Anytime I have had to return anything it has been hassle free. The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because the evening shift at times is filled with young people who don't know there job. So best bet is to go during the day or afternoon.

2.description: This store has no idea as to the meaning of customer service. Gives Lowes a bad rep. Have taken my lawn mower for repairs TWICE and both times Ive had the most awful experience tracking the status and its whereabouts. I call and am placed on hold multiple times for at least 20 minutes. Employees, and managers for that matter, need retraining!

9.description: Not trusting any of the big box stores, I always call ahead to make sure things are in stock.  Seems like they always have what I need in stock, and their staff is very helpful.

10.description: I really wish I could like this place because Home Depot doesn't exactly excel in the customer service department and Mendard's isn't bad just a little cheap when it comes to certain merchandise.  So we came here looking for patio furniture because Home Depot and Menard's didn't have what we were looking for.  We did find a nice patio set and the salesperson was nice enough to help us with some additional items we needed for their upkeep.  We made our purchase and scheduled the furniture to be delivered & assembled in a few days.But that's where the "great" customer service ended.  I had to take the day off from work on the delivery day because they don't do evening deliveries. And that was okay because I figure this is a big deal after all.  But when the furniture arrived, the delivery guys were nice but told us assembling the furniture wasn't included in the delivery and said Lowe's lied to us.  But, they still helped assemble it anyway and that's when we found out one of legs on the conversation chair was bent in half.  We complained to the delivery guys about this and they said to call Lowe's and have them delivery me a replacement.So I called Lowe's and explained everything to them.  At first they asked why the delivery guys didn't return the damaged furniture.  Really.  After being put on hold for almost a half hour, I finally got to speak to the manager, Jose, who was rude.  He didn't apologize at all nor offered any credit for having to replace said chair.  The only thing he offered me was to replace it which would mean I'd have to take another day off work.  When I explained this to him he said that was my problem.This is really unfortunate, because I felt up until the point that we bought the furniture, Lowe's would become my new Go To place for buying all my home improvement needs.  But not so.  First rule in business, always take care of the customer.

13.description: I heart hardware stores.. I have a problem with the smell of freshly cut wood.. I can admit it  lolGreat store, good friendly folks and always have what I need and some stuff I want ;)

16.description: Excellent customer service!  We needed a window air conditioner on short notice in time for the latest heatwave.  We found one on line, ordered it by phone.  Not only was it delivered the next day during the promised time-frame but for the same price brought upstairs to our second floor apartment.  We chose this retailer because of these customer service touches.  Other places were not able to respond as quickly or as thoroughly.

6.description: Do not purchase an appliance from this location!  If your appliance needs repair you be unbelievably disapointed and frustrated.  After waiting SIX weeks for a part to come in for my washing machine, I am still without one!  Lowes contracts a company called All Star Appliace, located in Lincolnwood, and they are the WORST!  I have never experienced such appaling customer service.  Any attempt to get Lowes to help has been unsuccessful!  I am at a loss as to how to resolve this situation.  I hope I can save someone the hassle  and frustration - take your hard earned money elsewhere!!

15.description: Holy crap I walked into Lowe's to get a new storm door and to my astonishment when I got to the door dept.  some asked me if I needed any help! better yet not only did he help me he was knowledgeable and helped me get  the door I needed. I also went to Lawn dept to shop for a Weed whacker and once again got a very helpful employee,, What's with this place? The last time I was in Home Dept I had to shoot a flare gun to get someone's attention! I will definitely will come back to this store over HD and Menards

0.description: went in for roofing supplies near closing and the Hispanic girl in that dept. was extremely helpful, then I went to pay and the cashier Juan was not just extremely handsome, but very cooperative trusted his judgment on A beverage and although I was making a mess at the soda coolers he was considerate fast and attentive great customer service all around in this store DONT CHANGE ANYTHING!

5.description: Bought a house, flipper, he did things pretty cheaply.  We just could not get the hot water heater to work, and it was brand new.  I looked it up online, saw that it's a piece of crap that people continuous sink money into plus GE's help line was no help at all, so we opted to sink whatever repair money into getting a new one.  Our bad:  it was a Sunday, but we knew going in what we were getting into.  We had no choice though.Only store we could find a well rated hot water heater in stock with someone who could install it same day, so that's why we went.  The sales guy was very nice, very helpful.  The sweetheart said well, since we're here let's get a lawnmower too.  Ok fine.  The sales guy there was super nice and helpful too.  Even the checkout girl was very nice.  Overall, I'm not a huge Lowes lover (it's like a home improvement center extra-lite), just a personal choice, but we had a good experience here.The bad:  the installation guy.  Yes it was a Sunday, yes we paid nearly as much as the heater to have it installed (ugh), yes it was stupid hot out.  He showed up and while I kept the dog at bay, the hubs dealt with the guy who appeared to be very very grumpy.  The guy said he couldn't find street parking, could he park in front of our garage in the alley.  Sure, why not, everyone else does it up and down the alley.On the plus side, he got the job done in a speedy manner, maybe 45 minutes tops.  But every time I looked out the window and saw him, he was pissy.  My hubs even said he was pretty grumpy.  So, the guy is leaving and says hey wait, I got a $150 ticket for parking in the alley, um....help me out?  My sweets was a tad confused as no one in our alley ever gets a ticket and some folks park out there all day, so he said um, take the old water heater with you.  Thankfully he didn't give the guy cash as, upon reflection, we both think he was trying to pull a fast scam for some extra pocket money.The store called a bajillion times to see how happy we were with our purchase, blah blah.  We always missed their calls and we didn't have a chance to call back.  But, I wish they hadn't called as many times as they did -- it was annoying.So, decent enough store, beware of hot water heater installation guy, know you'll get a trillion post-purchase phone calls.

11.description: The staff here is proactive and in a good way they approach you to be helpful.  They're knowledgable enough to suggest ways to maximize the value of what you purchase.  The location is well organized and easy to navigate.

8.description: I wish I could give this Lowes lower than 1 star my experience here was the worst I would NEVER recommend anyone to shop here. I purchased a floor model refrigerator for a good price exactly what I was looking for, free delivery and haul away and It would be delivered Monday I purchased on Saturday night. Too good to be true I got a call Sunday saying my item was damaged when taking it off the floor but they found me a new one from another store I just had to wait until Wednesday for delivery. Tuesday night came I received another call saying that the second fridge was damaged too and I can come in and get a refund. Finally Thursday after the manager had another associate call me to offer a different fridge for the same price I received a new fridge but a completely different one the one I wanted wasn't available anymore and was not the same as what I wanted but I needed a fridge. After calling another day and speaking to the appliance manager I was told that my fridge was not damaged it was over sold so obviously I was being lied to all along. I was told Management would return my call two different times and still to this day I have not received a call. This store clearly has poor management and very poor customer service skills.

4.description: they don't even deserve a star Worst customer assistance ever , i asked for help with custom cutting the plywood i waited 10 min than i asked someone else , was told to hold on while they paged another person than i called the store while i waited in the store and no help after 6min a guy comes and says i will be back with a cart and takes for ever i was standing there for a total of 20min being pushed off from one to the other, i just left; ur better off going to home depot!

14.description: This review is primarily for the kitchen department, and specifically for the wonderful kitchen designer, Melissa, who deserves a raise.  She helped me in 2009 when I wanted to redo my kitchen.  Fast forward to September 2011, when I came back and got very serious and committed.  (I had a 10x10' kitchen that I couldn't take anymore: A kitchen with barely any installed cabinetry and countertop, a portable dishwasher, stained & chipped laminate, oven next to the wall, no space-saving microwave, and a fridge that was a mistake purchase for such a small room.)  We drew up a plan and I knew where I wanted everything.  She helped me and gave me extremely honest opinions and input about what was really necessary.  Thankfully this is a newer store and it had the latest cabinetry.  No old stuffy cabinets & old kitchens here!  She led me to a wonderful cabinetry company called Shenandoah, with a limited lifetime warranty.  They have almost all the features of Kraftmaid without the high, premium price.  Don't get me wrong, Shenandoah will still set you back.  I had pages and pages of written questions in person and I must have called this lady 15 times.  She not only answered all my questions, she got back to me in a timely matter with pertinent info as if she was my own personal assistant.  That's customer service!  She's honest and gave me all the insider info I could have asked for.  And she led me to the right decisions in choosing an independent contractor, down to tiny decisions like choosing a garbage disposal.  She is truly a gem!After ordering, she was there every step of the way.  She was there when there was a question on trimming a panel from the installer and she was there when I had a claim for the cabinet company to send a few new parts and cabinet pieces.  The cabinetry was by far the most expensive part of the remodel and somehow, it was the easiest decision once I found the right store and the right designer!  A few months later, we bought the most beautiful, realistic, artificial Christmas tree in their Christmas department.  It was a pleasurable experience.  Sometimes you end up paying a little more at Lowe's than Home Depot, but it's an infinitely better experience.   A well organized, well lit, customer friendly store.  I will be shopping at Menards and Lowe's in the future.  Thanks to the kitchen department and Melissa, I have a beautiful new & functional maple kitchen that I will enjoy for a very long time.  Thank you sincerely.

7.description: I'm a big fan of Lowe's its kind of like Menards and Home Depot in one Hybrid store.  It's big inside, and they have a lot of merchandise like Homedepot, but its also nice, bright, and organized like Menards is.  This location is near me, so I've been in here a few times.  The customer service is really good, just about every employee who walked past me either said hello, or asked if I needed any help.

1.description: Good Food.

9.description: This is one of the worst Mexican Restaurant places I have ever went too and I don't say that to be mean but because it is a fact!If you check the reviews from this place many are from 2010 and 2011 and we all know that a Restaurant can go downhill if management changes or cooks!We sat down and was greeted by the cashier/waitress who placed two bottles of salsa and chips!  Yes you read right bottles, are you telling me that as a customer who is sitting down to dine we can't get at least some fresh salsa in a bowl so that we can dip our chips instead of squirt the pre-made salsa that has been sitting in a bottle for who knows how long.After we places our order we were given some tomato soup with noodles that was very bland so we squeezed some lime in it a tip we got from Cesar's and that helped give it a bit of a zing to an other wise lack luster cup of soup.My friend ordered the Burrito what was funny to us is that the picture displayed rice and beans with the Burrito we were quickly told that was just a picture and if we wanted the rice and beans that would be extra!  Now that is not on the menu where the Burrito actually is but they do have it in the inside of the menu.They need new menus because I want to look at a picture just to be told that isn't what I get and if it is true then mark it some place so that I know right off the back!When the platter came out it had a pretty good looking Burrito on it(looks can be deceiving) some dry day old looking rice and beans!  The steak was flavorless and fatty the best thing about the Burrito was the tortilla it was wrapped because it wasn't what was in the Burrito. My friend ate most of her fussing the entire time lol, saying they better be glad she hadn't ate all day but the food really didn't agree with her she was feeling sick by the time she got home that night!I ordered the steak taco salad again the presentation was amazing I couldn't wait to dive right into my dish and all I got was a disappointing heap of unappetizing mess.  I ended up just eating around the salad and tossing the rest away.  I couldn't even force myself to eat that unappetizing meal!I was also disappointed that with the Groupon you only order non-alcoholic drinks which although they weren't that expensive it left us scrambling for other things to purchase.The Groupon is also for dine-in onlySo, my friend got the rice water I believe it was called and she said it was good!I got an avocado it was fresh and a sprite that was the only thing that was eatable in my opinion.My warning to people is this before you buy any Groupon and you check the reviews make sure they are recent otherwise you maybe sorely disappointed as we were from the Fajita Mexican Restaurant who shouldn't say they are authentic!Yuck!

23.description: This place has great mexican food, I kinda miss the beef stand that was here before but glad to see someone invested in this neighborhood and opened another food joint, burritos, tacos and fajitas are all great, prices are really good too for the quality of food you get.

12.description: I just saw someone's review stating that they are selling Restaurant.com coupons but not honoring them because of new management. I want to stress how they really don't like coupons! The waitresses seems angrier than normal when you tell them you have a coupon, (I have bought Groupons a couple of times) and they will go on to give you the rules: 1. Does not include alcohol (which I was not ordering because I had children with me). 2. Cannot be used with any specials, (which means if you are ordering any special, you cannot use the coupon, or you have to pay full price for your item, weather or not you are spending the required amount besides the special!) and most of all they want you know 3. Tips are not included and you should be paying a tip based on the full amount BEFORE the coupon. I am normally a good tipper when I get good service, but I don't appreciate being barked at by the staff. If they don't like the coupons, stop selling them! Like I said previously, I have not, and will not be back!

21.description: I tried this place after getting a good deal through restaurant.comWe got there on a Friday evening about 7PM and there were a handful of people there so we were seated right away. Here's what we had:Chips and Salsa (complimentary): salsa could have been spicierFideo soup (complimentary): good tasteHorchata: perfect not too sweet, not too watery, not too thickCoke in a glass bottle: ahhhh! no comment necessary I thinkFish Taco dinner: awesome tilapia tacos with cabbage on top, rice and beansSteak Fajitas: I didn't try this but they looked an smelled deliciousChicken taco: a lot of chicken! nice and softTres leches cake: just good...nothing I hadn't tastedThe portions are huge, and the tacos are overstuffed with the meat choice as well as the fajitas. The waitress was very nice and patient when my little rascal decided to wander around the restaurant. Decor is nice and plasma TV. I'd definately go back for those fish tacos, not too many places you can find these.

16.description: My wife and I love this place. The food has always been awesome and the prices can not be beat. The Good: The food. I love the Carne Asada dinner (which is on special on Saturdays). I could eat it once a week. The rice and beans are also very good. My wife loves the Taco Salad, which she substitutes the rice for meat. The soup they provide for you at no cost is also very good. The prices are very good as well. These days it is close to impossible to get a good diner for 2 for under 20$ and this place breaks that rule. The Bad: No liquor license. The only thing that makes a great Mexican diner better is a Margarita. Best Mexican food in the area. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

17.description: I tried this place after getting a good deal through restaurant.comWe got there on a Friday evening about 7PM and there were a handful of people there so we were seated right away. Here's what we had:Chips and Salsa (complimentary): salsa could have been spicierFideo soup (complimentary): good tasteHorchata: perfect not too sweet, not too watery, not too thickCoke in a glass bottle: ahhhh! no comment necessary I thinkFish Taco dinner: awesome tilapia tacos with cabbage on top, rice and beansSteak Fajitas: I didn't try this but they looked an smelled deliciousChicken taco: a lot of chicken! nice and softTres leches cake: just good...nothing I hadn't tastedThe portions are huge, and the tacos are overstuffed with the meat choice as well as the fajitas. The waitress was very nice and patient when my little rascal decided to wander around the restaurant. Decor is nice and plasma TV. I'd definately go back for those fish tacos, not too many places you can find these.

10.description: Absolute worst service and management I've ever seen.  Mind you, this was 6 months ago and I'm just now getting around to the review.  The manager actually had the gall to sit at a table, serve his family food and drinks while the rest of us patrons sat around hungry and thirtsty, watching all this, because the only poor waitress there was so busy taking tables AND answering the phone.  It was to the point where all us PAYING customers started conversing with one another loudly about what a joke the place was. He could of cared less as long as his darling wife had her margarita.  BTW, we ordered queso fundido...what a joke unless you like cheese globs that resemble brains.

5.description: I love it! My last day for a Groupon so I came with the partner at around 8:45 (they close at 10). I asked the young lady if these are the same owners from a few years ago and she said no. The place obviously changed due to it not being a "fast food" order and sit type of restaurant that it was a few years ago. My partner use to frequent the place since he worked not far from here. He also stated that the ambieance seems to of changed also. Newer Mexican looking and very authentic furniture, art and all together I had the Caldo de Res (Beef soup) and can I just add that the vegetables in this soup were giant! They also give you a small sampling of their homemade caldo de conchas (shell shaped soup) I still ate it!The food was really good and considering I thought I would'nt like it due to some reviews (and this is why I don't read reviews until after I try a place), I was really quite pleased. This is defintely super real (not authentic) Mexican food at its near best. Tortillas may not have been home made, but the food hit hard and just stood out. I also had a Corona (regualr sized) for $1.99 since it seems they have drink specials at any given time. See their menu's.All in all, Iam also happy that they have gift certificates available. $40 for $50 worth of food? Awesome. They also have smaller denominations. Oh and it  did not matter if liquor isn['t used with groupon since out of pocket after Groupon was used, I only paid $4.56 for dinner for two and take out of large concha soup!

11.description: Good food...the huevos rancheros weren't spicy enough and had too much pepper.  I would still recommend this place and I will be back. By the way,  the horchata was delicious.

22.description: My wife and I love this place. The food has always been awesome and the prices can not be beat. The Good: The food. I love the Carne Asada dinner (which is on special on Saturdays). I could eat it once a week. The rice and beans are also very good. My wife loves the Taco Salad, which she substitutes the rice for meat. The soup they provide for you at no cost is also very good. The prices are very good as well. These days it is close to impossible to get a good diner for 2 for under 20$ and this place breaks that rule. The Bad: No liquor license. The only thing that makes a great Mexican diner better is a Margarita. Best Mexican food in the area. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

0.description: Groupon : Pros ample parking , friendly waitress , Burritos descent enough meat but somewhat bland , beans and rice pretty good , margarita was good  fried pork taste like chitterlings , fair chips and gauc was bland . Worth the trip if you can get a Groupon

20.description: Best Mexican restaurant in the area... and I've tried most of them since I moved to Oak Lawn 5 years ago. Friendly staff, reasonable prices, and great food. Highly recommended.

19.description: Best Mexican restaurant in the area... and I've tried most of them since I moved to Oak Lawn 5 years ago. Friendly staff, reasonable prices, and great food. Highly recommended.

2.description: This hidden gem on 86 st and Cicero ave Is a very well-kept secret. They have the best Pozole every day of the week. On the weekends they make in my opinion the best menudo in Chicagoland. It's meaty and has a whole palate pleasing taste. They also make shrimp soup which will be my next purchase. Prices are reasonable and the eat-in part of their restaurant is clean and inviting. Try it for yourself. You won't be disappointed!!!

18.description: Don't know what happened. It used to be great but I think there is new owners. Lucky Burrito is much better.

13.description: Ok, it was Mexican food.  Nothing knocked our socks off.  The food was hot and fresh.  I ordered the chicken burrito dinner and my wife got the chicken enchilada dinner.  We drank horchata and everything was delicious.However, we were most impressed with how nice the staff was.  The servers weren't trying to be nice because they knew it was appropriate, or working on a generous tip, they simply seemed like genuinely pleasant people.  This made the food taste even better.

4.description: Ok, so I've driven by this place with the burnt out sign a million times and finally decided to try it when I saw they were on groupon.  If you don't have a groupon, don't waste your time.  First of all they bring you chips but no salsa.  Salsa is extra.  What?!  They did bring you soup that was pretty good.  I ordered chicken tacos and my boyfriend had steak fajitas.  I was impressed at how much rice and beans they gave you.  However, the actual entrees were disappointing.  First of all, I don't particularly like spicy foods and this was too bland for me.  There was just no taste to it.  My boyfriend said his fajitas were not much better.  The worst part was the bill.  Without the groupon it would of been $30.  $30 for two drinks and two crappy meals!? We could of gone to a restaurant that was nice with actually good food for that price!  I won't be back, with or without a groupon.

6.description: My burrito was huge and it was good!  Rice and beans good as well.  Waitress was sweet and fast.  I would recommend if you want decent fast Mexican food at a fair  price.

15.description: It is not a very comfortable place - hard benches.  It looks like a converted Taco Bell.  I knew I was in trouble when the salsa came in squeeze bottles.  The red and green salsas were tasteless and the chips were hard.  My dinner came with a cup of vegetable soup - the best part of my meal.  The steak fajitas were flavorless and the refrained beans were watery.  I had the fried ice cream for dessert.  It was more like a sundae as it is served in a tortilla shell.  It was also a let down.  The shell had too much cinnamon for my taste and the scoop of ice cream was small.  The only thing good about this place is the waitstaff - friendly and attentive.

7.description: This place has the worst service around I definitely will never go back again . I always knew the service wasn't good but I kept goin because the fajitas were good..But the last 2 or 3 times I've been here the food was garbage ...never again

8.description: The only thing I like from this place are the fajitas. The service is horrible. They won't even be busy and they still ignore and just stand there behind the counter talking. The only reason I go there is because they have a groupon but once that stops, so will my service.

3.description: The food sucks!!! Very disappointing. No flavor what so ever. Meat is hard and the lettuce taste funny.

14.description: This review is based on giving this place two tries.I once stopped in here late at night craving a pork burrito to go. The gentleman behind the counter was really nice and took my order.  I get home and my burrito is sloppy and falling apart and extremely soggy. Now I know your first thought is that the drive home may have hampered the burrito, but that cannot be the case as I live 7 blocks away. It takes me literally 90 seconds to get home, and 2 minutes later I'm munching. Nonetheless, it was quite difficult to tackle.Second time, I ate here with a couple a friends and ordered a burrito. Same result. You want tacos and burritos? Just go to Zaca Tacos on 71st and Pulaski. It's 10 minutes away, cheaper, and tastier. Even my Mexican friend said this place is no good. I guess if you don't know any better, you can hand this place all the stars you want.

0.description: As if I haven't failed at enough things throughout my dismal life, I have chosen small scale agriculture to "drop the ball on".    After giving botany some  work early in my twenties( let's just say it rhymes with "flannibas"), i thought I would give harmless eatable vegetables a go this year.    Decided to give different hot peppers, fresh herbs, and some cabbage a try this year.  I  was also very interested in growing my own potatoes this year as well.  Most places had the peppers, and cabbage but no potato seeds( a.k..a "potato tubers").  I was directed to this establishment by an older fellow whom informed me it was family owned for the last fourty years.   I took a gamble and headed over to their place of business.  A nice family run place indeed.  I was taken care of from the choosing of plants\ seeds and soils, to tips, and having the woman's son help me carry my goods out to my truck.  The woman whom ran the joint was very helpful and social.  Reminding me of the older stores and times before attrocities like Home Depot and Lowes popped up.  Sad, this places of mass selling and low customer service putting places like this out of business.  If you want some veggie seeds,plant, or flowers skip the big box stores, and head here for your selection(s).  Keep these places alive and personal service.

12.description: I went here for the first time today. They have sandwiches , chili, and ice cream. I wanted some ice cream and decided on a turtle sundae. I was not disappointed. The presentation was nice, the size was large, and the taste was awesome! I'll be back to try some of the other offerings. The chili is supposed to be really good and the peach melba frozen yogurt sounds intriguing.

7.description: Went to Lindy's for the first time yesterday.  I've passed by here before but never stopped to try it.  I was not disappointed!  I got a cup of chili to go and it was wonderful.  It was a little spicy, with the right amount of meat to beans ratio. I wish there was a Lindy's on the north side ;(

3.description: BRING CASH; it's a cash only place!  Guys are always super fast & friendly

1.description: "Baby it's cold outside!" Or maybe the rain has you in the mood for a cuddle; so let your tongue spoon with hot Lindy's Chili (with or without beans), and your body caress the heat inside you with each slow swallow. That's right, it's like that...an experience, an emotion, a gratification. I follow it with a shockingly cold pineapple milkshake (there's always enough to share), with pieces of pineapple to keep you occupied, and satisfied in the moment. I'll leave the explicit detail of each bite of chili and each sip of milkshake to the imagination. Try it blindfolded it might heighten your experience!! Cheers!

2.description: Awesome desserts and food. Love the brownie sundae... Paid $18 for 3 sundaes. They were huge though. They don't accept credit cards   Cash only.  Great place!

9.description: I'm not sure what's going on this was one of my favorite chili spots ... I got a bowl of chilli with beans was not the same very disappointed will def not be coming back

10.description: I ordered a strawberry banana milk shake, but was given a vanilla milk shake with a hint of strawberry. I gave three stars for the vanilla ice cream used for my shake.

13.description: They have good chili and we love the fries! I took my kids here for lunch today, and it brought memories of my mom bringing me to " Lindy's Chili" for lunch. I still think they make good chili that is great on hotdogs or just in a bowl with crackers and cheese. I would return again because they are consistent and the service is very friendly.  It's cheap eats.

16.description: Lindy's has some of the best chili I've ever had in my life!  Whatever they do, the spices they choose, is near perfection.  I honestly cannot put my hand on what they use to create this perfect blend of spices.  The chili has a bit of a bite to it, but not too spicy by any means.Lindy's original location opened in 1924 on Archer and have since expanded into a handful of locations.    Get your delicious chili and eat in, and when you go, get a container and buy more for later.  Trust me on this one!

17.description: For a place that has "the best chili in Chicago" it was not as good as claimed.  I also tried "the best hot fudge sunday in Chicago".  I have had better one of my personnel favorites is Margie's.  This was a good place to try once, doubt I will be back it is also a drive from the northside.

15.description: Sadly, this shop, like the mall beside it, have fallen on hard times. Huge pot holes in the parking lot. Threadbare and heavily soiled velvet upholstery in the banquettes that does not appear to have been replaced since the shop opened.But the soda jerks still turn know how to turn out some of the best ice cream sundaes you will ever find anywhere, and at a fraction of the price you would pay at just about anywhere else.I wish I'd taken a picture on my recent return visit. A strawberry sundae -- two scoops of darn-good vanilla ice cream equal to the size of a pint and a half of Haagen-Dazs, packed into a classic soda fountain glass, topped with strawberry sauce with real strawberries, capped with a towering mound of fresh whipped cream and a gorgeous dusting of crushed Brazil nuts, topped off with the classic maraschino cherry, and, one of the iconic ingredients I've always loved about their ice cream dishes, a couple of Nabisco French vanilla cream sandwich cookies. Yeah!

0.description: This chain is an institution in the Southwest side of Chicago and suburbs. It's one of the many locations and the one closest to me. I have a lot of great memories of eating here with my friend and enjoying the food. The quality in my opinion is a bit better than your standard fast food. They serve burgers, hotdogs, turkey club sandwiches, patty melts, and other standard stuff. However, the chilli and ice cream is really the focus of this place. It's very inexpensive and two people maybe even three can eat for less than $20. The chilli is great and I always order it without beans which I've read is the real way to eat Chilli as Beans are considered a filler in Texas or maybe I'm wrong? It's not spectacular but it's pretty good. It's got a bit of a sweet finish to it and a great overall spice. You can order it by the cup or have it served up on some fries, nachos and even spaghetti!(I tried it once and it was actually pretty good, it came with garlic bread) This place is also one of the few places in Chicago that does old fashioned Ice Cream, like old soda fountains in the early 20th century did. It's pure Americana and I love it! My friend and I would usually share a sundae but if you're hungry it's more than enough for one person with an appetite.
