They always have an assortment of flavors(try the butter pecan!) and have toppings that include hot caramel(so good!), fresh strawberries, bananas, peanuts, and a couple other things. Instead of McDonalds try this place for lunch.

5.description: Go for the chili! Stay for the ice cream! This is my happy place! I love their chili with cheese and sour cream. You can get a bowl of chili or a combo meal (burger/fries) with a cup of chili on the side. In fact, you can add chili to practically anything on the menu. It's that good!! Make sure to save room for dessert! The turtle sundae is my favorite. It's beautiful too look at too. Have your phone ready to Instagram a pic! To top it off the staff is always very friendly.

11.description: After living only 5 minutes away for the last 14 years...this was my first time stepping into the place. I loved the atmosphere, a 70s, 80s feel. Peaceful when I walked in.I didn't take too much of a good look at the cleanliness of the place as I was more focused on the menu, in and out for my lunch break. I saw that they a good variety of food selections which I liked.I had a taste for a scoop of ice cream, I was debating between the Irish Coffee and Peach Yogurt..both sounded so good. I chose the 1 scoop of Irish Coffee and left with a beautifully filled cup of what looked like 2 1/2 scoops at a nice price!! (vs. Baskin Robbins for instance)Very hearty in their serving size!Ice cream tasted wonderful, no complaints.Staff; very friendly.I'm ready to take on their food menu soon!!HEADS UP: CASH ONLY!

8.description: Awesome place for some old school good ice cream so they get a star for that,sucks because they only accept cash! What kind of stuff is that get with the times Lindys! That's just a shame that you have to turn around an leave to get cash because this place decides to stay in the era of no credit cards

4.description: Best banana splits !! Ive tried other places and im sure many would agree. This is a great  place !! Im addicted !! Maybe next time ill try  the food.

14.description: Definitely a good place to go if you want an old fashioned sundae. The chili is really great to, I love the chili mac.Of the 3 different locations the one over on Archer Ave by Nashville is the best, friendliest service yet. Can't say the same about the other locations.On the down side if you order a hot dog or burger that's all you're gonna get, fries come extra.

6.description: I remember when this place first opened back when I was a kid but I have never been here until just now for a banana split!The banana split was awesome! I mean how can you even mess up a banana split, I imagine that even a bad one is still pretty good.The interior has seen better days but I am thinking that is the old/old-fashioned look they were going for. You know what, The "old" look is working for this place.The guy who tool our order obviously wanted to be somewhere else and he made that perfectly clear by not cracking a smile, and just being as unpleasant as possible to us. He barely said a word to us all night. He was so downright rude that he made me just want to get out of there as soon as possible. I am not going to go out of my way to go to this location again. There are other locations that I enjoy visiting.

3.description: This is an area with few Mexican joints. This place is pretty good and really cheap. They have a HUGE menu. Their horchata is really good and they have a bunch of different burritos to check out. I just tried their house burrito. It's ur standard burrito smothered in mole sauce. Definitely worth checking out!

1.description: The first and only time I went there the order taker had a hard time understanding very simple questions which was frustrating. Furthermore, they got my order wrong so I had to drive all the way back. No one apologized for the mix up, I was simply asked if I wanted an exchange or my money back. It wasn't so much that the order was wrong because we all make mistakes, but she expressed no concern whatsoever. That was not good customer service, so I got my money back and I'll never go back again.

2.description: This place is open late which is a plus, they have huge burritos that will keep you full all day lol. They do have American eats(nachos, burgers, etc)  but in my opinion it's so-so. If your in the neighborhood and craving a burrito, Check it out.

0.description: This is my first time coming here.  I was in the area for work and saw this place.  After looking at the menu decided to get the steak taco dinner.  The cashier, Virginia was very nice and let me know they had a special for 2 tacos, rice & beans, and a small drink for $6.99.  You got a lot of food for the money.  The steak was seasoned well and not tough.I was impressed by the customer service.  They checked to see if I wanted anything else after I was seated.It also was extremely windy outside and one of the city street lights broke and got glass on the parking lot.  The staff immediately sweeped up the glass and called the city.  I would come back!

1.description: This location is not usually busy when we go in. The same salesperson has waited on us the last two times, which is Meagan and she is always nice and very informative.

2.description: Typical Gamestop. I'm always greeted when I walk in the door. Nothing special.

0.description: Best gamestop period mostly due to the cool staff and the awesome boss Adriana. She is always helpful and super cool and nice.

1.description: I went in Oct with my 2.5 yo. I got a Living Social deal also and was looking forward to trying a new company. Once I walked in it was a bit suspect. The concept is great but thats it. Too much stuff going on in the lobby! The staff is great, the manager was very warm and seemed to have some good experience with dealing with clients. I thought the place needed a good cleaning, re organization and paint job! They haven't been around a long time, but Geez! We went to get my child a natural style, twists or braids something very simple. They wanted to Flat iron and blow dry Two year old hair!!! No discussion about options, my stylist was nice but no conversation, no soothing skills for my child who was upset about all the action in her hair and getting her hair washed. I made funny faces and redirected her while getting her hair washed to get her through it...I would think this would be a part of their customer service skills! (they start at 1 y.o) Me thinks not! I like to support a new business, but it seems like they just don't want it. I have one more voucher, I may pass it on to someone who doesn't have much expectation for quailty spa services. Oh and I asked ahead if they took Credit cards, which they told me yes, but when I had to pay, the machine wasn't hooked up correctly so I have to scramble and get cash!

0.description: I took my daughter here for her 6th birthday because they had a spa package deal and she is such a girly girl. That and the fact that I bought  a Living Social deal a couple of weeks prior to. :-)I guess I will start with the good things first. The lady who I spoke with on the phone was extremely pleasant. (which is why they get 2 stars instead of 1) I am not sure if she is the owner or not but she has great customer service. She was even very pleasant and accommodating when I went to the salon. Unfortunately, that is where my good ends and I almost feel so guilty writing my review because SHE was such a nice lady...Upon entering, I knew that I had made a wrong decision. The front waiting room was cluttered with all types of stuff included Mylar balloons and stuffing for build a bear-ish activities. I am assuming that is all for the party packages that they have but I just thought it would be better suited in another room. My daughter had the mini mani, pedi, facial and hair do. I was very specific about the color that I wanted on her nails because I didn't want anything too loud and grown for her. Apparently, there was mix up because she ended up with the exact thing that I didn't want her to have. It really wasn't that big of deal but the girl who polished her nails didn't seem to have any remorse or concern which kinda peed me off. We shouldve ended our visit at nails polishing...The same girl did her hair and I was not impressed AT ALL. We opted for a press and style. When I asked her about how long it would take she told me 20 minutes. RED FLAG...again, I shouldve left. Anywho, my daughter left looking like she never had her hair styled. Her ponytails were uneven and it looked as if her hair was barely touched by the flat iron.  I was VERY dissatisfied because my bill was $75.00 and she only had nails painted the wrong color to show for it. For a moment I was thinking maybe we shouldve gotten her hair braided, but then I saw a finished product coming from the chair and knew that would've been an epic fail as well. I will be sticking with my tried, true and trusted Kiddie Kuts from now on...which reminds me, I need to write a review on them as well....

3.description: I always use to come to this because I lived a few blocks away but I stopped coming and started going to places like Mariano's whole foods and tjs I came here April 1st around 9 something I got my 4-5 items I came there for and went straight to the self check out there was a gentlemen there who was suppose to b watching the station but he was to busy playing with the other employees cursing when the girl toldHim u better watch your station he told her I see him or her or whatever that is remind I'm the only one there. Then his phone rang and he got on it like yea who is this oh hey girl I'm like really is this how ultra foods operates I don't want any parts of this store anymore I was highly offended at the comment the young man made and I will not b coming back and oh I got sick off of their chicken as well so I definitely will not be back rather spend my money on a better quality of food anyway

1.description: read your receipts before you leave the store!!! If you go to the store in Calumet park

2.description: So disappointed, not only was I disappointed but I actually witnessed a fight inside. I thought I was on girls gone wild. Some lady freaked out when the meat department came out and insisted she was waiting to get the "first picking" of the meat. I was floored and was like, WHOAAAAA,,,,I have wanted to come in for many years, but its not exactly across the street from me, so we decided to come in on Labor Day (ummmm what was I thinking), still we came and seriously were not impressed. The floors were dingy and although items were stocked up, the prices were not what I though. One of the Managers was super kind though, he greeted us as he passed us up in an isle and I thought that was really nice of him to say welcome. That says a lot of the staff, and the cashier made me laugh like a crazy person. I like the fact that when I asked her how she was, she was honest and yet still smiled and was like, I am thankful regardless for having a job, Since a few minutes earlier I saw someone giving her a hard time. She was beautiful and just pleasant. I thought that the meat prices would be less but I was wrong. Maybe it was due to it being Labor Day? But still, the prices were outrages. I don't think I will be back but I am sure others may enjoy some of the prices. Just not for me.

5.description: Ultra Foodshas some good prices on par with places like Food4Less. This particular Ultra is can be a pain in the butt depending on what time you come here to grocery shop. They never seem to have a enough cashiers especially close to closing time. As far as prices they are very competitive. The staff here hit or miss meaning you might get a cashier acting like they hate their job and then you get some that are very friendly.

6.description: I  like the store ok., the prices are good ,bla bla ba...but they need to be responsible for the new trash/paper these people are bringing into the neighborhood and throwing all over the street...I hate litter with a passion... Please clean this up!

7.description: Ultra Foods opened a few months back, and I have been a customer ever since.   The diverse crowd matches the neighborhood.    The main aisle is loaded with great buys!   The store is always clean, orderly, and well lit, unlike my local Jewel.  The size of the store accommodates a wide variety of brands and a big selection of fruits/veg tables and meats.  You can always find a Ultra worker who is more than willing to help.  I can't remember the last time I seen a couple of butchers out in the meat department  helping customers, but damn they are always there at Ultra.     I have yet to see less than a dozen cashiers open, and I've never had more than two people ahead of me in line waiting to check out.    One complaint that I do have is with the deli counter.   Not all the available lunch meat is displayed up front, there is some on a shelf behind the counter, making it difficult to see what actually is available.  The prices are all over the place, so choose wisely.  Also, make sure you take the right ticket to be waited on.  There are three dispensers, and the one in the middle is the only one for the deli counter.        I really can't put my finger on what makes this place so inviting.        I probably need some serious therapy, but going to this store really is a pleasant experience.  There are some brands I haven't seen in a long, long time, and the workers are always great.  It has the feel of going to one of the small neighborhood grocery stores when you were a kid, only it has 10 times as many aisles.

0.description: I came here on the 5th since it was just a short bus ride from my work location nearby off California Avenue. My only issue is that stores like Ultra cater to hoodrats who come in when it's the new month with their LINK cards loading up on the month's supply of pop, processed food, and other empty calorie food items. I bought some milk and cereal from here, but it's a good store if you're passing through the area. Just can do without the loud hoodrats coming in screaming and hollering about really nothing.

4.description: I had my first visit here recently and was definitely not impressed.  I do not like the extremely high shelves in the aisles like another person mentioned. The deli was expensive $6+ for a lb. of ham, not to mention very slow, and I kept having to repeat both my orders multiple times.  The store is too large for me.  The cashier was honest she did not enjoy working there, though I sympathized with her.  Only two registers were open of 19 or so, and the self-checkout was open.  Meat prices were as expensive as other stores.  Nothing was a super deal or even a great deal.  I found the produce section lacking.  This store was 'average'.  It isn't a rating of the store, but the customers at this store were kind of surly.  For the price, which was as expensive as other stores in the area, WHY would I want to bag my own groceries in a rushed manner?!  I think not.  I came back to my car littered with an ad on the windshield.  It was just not a good experience, but at least I tried it.

12.description: Food is always good! This little shack is the bomb, this place is always pack and this place as limited seating but leaving close is a perk...always to go is good for me.

3.description: Delicious and inexpensive taco and great customer service depending on which crew is working. I've visited the restaurant and been the butt of the employees jokes. They were speaking in Spanish because they assumed that I wouldn't be able to understand and I chose not to entertain it. I brushed it off and said I'd never return again. But I did visit again because if their late hours and my tacos were extremely greasy.

1.description: Mmmm mmm good! Looking for a quick grab and go Mexican meal? Look no further. This place is delicious and cheap. No frills so if you want a large skirt steak then go somewhere else. But if you're craving some super delicious authentic tacos then this is your joint.

2.description: I had this place bookmarked off of another Yelpers review, and I am really happy I checked it out.  This is a tiny stand-alone building on Pulaski, but has great signage out front, so you will not miss it.   By tiny, I mean if there are 3 people inside at the counter, waiting to order, it is crowded.   They have outdoor seating for about 20 - which is great if the weather is nice.  Otherwise, this place is strictly take-out.I hit them up around noon on Saturday.   There is 1 table with 2 chairs inside, and 2 stools to sit at, at the counter.   There is a window to order from and the menu is posted on the wall.   I just went with 3 tacos to get a baseline - a carne asada, a chicken, and a chorizo - and an order of guacamole.     The space where orders are taken and food is prepared is probably 8 x 4, with 3-4 workers maneuvering around each other.  They have this down to a science.  Everyone was very friendly.  The place quickly got crowded and me standing inside waiting for my food was not an option, so I sat outside.   It did take about 15 minutes, and in that time, people that came after me received their food.   I wasn't in a hurry, so I just enjoyed the gorgeous weather.   When they brought my food, they did apologize for the wait.I couldn't wait to get home and try these.   The tacos steamed in the wrapper and I am sure only got better during my 5 minute drive home.    They were AMAZING.   The chicken was probably my favorite, but all were so good.  The guac was average, but at $3.50, a good deal.I will make this a destination spot for take-out authentic Mexican food.   They have a pretty decent size menu, and I look forward to trying more options.   I am not sure if you can call your order in, but I would give it a try, because they don't have the kitchen space to put together a large order in a short amount of time.

9.description: Woooh I swear.  Best Mexican food I've had in a long while.  Very authentic.  Bilingual.  Good service. Food always tastes great no matter what I order. Only thing they lack is a bigger space. Best to get take out since they only have a little corner table for 2 & the ordering counter for 3-4 people.

10.description: Great!!! It's a tiny place and sometimes the wait can be discouraging but their chicken tacos are soooo good I love them... it's good to call ahead to order that way everything is ready when you get there.

4.description: Very good and very cheap.The only complaint would be that the amount of meat in Taco is too little.

6.description: A gem pretty well hidden and forgotten.  Excellent for adventurous yelpers,  who knows good taste  and not judging a book by its cover.

0.description: Absolutely love this place! I've tried just about everything on the menu and was not dissapointed. I can't speak spanish but the ladies are very helpful and patient with me. The pork is amazing on anything. It's flavorful and juicy. Best authentic mexican food around! Another great thing are their prices. You don't pay a lot but get a ton of food. It always seems to be busy now which is great for them, but don't let that bother you. The wait is never long.

5.description: Simply the best place on the south side of Chicago to get your favorite Mexican dishes. I always go for the steak burrito, it's the best in town! No fake food like chipotle or any other "tex mex" chain.

13.description: Best Mexican restaurant I have been to in a while. The food is excellent, the service is great, and the wait isn't that long. The only downside about this place is the size of it but I can't complain. In the summer I like to sit in the tables outside and eat my meal. Haven't had a bad experience with this place yet.

11.description: Not a very big place, but don't let looks be deceiving very good authentic Mexican food. I always get the chicken or steak tacos and yet have I ever been the slightest disappointed with the food. I've never dined in, I wouldn't recommend dinning in just because of the lack of space but the good is EXCELLENT!!!!

8.description: I love the fact that they're opened late!! Love their tacos! Must have! :3 better than McDs right across the street! You can't say no to Tacos

14.description: Hands down, this is the best Mexican taco shack on Pulaski. It is very inexpensive to eat here and the quality of the food is top notch. The employees are very friendly and the portions are huge. They stay open very late and offer much better food than their full service Mexican counterparts. The sopes are to die for but the nachos could use some work. Oh, order a horchata or jamaica to complete your meal!

7.description: Ate here one night I wanted a burrito AnD didn't feel like driving to zacatacos. Decided to try something closer to home. My girl warned me, that I was going to regret not driving the extra distance. She was right. They piled a lot of rice in the burrito AnD the steak was dried, old AnD reheated. Never again. It was big, but the quality of the food matters more than the quantity to me. I'm good on them. Friendly though AnD tamale was good.

0.description: Maybe one of the ladies who work there can be a little nicer, I needed help and she answered so rude.

I purchased a mattress a month ago the salesperson said I had 30 days to try it and my Wife was not happy with it so we went back and told him we wanted another mattress he said ok we just have to pay the difference of $150 plus $60 shipping. I told him I wouldn't do that. He called his Manager and said I'll have to do is pay the $60 for shipping my wife said no so I said no I first got charged $30 for shipping the 1st time. He said that's their 30 day comfort policy. I told him I regret going to American Mattress. i should went back to Bedding Experts. The whole 30 day is just a switch and bait. I do not recommend American Mattress got to other stores.No recomendo a esta tienda y compania!

3.description: Stopped by this salon to get brows arch and a manicure before I went to work which starts at 2pm.  It was 11:50 am when I arrived.  Asked how long it would be for the arch ..the eager owner said five minutes.  After 20 minutes, I asked how much longer for the arch because at this point I knew the manicure was out.  Again 5 minutes by the owner but the technician that was to do the arch gave me a look like ' whenever I am ready' and something to that fact to the nail customer she was working on.   The customer laughed.  After 25 minutes I left because I now began to see the filth in the place and did not wish to give myself any skin issues.  Went to Orland Park mall salon on the way to work and was thoroughly satisfied.

1.description: I have been going to this nail salon for almost 3 yrs. the owner Mike is very customer friendly and welcoming. I get my nails done by only 1 specific male tech (Tom) He does them exactly as I like them.  He is very fast and efficient. I'm ok with the prices but they do need more design selections and training in design application. Finding a good nail tech is like finding a good hair stylist (preferences, performance and personality).

2.description: This place scares me...There is a stench of mildew and fungus. It's dirty and not relaxing. The owner was super eager to make me come back as if business is dying. The chairs are falling apart and torn up and my pedi was a disaster. My nails were all different sizes and uneven. The color wasn't even on my entire toenails.

5.description: This is HANDS DOWN my favorite spot to get a pedicure. Yes, it's a strip mall storefront and doesn't have a ton of glam but for what you get and what you pay, it's an excellent experience!  All techs are not created equal...Cathy is the best. She takes her time and gets to know you and your preferences as you frequent the place. The sea salt scrub is excellent; it doesn't feel like she is just playing with your feet for a few minutes. She's actually massaging with real attention to muscles and dead skin removal. It will be about 45-60 minutes but your feet will look and feel beautiful for about 3 weeks.

6.description: My friend and I came here upon a recommendation from her mom and sister, and so we decided to give it a shot. It was a gorgeous Sunday afternoon, and we decided to extend our lazy day by coming in and getting our nails done. The salon was pretty busy for a Sunday.  We waited a little bit, but not too long. The salon does have massage chairs, but it seemed like the batteries weren't working so well because I could barely feel any sort of movement within the chair. It's a no frills kind of spot that does a great job though. Unfortunately, we didn't get to sit next to each other while we were getting pampered, but we both had wonderful ladies that took care of us. I had Julie while my friend had Tonya. I got the sea salt massage and was not disappointed.  For an extra $5 - it's worth it ladies. After my 10K run a few days ago and still trying to recover from my shin splints, it was a nice welcome. Julie really took her time in making sure that the excess sking was removed and cleaned. She made sure I was feeling good during my massage as I was closing my eyes in a state of relaxation. The prices are pretty comparable in the suburban area. There must not be a lot of yelpers in the area since this place is pretty busy, and they seem to have a lot of repeat customers. A lady came in to get a nail fixed that had a chipped nail to find that the color they had a few days back they were all out of and the new order to restock that had been placed hadn't arrived yet! I would recommend coming in a couple of hours before closing time to ensure that you can get in here. There were lots of girls trying to get in an hour before closing deciding to come back the next day or go elsewhere since there were 5 other people waiting.

7.description: My nails were in need of a mani and pedi. I didn't have time to go to my usual place so i went here. I don't know the girl's name who did my nails, but she did a great job. she took her time and my nails looked great. The extra $5 for the sea salt scrub is worth it. The only thing i can really say about this place that's negative is that it's kind of small... and one could perceive it as ghetto. Also, I like the overall atmosphere.. like decoration and just all the extra stuff. This place didn't have that. But overall, the people get the job done and they are nice. Check it out if you live in the area.

0.description: So I was burned by another nail shop and I was out driving.. randomly and decided to stop in this place.. I had passed by several times and never stopped.  Well I am glad I did... They fixed the other shops HORRIBLE job and I felt very welcome there.  They are full service nails, toes and waxing. If you go please pay the extra $5 for the sea salt massage with the pedicure.. it is AWESOME!!!Very friendly, clean and they always have plenty of folks there..

4.description: Randomly happened on this place. Needed a pedicure before heading to Yoga. Called the first location and was told they were closing. Then owner informed me of the Hometown location and they would accommodate at 7:45pm. (they were closing at 8pm). Great customer service! My husband said my feet feel like cotton candy! This is my new regular spot!

12.description: Back on 12/24/2011; I left a comment reflecting the horrible service of Waldo Cooney's, I mentioned I contacted the Better Business Bereau and according to them, Waldo Cooney's has a month to try and solve this issue.  Well, today is 1/20/2012 and after playing phone tag with "Jim", (manager?) and not a single conversation with Gary (owner) this situation remains the same.  Maybe they believe I will go away, after about a month of, AGAIN, giving this business the benefit of the doubt, I remain certain that they're personel really does not care of the service provided, now if this is true of the personnel, what can we expect from the quality of food. Below is the e-mail I received from the Better Business Bureau, please DO read: "Complaint ID#: 94380635Business Name: Waldo Cooney's PizzaYou recently requested our help concerning a problem with the company named above. The company has not responded to the BBB to date. Please contact me or return this letter to the BBB by January 30, 2012 and inform us whether you have heard from the company or not, this will be reflected as such in the company's business review. "

7.description: For cheap eats, can't go wrong with the portions & quality's fairly good.  Whenever I need a chicken wing fix but I'm really short on cash, I get their Tuesday special.  The wings aren't the best in the world but they're meaty.  I order from them for work from time to time & they always offer us great deals; especially when it comes to work orders.

3.description: Tried this particular Waldo's the other day. I ordered a slice of sausage and a beef sandwich. Their slices are double dough but you can order a full pizza with thin crust. Im gonna do that, because their sauce and sausage were really flavorful. Cheese quality is very good as well.While the beef was good as well..I feel for $4.99 it should have been a bigger sandwich when compared to the size of the beef at Pizza Plus in Hometown Plaza, just  minutes down the road on SW HighwayAll in all, will def' go back again...

1.description: Worst customer service. I placed an order over the phone for pick up, the girl said 25 minutes. I showed up half an hour later for them to tell me that they don't take orders over the phone .. Really?!

2.description: I would seriously give zero stars if I could. I ordered a simple grilled chicken sandwich, add cheese. When I picked it up, not only did it not have cheese, it only had lettuce and tomato, no onions or mayo and was so dried out you couldn't even eat it. So I call and talk to some young kid and obviously he can't do anything about it. So he asks some guy in the back who blames me of course for ordering wrong and says he will make another one but I need to come all the way back there NOW. umm... No. They did not apologize, offer a credit, or anything to rectify the situation. I will NOT be back.

9.description: Pizza is decent, not my favorite but everyone else in the house is content with it.  Service is not the best, every time we call we are on hold forever. Looks like they need to invest in a second person to man the phones. Let me guess, the longer we are on hold the more menu items you get to push during the hold time. Sneaky move. Never had a problem with delivery guys. Pizza gets delivered in a decent time. Biggest peeve? I hate when a business gives you too many no's, with so much competition that shouldn't be the case. I recently went in there to order a pizza to go "Can I do quarters? (As in Quarter sausage, quarter green pepper)" "No""Ugh ok fine," hands them a $50"Sorry we don't take bills over $50"We have ordered from here often but lately our conversations when deciding where to order from go something like this"Should we order Waldo Cooneys?!""Nah, I don't feel like being on hold forever and they don't do quarters""You are right, remind me to write a Yelp review on them"

10.description: We called tonight for delivery....first thing I asked is how long is it taking for delivery was told within the hour.  I placed a order and we waited for 90 minutes called back and was told they left 20 minutes ago I live about 2 miles away.  We waited 10 more minutes still no one here then I called back to cancel the order.  The guy on the phone was a complete jerk!!!!!! The delivery guy showed up 20 minutes later as we were walking out the door!!! We told him we cancelled the order and he mumbled something and walked away slamming the car door.  It was the first and last time I order from here!

13.description: The supposed "manager" named Jose at this location gave me such a hard time when I tried placing an order. It started with my area code, which is a Chicagoland area code that is less common but widely known (224). He said he could not provide service unless it was 773, 312, 708 "or something like that". Wth? I explained it was a Chicagoland area code and that there wouldn't be an issue calling me back. He had an attitude from the start rushing my order, talking over me, and questioning every answer I gave all the the way through the end when payment came up. He asked several questions about ID, imprint, which Id usually understand but gosh, that attitude! It was just terrible. I asked if he gave everyone that hard of a time and I just got more sarcasm and resistance. I asked to speak to a manager and to my surprise, guy tells me he's the manager. Really? No apology or explanation. I have no issue talking my business elsewhere. I used to order from there all the time in the past... NEVER again.

16.description: If you like good pizza this is the place to go.They sell the biggest slices I have ever had for such a low price.The stuff there slices with meat so don't worry about that at all if you like sausages. There slices are a little thick so if you not a bigger eater this could be a good lunch and maybe a midnight snack.The pan pizza are also great. I love pizza and this place will not let you down.Grade = A

17.description: Waldo's has the best pizza on the southside!  There is nothing up and down Pulaski Rd. that compares to Waldo's.

15.description: If you love sausage pizza then waldos is king. It's not your typical snausage bits - it's loaded with sausage. Same said with other ingredients; they don't skimp

0.description: Years ago I would order for delivery and I've been wanting to stop by the location and now I am just picking up a pizza pie for the family. The memories of this pizza is really now making me feel so nostalgic and glad I decided to stop by. The first time I came into the joint and it's actually super clean with vintage (not real vintage) signs hanging all over the walls all the way from Betty Boop to Mohawk Gasoline signs. It adds a charm to the place indeed. But the pizza? LOVE THE THIN CRUST FOR SURE. It is the right amount of sauce and perfect taste throughout the pie. And 16" pie will feed at least 5 grown ass adults! The cheese is the perfect consistency and the sausage hits the perfect taste of flair. Check them out and they do have a parking lot.

5.description: I used to order from here 10 years ago & just started again,  never an issue but I suggest ordering a pizza instead of a slice,  much better in taste!

11.description: I went in for a slice of pizza. Basically I walk in and the place it is practically empty. Which is always a bad sign. I pass this place all of the time and it seems to stand out since it is right in the corner. I order the # 6 special which is a pizza slice, a drink and fries for $4.99. I also ordered a second slice of pizza. I was told there is only cheese and they literally only have 2 cheese pizza's in the warmer. I am not going to wait 25 minutes for 2 slices of sausage pizza. So i go for the cheese. I am told there is going to be a wait for the fries. It seems fine too. I am about to ask for their cheese sticks. Was told before hand we have no public washrooms. "okay" I said. I am given my order the #6 which includes the pizza slice, the soda and the fries. I guess he forgot about the second pizza. Well I am glad that he did. The bread was as thick as the length of a quarter and the cheese was as thin as paper. Definitely will not be going back.

8.description: Went in last night for pizza slices.  Old, cold and gross!  Have always had good pizza here, you would think they would make fresh ones every once in awhile!  Next time will order a whole pizza but probably not at this Waldo's!  One on 111th always has great pizza!u

4.description: This place is piece of Shit great pizza horrible service will never order again complete thugs

14.description: I did not eat here...did not get THAT far... I am staying 2.3 miles...that is 2 point 3 miles (like 10 minute drive) away from them and tried to call in an order for delivery. They CHARGE $3.00 for delivery..oh..and by the way..2.3 miles (10 minute drive), yeah that's too far. They don't deliver 2.3 miles away. Too far...I know this review is somewhat venomous. I assure you I had just a normal voice tone with their "customer service" expert up until the point when he told me that 10 minutes was too far to drive for a $3.00 extra charge for delivery. Eating at Angies...cheaper, no delivery charge,and don't seem too concerned about those long distance delivery drives.

6.description: BERWYN LOCATION: We ordered pizza earlier tonight now technically last night at 945pm. We are still waiting for delivery and when we called realized that they closed at midnight. When we placed our order the gentleman on the phone knew our address and name, maybe from caller id and we have ordered from here before. He took our order and said it would be a little over an hour. We live down the street from this place and somehow our order was not delivered. No phone call no show. This will be the last time we order since it is 1am on Sunday and we have not had dinner. We have since ordered from Al's and we are sure that they will deliver on time.

0.description: I live nearby to this store and sometimes feel that the stores in the area aren't that great.  They're not as well stocked as the other stores and just kind of run down.  This was not the case with Payless.  They were well stocked and the workers were professional and kind.  I will definitely be going back!

3.description: While you may not get the top-of-line breakfast experience you would get at someplace like OHOP, and may not the same lunch and dinner experience you'd get at a place like Applebee's, what you will get is a slightly better than average breakfast, lunch, and dinner experience combined. The wait to be seated is never too long and you always get your food exceptionally quick too. With decent food at decent prices and kind waitresses, I'd say that Starlight is a solid diner to visit if you're in the neighborhood. Try the meatlovers omelette if you get the chance too.

1.description: We came here since we were in the area. Service was good, but the food did take a bit to come out. Food was okay, but I've had better.Bathroom was clean, but they need to change out that carpet in the dining area.I probably wouldn't return though.

2.description: Never order anything but the breakfast from here!

5.description: My family and friends have been coming to this restaurant for years (10 years)! Greek family owned restaurant / diner. Good staff and good food!! = ) It's a nice brunch/lunch and dinner place...very Chicago. = ) Check it out!

0.description: I was in the area and gave it a try. The menu has a good selection, the prices are fair and the service is great. The restaurant is clean, the service is quick. The specials that ordered were good and very filling. I will definitely come back again.

4.description: I love having this restaurant in my community. I always love my food, get great service and feel like I get a good price. I come back almost every Sunday for breakfast cause its that good. Make sure you ask for Kim when you visit. She always takes care of me and my girl.

3.description: It's Mcdonald's... nothing to see over here. My order hasn't been wrong yet, which thoroughly surprises me.

1.description: The slowest f'in McDonald's in the history of McDonald's... Everyone that works here is ignorant

2.description: Lousy service! Slower than slow drive thru Haven't gotten an order right for years!! So to avoid the drive-thru you go inside, and find they can't make milkshakes because the machine is broken.

0.description: Shouldn't expect much of a local McDonalds anyway. Averagely organized but lacking in stocking. Its always either the ketchup , napkins or straws that's unavailable. Not to mention they often forget small details. Make sure you're order is correct before leaving because they might not answer the phone.

3.description: We live 4 blocks away- at night we sometimes want a nice cup of coffee and a donut to go with-- they never have the donuts we like, and tonight they had NO DONUTS AT ALLLL! Sayeth whaaaa?! No DONUTS at a DONUT place?! Really? Wow. So we settled for a sandwich.  There were NONE.  I hate this dunkin-- not to mention that they NEVER have the ice cream you want EITHER.  I guess when all you have is a run down Dunkin Donuts in the neighborhood, you have no choice but to keep trying.  And this is why "America runs on Dunkin," but we HOP, SKIP, and JUMP ON STARBUCKS!  Man, we need a Starbucks in the hood! LOL ...Best thing about this location is the guessing game you'll have with the thick-accented, visor-wearing, customer-service lacking cashier guy! Enjoy! Lol...

1.description: Bad customer service!!!  I  am standing in the lobby for 5 minutes (no line no wait) before someone finally acknowledges me- not the young man at the cash register,  but instead a manager from the back who only came up to ask (in a less than pleasant way)- "what are you waiting for"  Eek!!!!  No "How are you doing-how can I help you." I had been waiting for my family who went through the drive through.  I am watching the young lady in the window holding a conversation with a patron while my family waits behind him in the drive through lane.  I had come inside the store because I had walked from a nearby store while my husband decided to get a "quick" bite for the kids.  I didn't realize that it was inappropriate to wait in the lobby to avoid waiting in the cold, but I might not have waited as long if the drive through had been a little quicker.Not pleased with this location and since the nearest DD is less than 2 miles away the owner should consider teaching a little customer service, because customers do have the option to take their business to another DD.

2.description: My post is about a Year late but after reading all the others, I now know it wasn't just ME feeling some type of way.  INCOMPETENT & lacks customer service skills, including the manager. Ordered a Latte, took them 10-15 freakin' mins to make it then its a Iced Latte. I say "Im sorry, I thought I said HOT?" The GIRL looks at me like she wanted to slap the taste out my mouth & nastily says "No u didn't! ! U said Iced!!"  It took ALL I had not to show my ass but long story short instead of just making me what I want, we go back n forth til mngr comes out, looks at receipt & says "This says U ordered Iced Latte" I tell him I dont care WHAT IT SAYS, I DON'T WANT ICED, I WANT HOT!! BETTER YET JUST GIVE ME MY MONEY BACK!!! They quickly make me,a Hot but when I got in my car, either I was just too pissed off or it truly tasted like a cigar had been dumped in it, I just threw it out!!! Haven't been back since & NEVER will!!! Im sure if they were in a "mainstream" neighborhood, the service would be 10xs bettter!!! WORST DD EVER!!!

0.description: You had one job, Dunkin Donuts. Make me a toasted bagel, sliced into halves. Why did I get three hunks of bread, badly and incorrectly sliced? It tasted like any other Dunkin Donuts bagel, but my smashed hash browns and mutilated bagel thrown on top of them tells me that they just don't give a feck here.

4.description: I had a lousy experience here. 5 Hindu guys all goofing off, ignoreing the customer, no hello, no thank you, no eye contact, I'm done with Dunkin Donuts. Too many similar experiences.

1.description: There is nothing more than I hate about McDonalds then when you get home and discover that they have you the wrong order.I ordered a sausage biscuit, I just got home to discover a damn sausage egg mcmuffin. I've never order that before & will never. 1 I don't like the fake eggs they use or to have cheese. Was it too difficult to have a simple sausage on a biscuit with jelly & a hash brown? For this McDonalds: YES!I asked for jelly, no jellyAsked for 2 bags, put all the food in 1 bagIt's morning they should be wide awake.Will not come back here

2.description: I am giving them at least one star because everyone had on a hair net. If you only find hair in your food, consider yourself lucky. The service here is horrendous. A smile is out of the question and so is getting ice in a complimentary cup of water. The only good part was the homeless woman who announced that she was now a vegetarian and was refused hot French fries off the grill. Her reaction was priceless.

0.description: I agree with Lauren, the other reviewer.Check it out: I'm one of those rare adults who loves McDs and is not afraid to say so. But this McDs is SOOO bad...(how bad is it?!)It's so bad that I've lived near it for 15 years and have only eaten there three times. They were so bad that I literally boycotted them. Despite their convenience of location, I drive miles out of my way just to find an agreeable one.

3.description: So I totally understand with the weather and all that you may run into some traffic problems. I ordered for delivery and they said 30 minutes. That turned into 1 hour and 20 minutes. I'm not even upset about that!  What I was upset about is everything was cold! One mile away and my sandwiches are cold too! I called to let them know and the young lady was going to put her manager on the phone but all of a sudden left the store. It's ok, it only takes me one time to learn my lesson! Never again!

1.description: I use to be a fan of red snappers. The tenders, pizza puffs, sandwiches, and shrimp is all good don't get me wrong. However, on their flyer they are advertising 20 buffalo wings for $9.99, which happen to be the pettiest, smallest, most sauce drenched disappointments I've ever had. As a valued member in the chicken-eating community, I am appalled that they would even promote something as bogus as that. R.I.P Red Snappers

2.description: This place stinks.  I picked up an order from here last night.  The chicken wings aren't bad but I've had better.  Last night I ordered wings and fish (jack salmon) when I got home my jack salmon was so hard I couldn't even break it.  It was like a rock.  I didn't live close otherwise I would have gone back to complain.  I will never eat here again.  I'm so sick of going places spending my hard earned money for terrible food and service.  That crap cost $11.00!!!!! never again.Try J&J on 109th and Western.  Last time I ate there which was about a month ago I had the most delicious, fresh and flavored chicken wings and fish.  It took a little while but the guy fried it fresh.  I enjoyed it.  I will go there again before I set foot in this place again.  Save your money!!!

0.description: The prices are a little high for fast food, but I like the variety on the menu. The gyro plate is delicious and so large it will feed 2 adults or 3 to 4 kids. My wife likes the fish. This is the place to go when my family can't agree on what to eat. Between the fish, chicken, burritos, pizza and gyros, this place has something for everyone when going for fast food.

4.description: I tried pretty much everything there and its all so tasty. The staff are friendly. The gyro sandwich is one of the best. They don't sell pizza like the one on 67th and California but they know how to make fast food faster then McDonalds. They're wings are made fresh. 100% satisfaction guaranteed. I almost forgot to tell you about the cheeseburgers. They have cheeseburgers that are better than portillos cheeseburgers. Last but not least the tasty catfish fillet. Its crispy and delicious. They do delivering and catering for any occasions. Trust me you will love it here!!!

3.description: Amadoo is great, he was very helpful and not pushy at all. I had a very good experience at sleepy's.

1.description: Darrel was so good to us. Came in for a mattress. Gave us a good deal. He was awesome. Thanks for the help. I recommend this sleepys. Very nice people to deal with.

0.description: My husband and I walked out of Sleepy's with a sense of piece knowing that we picked the right place to pick our long over due mattresses. Darrell was very helpful and kind and made sure we were pleased. We were very well taken care of, and Darrell definitely knew how to deal with us as his customers. He gave us the space that we needed to discuss what we can afford to make a decision on our purchase. And let's not forget, we got a free 2 night stay at a hotel with our purchase. Sleepy's was going to be one of others to shop for mattresses and compare prices, but after being guaranteed with a price match we cold not refuse. Very pleased with his services!!!

2.description: Great experience @ Sleepy's. Outstanding service provided by Darrell Abernathy. Went to 2 other places 1st and felt like I was being sold a used car. He was knowledgeable, personable, and very helpful.

5.description: Darrell was very professional/helpful & was able to answer all of my questions.  I haven't had the mattress long, but so far I'm very satisfied..

6.description: Such a disappointment!  I came here on Black Friday because I've been putting off getting  a new mattress for awhile.  Apparently everyone else decided to was time to buy a new mattress too because it was crowded.  Whatever, it was black Friday, I can handle this.  The sales guy said hello to me when I walked in but wasn't able to help me.  I was surprised they only had two people working!  I figured this couldn't be too hard, they're beds I can just look around and figure this out myself.  Wrong.  This could be the case if I needed a bed that has twenty positions, a remote, and built in coffee maker.  I just need a regular bed but apparently those are hidden in a different part of the store because I couldn't find them.  Without anyone to help me I was sick of waiting and decided to leave.  Bummer.  No bed for me.

7.description: The sales man Darrell was very professional, eager to help and went out if his way to help us. The man knows what he's doing!

8.description: A good friend recommended Sleepy's for a great mattress. I am so glad that I listened to her. I walked in and was greeted by the lovely Karen. She made the experience a blast. I was laughing the entire time. She made me feel like a friend and not like a sale. She was attentive to what I was looking for and also taught me some interesting things about my sleeping patterns. Karen made finding a new mattress a fun experience. I appreciated all her help and can't wait to  get my new bed all set up.

9.description: Had such a great experience! Karen is an awesome Sleepy's Professional! Can't wait for my delivery!

10.description: Simply put, Paul was amazing! Amazing enough that I decided to fill out this form and add the recently opened store to Yelp. Don't want to read the details? Skip to the summary and head to Sleepy's!!I moved to Chicago from California with an apartment lined up, but no furniture. I figured the RoomPlace / the MattressPlace on Cicero would be a great option to get  a mattress quickly as they were advertising a sale, The place was clean and had a nice set-up, but the salesmen were aggressive and oozed shady. They refused to negotiate until they realized that though I flew in that morning, I wasn't born that morning. When they provided me with their 'best' price, I told them I would check out the surrounding shops to compare. The cocky salesman informed me that I would be back. The other shops I tried on Cicero aren't worth mentioning. They simply lacked quality. Then I stumbled into Sleepy's as a last resort before heading back to the shady salesman at the RoomPlace. Paul greeted me at the door and was professional yet personable. He was a true gentleman and gave honest feedback on the pros and cons of each mattress. I was thoroughly impressed with his knowledge. As opposed to trying to wheel and deal he simply let the facts speak for themselves. I found a mattress I liked and wanted to compare it to the one down the block at the RoomPlace. Paul understood me wanting a peace of mind and off I went to sit on the other bed. The shady salesman was quite smug and hovered as I sat on the bed trying to get a feel. I noticed that their pillow top bottomed out and my decision was made. I went back to Sleepy's where I received better service & a higher quality. Paul quickly checked me out and the delivery was accurate and smooth for an amazing price!Summary: Mistake = going to the RoomPlace / the MattressPlace. Another Mistake = checking out the other small shops around. BEST DECISION EVER = going to Sleepy's and working with Paul. Make your next move your best & head to Sleepy's!!!

4.description: Terence was very knowledgeable and helpful, and not at all pushy.  He guided us to the best bed for us and made for a very pleasant buying experience. We feel like we got a great deal, and would recommend Terence and this store location to anyone.

28.description: Five characteristics make Chicago Cheese Steak a five star fast food experience. Quality, quantity, great service, everything is very fresh, and a unique menu. The cheese steak is so tasty I seriously have to restrain myself from eating 87 of them in one sitting. They have the standard size and king size.  If you go for the king, bring a hearty appetite. The bread is cloud like soft, similar to a mexican bolillo. And it's filled with just tasty meaty goodness. The steak, onion, and pepper mix fills it to the point where they need to bend the sandwich to fit in the take out container. Whatever they use to season the meat really just makes this an amazing sandwich. The fries are always cooked to a golden crisp perfection. And the gyro burger is kick ass as well. I mean how can you combine gyros and burgers and not expect pure awesomeness to result from this?The owner is a really cool dude. He'll ask how your day was and strike up some small talk while you wait. The prices are reasonable and he doesn't nickel and dime you to death for condiments. Chicago Cheese Steak is a class operation and a fine representation of good south side food fare.

1.description: After reading the wonderful reviews I was so looking forward to trying this place. Unfortunately, my meal was ruined due to the delivery driver. All my items arrived cold. I don't mean not hot....I mean cold. The driver called me in the process of this delivery and literally questioned if I knew my own address because he couldn't find the place. Are you frigging kidding me!?! Now I'm sure people do enter addresses wrong, we're human mistakes happen but to say it in such a tone to make it sound as if you're implying I'm too stupid to know my own address? Not happy, poor customer service lead to me wasting nearly  $18 on lunch.

39.description: I used to work in a store near this place for six years, but didnt start eating at this place til my last year at the store.  All those years I was so close but ddnt realize what I was missing.  This place has burgers, melts, gyros...etc   The value here is great, typically you can order a burger + fries for under 6.  They give you alot of fries and the burgers are pretty big.  I would eat it for lunch, but would be too full keep working after lunch lol.   The owners/workers are very friendly too.

9.description: I love the food at Chicago Cheese Steak. I tried chicken tender, traditional wings, whole wing, Chicago cheesesteak sandwich , and fresh made cheese burger. All of them tasted really great. On my next visit I like to try gyros.It been a month I didn't eat at Chicago cheesesteak. Now I'm there it's time to try the gyros. The gyros meat is like other places it's from Kronos. The meat was very tasty. The most thing I like is the gyros sauce. I never tried a gyros sauce that tasty. It was thick and rich with flavor.

29.description: Greatest cheese steak sandwich ever. Been eating here for years now, quality never changed. Always fresh and hot. Buffalo chicken is also very good.

23.description: I had a horrible experience here. I was really surprised because someone recommended this place to me and because of all the great reviews. First off, when i saw the prices, i opted for a drink instead of fries with my burger. The guy that took my order was too busy creeping on me to get my order correct though. After 20 minutes (there was 1 person ahead of me and two cooks in the kitchen) i received my greasy, previously frozen by-product of a double cheeseburger with some overdone fries i said i didn't want with my soda that i could swear was a generic cola, not coke. Although on that last part, i can't verify it wasn't name brand, i can assure you i didn't enjoy it. Set me back $8 and some change,  and i was running late getting back to work, so i couldn't even finish my overdone fries.Not happy. Won't be back. Womp womp.

5.description: The food here is great, a quick stop and friendly service. The only down side would be the space, its very small to have sooo many tables.

31.description: Stopped here today after reading a few of the reviews - this place is down the street from my house, but I've never noticed it before.Tiny place - a few tables, probably wouldn't eat in, though a few people were.   I walked in and was met by a great smile and friendly service.   The lady (owner?) was so warm and welcoming.    The other patrons that came in, seemed to be regulars, as the people behind the counter seemed to know everyone by name/order.I got the Chicago cheese steak and the chicken parmesan cheese steak  - to go.   I would rate the Chicago as 10 stars.  The steak was so thin and flavorful - loaded with cheese, onions, peppers - so, so good!   The Chicken parm, I would not recommend at all - the chicken was not good and the flavor was off.The bread!  Oh - the bread!   The rolls these sandwiches are served on is some of the best, freshest I've ever tasted!The fries were just 'eeehhh'.  I think they were supposed to be crispy, they looked like they were going to be.  But they were kind of soggy and tasted old.I would absolutely come back for the Chicago Cheese Steak and the great service!

25.description: Had the cheese steak and fries because of the reviews we read here. They were really, really good!  Nice, friendly service.

12.description: I love this place. I wish they accepted Bitcoin. i'd be here everyday.

37.description: WOW the service.....awesome service and the best cheesesteaks in chicago hands down! Try them you'll love them.

21.description: I just had the cheese steak sandwich and fries combo and it was perfection! The service was great and the place is very clean with a welcoming atmosphere. I will definitely be back because it's close to my work and of course for the foood! Thanks again for a great meal!

16.description: Best place in town can't believe people are bad mouthing this restaurant. Excellent service the cook in the morning is amazing at his job and has excellent  customer skills. Keep up the good work guys the fries are fresh and the sandwiches have excellent  flavor.

17.description: So I'm a big cheese steak fan so this place before and they were closed about 6 months ago service was good the food came quick but this was a onion and bread  sandwich very little meat and the fries tasted like fake potatoes keep it up I can see this place close soon I feel violated.

10.description: Horrible place. Food sucks.service sucks. Fries are burnt. If you can't cook a French fries right. Then you shouldn't be cooking food. It like eggs and bacon. Really hard to mess up. They could give a crap about you. Service sucked. Funny how most of these compliments are old. Isn't  even the same owner. Come on if your foods good. Get rid of these old comments. Quit biting another guys complishments. Should say new owner ship. But dudes to scared to put it out there. Cause he knows the food sucks

11.description: This is my second time here! My second visit was better from the first one. There Chicago Cheesesteak is delicious, friendly employee. This is a great quick stop for a delicious lunch or dinner when you are on the go.

26.description: Best food in the area. I've never been disappointed. Every sandwich is extremely delicious. I am always serviced with a smile. Fairly priced.

27.description: Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! I have been coming here for almost ten years, ever since I once worked at the nearby Target and went here just by chance on a lunch break. To this day, every once in awhile I will get that craving for some cheesesteak and feel compelled to drive on by. And I have only one time gotten something other than cheesesteak because it is just that good, which was the gyro burger and that was awesome, too; very big. I love that they have bottles of ketchup, hot sauce and barbeque sauce at the counter, I recommend everyone who comes here to squirt hot sauce and ketchup on their fries before they leave or sit down because when it soaks in, it is divine! They also have daily specials which is nice even though this is the kind of place you don't mind paying full price because it is a local shop that one wants to keep in business. And the service is the second best thing about this place next to the food. It is a family owned business, the owner is such a nice, down-to-earth gentleman who you can tell strives to make sure the customers are satisfied. His wife is also such a sweet lady. And it's funny to think, I've actually watched their son, who works there occasionally, grow from a young little dude to a grown-up now who you can also tell takes after his dad because he is so welcoming and kind.

35.description: The best steaks in chicago a must try

8.description: Cheap steak, cheap cheese, etc.., get the picture. Your better off getting an Italian beef, more value for the money.

0.description: Always the best!I call on Chicago Cheese Steak to fill my belly at least once a week. Great food, nice people, fast delivery!I recommend the Chicago Cheese Steak Sandwich!!

20.description: This is my second time here! My second visit was better from the first one. There Chicago Cheesesteak is delicious, friendly employee. This is a great quick stop for a delicious lunch or dinner when you are on the go.

19.description: In Chicago for business.. Stayed at a hotel close to the restaurant.. So I ordered delivery.. Ordered thru Yelp.. Great service.. Prompt.. Cheese steak was good.. But way too many onions and peppers.. Overpowering the entire sandwich.. More of them than the meat.. That was disappointing. The Cheese Sticks were great. I will order it again.. Minus the onions and peppers.

33.description: On the day I went to try this place, I think a bunch of people had the same idea as it seemed as if they were overwhelmed and I think the owner was training new staff (which explains my 4 stars instead of 5 and I will probably change it to 5 after a second trip there) my hot dogs were way overcooked but they were still delicious and the cheese fries were beyond amazing! If I could I would eat an entire meal of just cheese fries they were that great! The person I went with had a cheese steak sandwich and he seemed to enjoy it quite a bit.

2.description: My husband and I were returning from a trip and driving back home from Midway and looking for a quick bite to eat. I found this place on Yelp and was so excited bc I LOVE Philly cheesesteaks and I saw they had 4 stars on Yelp.I ordered the cheesesteak combo and my husband ordered chicken fingers only bc he needed something he could eat while driving. I was a little worried bc as we were waiting I read some of the reviews on Yelp and it seemed most of the good reviews were from a while ago. My husband mentioned to the guys that were at the counter that we were on the way home to see our 2 little boys and one of the guys pulled 2 quarters out and insisted we pick something for them out of the little toy machines for our boys. Yeah, it was only 50 cents but such a thoughtful gesture on their part.We got our food I would say in 5-7 minutes, not long at all. We hopped in the car and I started in on my cheesesteak. YUM! I was so pleasantly surprised, the steak was flavorful, there was plenty of it and the cheese (please see my picture for reference) and the peppers were cooked perfectly, not undercooked or over cooked. The fries were also great, definitely freshly fried, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.I don't know who this Sal person is that people keep talking about since it was my first time there, but give this place a try, even without him. Change doesn't necessarily have to be a bad thing!

32.description: I love Cheesesteaks!! I'm extremely picky.  These are the best I've had in Chicago.  Sal, the owner is very friendly and an excellent cook.  He knows customer service.  You can eat in or take out, the seating is limited.  These cheesesteaks are loaded with meat and the buns are just right.  Perfect!  Their fries are great and they load them on.  Everything is made to order just as you order it.  They have several other sandwiches too, burgers, hot dogs, chicken-cheesesteaks and others that look very good, but I can't get past the Chicago Cheesesteaks!  This is definitely a fast food place, very casual.  You've gotta try the Cheesesteaks here, one of the best food items on Cicero Ave.

18.description: Stopped here today after reading a few of the reviews - this place is down the street from my house, but I've never noticed it before.Tiny place - a few tables, probably wouldn't eat in, though a few people were.   I walked in and was met by a great smile and friendly service.   The lady (owner?) was so warm and welcoming.    The other patrons that came in, seemed to be regulars, as the people behind the counter seemed to know everyone by name/order.I got the Chicago cheese steak and the chicken parmesan cheese steak  - to go.   I would rate the Chicago as 10 stars.  The steak was so thin and flavorful - loaded with cheese, onions, peppers - so, so good!   The Chicken parm, I would not recommend at all - the chicken was not good and the flavor was off.The bread!  Oh - the bread!   The rolls these sandwiches are served on is some of the best, freshest I've ever tasted!The fries were just 'eeehhh'.  I think they were supposed to be crispy, they looked like they were going to be.  But they were kind of soggy and tasted old.I would absolutely come back for the Chicago Cheese Steak and the great service!

13.description: Fast delivery and an excellent sandwich!!! Loved this place. I have had numerous experiences with this restaurant and I have never had a bad sandwich. Awesome food and excellent service

4.description: Good chessesteaks. I had the buffalo chessesteak. I would have liked more cheese, but was satisfied with the amount given. Friendly and helpful staff. This place is just a few miles south of midway airport. I would recommend this place for a quick bite after work or a quick lunch.

24.description: It was ok. Not very expensive. Staff was friendly. The tables and chairs were a bit grimy, food was nothing to write home about. Fry portions were good. I had the cheeseburger gyro. Burger meat was not great and gyro meat was ok.

6.description: I had a horrible experience here. I was really surprised because someone recommended this place to me and because of all the great reviews. First off, when i saw the prices, i opted for a drink instead of fries with my burger. The guy that took my order was too busy creeping on me to get my order correct though. After 20 minutes (there was 1 person ahead of me and two cooks in the kitchen) i received my greasy, previously frozen by-product of a double cheeseburger with some overdone fries i said i didn't want with my soda that i could swear was a generic cola, not coke. Although on that last part, i can't verify it wasn't name brand, i can assure you i didn't enjoy it. Set me back $8 and some change,  and i was running late getting back to work, so i couldn't even finish my overdone fries.Not happy. Won't be back. Womp womp.

22.description: I visited the establishment last week with a new employee of my company. The experience was very impressive. The entrees we ordered were prepared and delivered in a timely fashion that was surprising considering the line of people waiting to order their food. It was busy at the time of the visit, around 11am, which was a good thing for them. The establishment was governed by and family specifically by a father and son. I would recommed visiting and will visit again in the near future and order somehting diferent from the menu this time around to try something different

15.description: Had the cheese steak and fries because of the reviews we read here. They were really, really good!  Nice, friendly service.

7.description: Now that I found out Sal is not the owner anymore, it is clear as daylight why the service is so crappy. My girlfriend and I LOVED this place, the food was always good and service was very fast and extremely friendly. But my last experience was horrible! My fries were borderline burnt and my order was wrong which wasn't even the deal breaker as I could deal with a slight mix up, but waiting 30 minutes for two meals. That is CRAZY! You would think that it would take some time if the joint was busy but it was only a few other people before us.I also overheard other people getting upset that they had been waiting around for a while as well. Joke's on us for trying to pass of this place as the same establishment, I'm going to check out Sal's new place.

36.description: This place is the real deal. Owner is a pro at makin sandwiches and a nice guy. The place has got some history to it as well. Gotta try it to believe it.

30.description: OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Chicago's finest!  The best!  They aren't nice but with food this darn good who needs to!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

3.description: Not bad.. very tasty sandwich.  Pretty much a fast food joint.  Small tables, Free wifii, unappealing dining area.

14.description: Cheesesteak was delicious! Soft/tasty bun, just the right amount of onions/peppers. And the fries were probably some of the best fries I've ever had. Fresh, delicious, with a great texture. Very reasonably priced as well!!

3.description: I love Michelle!! She is a true artist! Her work is amazing! I have been going to her for a few years now! She's currently tatting my half sleeve And has covered up many bad pieces that I had got in the past from other places. She's awesome at giving advice! Her color are so vibrant!! I love it!! Finally found a true artist, I will definitely be back for more! :)

1.description: Etched In Skin..... What more can you say! Michelle is a great artist. Her shop has been there for years. A true Southside Gem. All work done by appt which is your time. Some of the best cover up work I have seen, my arms are proof! Keep up the good work. See ya soon!

2.description: This tattoo parlor is a 5 star joint for the young and dumb or biker gang.When I look for tattoos, I now look for various things that never even crossed my mind when I was "young and dumb".1. The tattoos artists must actually be artists outside of their tattoo profession and have something else to show. I like that tattoo artists have art shows.2. The artists work with the clients to create/design up a tattoo that fits that particular client's needs/personality (after all, it is their job to be creative as an artist). 3. Reputation- I stay AWAY from the places that are over priced tourist traps.4. I look for artists who can venture away from the traditional "out of the book" tattoo design and know how to give realistic looking tattoos.5. The studio must be clean, and I like when the shop is uniquely decorated to the artists' style. 6. The ink must be good and the artists must be able to work on themselves,When it comes to Etched in Skin, I can say that I have only experienced 2 out of these 6 things. This shop looks like every other I've been to on the south side. Blah. Walking in, you do not see much creativity and can't really make out the personal styles of the artist(s). There was only one artist working here when I came in, so it's not like you have a choice as to your tattoo style.Now, as I said, I was young and dumb when I came in here, so I stuck to the book. I got what I paid for: over priced, cartoonish looking traditional tattoos. They aren't very big at all and don't have as much design and talent as others I have seen from elsewhere. One, I want covered up, the other, I can only hope to get covered up. It's not that she did a bad job with the tattoos. She didn't. Looking back, I can say that her designs just arent my style. The ink used at this place though is pretty awesome. I dont have much fading at all with my two tattoos. Any fading that I do have is probably due to me not putting anything on the tats when out in the sun. I did not like the personalilty of the artist. She seemed to herself in a way. Not very talkative. Something really shady about her. One day when I went in with one of my siblings, she acted high as a kite. This in itself is something that turned us away.When choosing a tattoo place, do your homework and don't go somewhere because it's close and convenient. That choice literally stays with you (unless you choose to cover it up).

0.description: I'm not writing this review simply to disagree with Morgan's. I'm a new, long-time customer, if that makes any sense.  I was referred to Etched through a friend of a friend, and I'm incredibly thankful this happened.  Michelle is my tattoo artist and she's amazing.  No, she's not in some high-end, pretentious shop, nor is she a diamond in the rough.  I can't tell you how many years Michelle has been tattooing, but her works leads me to believe it's been a while.  Michelle did my left sleeve (which was complicated because I had my entire shoulder already done and I needed her to take another artists' vision, and make it her own.  Maybe I'm a little biased because it's my arm, but she nailed it).  She kept the original work, added to it, and then blended everything in to make one helluva 3/4 sleeve.  I loved her work so much that I went back for my back piece, which we're currently in the process of completing. You can walk in off the street and get great work done, or you can come in with a vision, talk with Michelle, and let her put something together.  You can't walk in to a tattoo parlor, tell the artist what you want, then expect something unbelievable to appear on your arm.  It doesn't work that way; it's a process.  Call the shop or stop in, throw around some ideas, then give Michelle a little bit more than 19 seconds to come up with something, and I guarantee you'll be impressed.  I've been referring people to this shop for almost 2 years now, and I will continue to do so.  Michelle is there to work.  She runs a business and runs it well.  Her designs are beautiful and her work speaks for itself.  Don't judge a shop by the location or the "I just want to get a tattoo so I'm going to pick from one of these designs hanging on the wall."  Judge the tattoo and the artist by their work, on someone's skin.  Her ink is the best, her rates are excellent, and she's a pretty cool chick.  5 Stars for sure.  Keep it up Michelle!  When the back is complete you know I'll be there for my right arm 3/4 sleeve!

4.description: I have been here for 6 of my tattoos. I had Michelle design and draw my tattoos for nobody else would have them. She did  a great job. Michelle does a great job and I would not go anywhere else...

3.description: Horrible service. I asked for no chip manicure and the lady kept saying acrylic.  I kept telling her no that they were my real nails not fake ones and she kept insisting and I kept telling her no. When I thought she had gotten the point she tried to pull my nail off!  Never going there again!

1.description: Horrible experience.  Bad service...The girl was watching a movie on her phone while she was doing my nails. She didn't do what I wanted.  Never going back!

2.description: So decided to give them another shot even though it's new management. Ugh, bad idea. Had bad experience with pedicure. Lets just say I walked out limping with a bandaid, no apologies, and no discount. Manager was there, she seen, and nothing. Never again. Im picky with nail salons, miss the old management :( . After some searching finally found my new spot, I highly recommend the new place I go to yelp.com/biz/e-nails-chi…

5.description: I must say that I was very pleased the way my nails came out today my first time here, I got the PINK&WHITE set, it's more expensive than the acrylic or gel nails, but well worth it! Vu did my nails, he is good! I will definetely come back!!!!!

0.description: This used to be my regular go to. However, recently there was an ownership change. While there are two or three ladies from previous owners that still work here, overall it has gone downhill. I used to love this place now I'm on Yelp looking for a replacement. Cleanliness, friendliness, and overall feeling is no longer acceptable.

4.description: Terrible service, the place was extremely dirty. The woman who was doing my nails used dirty utensils and didn't bother cleaning up the women's mess before me. She actually had nail clippings all over her station. Definitely never going back!

1.description: I love this place! This is my local spot that's only a few blocks away from my house. The delivery fee is only $3 and they're open late. The menu is good and they give tons of food. Con:closed on Mondays lol! If anyone wants good food for a great price I'd recommend this place

0.description: When I first moved to this neighborhood I ate at dozens of Chinese restaurants searching for the quality that I was used to in Chinatown. Fon Fon has by far the best tasting Chinese cuisine in Chicago. I highly recommend the chicken lo mein. The orange chicken is also fantastic (they make it nice and spicy)!  The menu includes all the typical authentic Chinese dishes one would expect, at a reasonable price!

3.description: Absolutely the worst DD I have ever been to. It is my fault that I still occasionally stop there. They never get my order right. I only ask for one drink. The DD on Pulaski/I 55 is amazing. Not only can make My drink they are kind and fast. I tipped the girl $5 the last time I was there.

1.description: No Wi-Fi... Still.... Come on man.After months of no Wi-Fi... Now this owner raises prices. His employees are good. His customer relation is shit.

2.description: First experience at this location was under construction which I did not like. I couldn't even eat at their table due to a table saw that they were using during my order. They wouldn't let us into the lobby because they were doing something to it. And also the egg bacon cheese bagel that I had had a really burnt bacon.  This is the reason I give them a one star. Bad service and burnt food

5.description: It took 10 minutes to get my bacon, egg & cheese bagel. The people there were very rude and obnoxious!

6.description: I know, I know. It's Dunkin' Donuts. This one is really awesome though when it comes to the drive-thru. Do not be fooled by the long line that curves around the Lowe's parking lot in the morning, you will not have to wait long. They are on top of their game at this location. They make everything fast, get your orders right and everything is super fresh since this location is so busy. I don't know why, but the lattes just taste so much better from this location. Who knows, maybe they actually measure out ingredients instead of just throwing stuff together like I am sure some other locations do, but I'm serious...the lattes taste really good and they are consistently good. That gets them a 5 star from this latte-loving mama.
