7.description: Went through the drive thru for a large iced coffee. Person on the intercom sounded like they were just mumbling. Get up to the window and we had to sit and wait for like 3-4 minutes before someone came to the window. Well, the iced coffee was good though.

8.description: I don't what it is about this location, but it's like the best of all the one's I go to.  I think it's because of how busy it is.  It's always fresh I guess.

0.description: Best Dunkin Donuts anywhere! Everyone is always so nice, so fast, and so efficient!!!! Just drove through, there were five cars before me and I got my coffee in 2 minutes!!!! Keep up the good work!!!!! Love this Dunkin!!!!

4.description: This is one of the worst run DD's I have ever been to.  The leadership must be absent from the operation and unable to set expectations of quality and good service. Or they're just in way over there head with running this store. Multiple times when I have gone in there was a line to the door and no one working with a sense of urgency. Customers walking out after no progress with the line, things like that. Amazing, some businesses you go into and they apologize for the wait when you only wait 15 seconds. Waiting here for five minutes still does not warrant any type of acknowledgment at all which is disappointing. It's so poorly run. Pay more for a competitor near by or just find another DD down the street. Or better yet, go in and check out the joke that is this location. They're so consistently bad that you're likely to have the same experience I am describing.

1.description: Every time I go to this salon I think "well maybe this time will be ok", when I leave I feel like I wasted an hour of my life and $20. Today however this shop costs me over $200 and my nails still look awful.I told the man how I wanted my nails done - what to do, what not to. Well lets just say the polish looks bad, one of my nails is crooked, and the acrylic is lumpy. I could have done a better job blindfolded. There is a parking lot between their strip mall and a closed Tasty Freeze. DON'T PARK THERE!!!! Although there is no sign you will be towed. I was!I can't recommend this place at all.

2.description: I've been a customer since their doors opened, nearly 15 years ago.  I love their service, but here lately, I've had to seek service somewhere else. Their sign says they close @ 8, but I arrived at 7 one day and 7:30 a few days later, the lights were out and so was I.  I found myself in the strip mall down the street and I'm very pleased!!!  They're open on Sunday as well. I'm gonna give this spot another chance. Cindy and Tony, step ur game up!!! Smooches.

0.description: I've been a customer for the past few years, but as of late, their customer service is horrible and most importantly, it's a hit or miss. The only technician that consistently delivers is Lee, so naturally she always overbooked. I'm definitely looking for another salon at this point.

3.description: I'll come here again for the wicked deals!The tables were sticky and there was a weird smell lingering in the air, but we had a really great time making fun of the joint and eating the good food.We had some adult rock playing on the jukebox but someone came in and ruined it with all this crunk music. The music did not fit the bar!We left when Lil' Jon wouldn't shut his damn pie hole!

1.description: If you want attention from unattractive, obese security guards, this is definitely the place to go!!The security guard flashed his light on my ass as I walked in & was following me to the bar. When I complained & asked for a manager, the bartender said she was the manager (LIE!!). I mentioned it was inappropriate & rude & all she did was agree with me. I attempted to call but only get voicemail. Inexcusable behavior!

2.description: This was the spot back in the 90s.  But sadly all good things must end.  This place is Closed.

5.description: Groucho's is infamous as a late night establishment.  A few years ago, New City included it in "Best of Chicago" as the "Best place to watch a fight".  I asked a friend who frequented a few years ago and he gave me some line about the two reasons why dudes go to groucho's and once its clear that the first isn't happening they move onto the second.  Full disclosure: I've never been here after 11 pm so I haven't seen it crowded and drunk.  That said, i was impressed with the evening shift.  Its actually a nice and large lounge with good food for a bar of its style.   Don't expect to have your hair blown back, but their burgers are tasty and they seem to have a pretty large selection of wraps and appentizers better than most bars.  Clean, sharp, good drinks and food...another good spot to watch the sox slowly make me concerned.

6.description: My boyfriend and I went there a few weeks ago, just to try it out, since it's near his house. It's not bad! Not a lot of people there at the time, but then again, it was on a Thursday, but we didn't mind. Had a few drinks and the tasty mini burgers for pretty cheap. I would go again.

0.description: DUDE!!!! this place is awesome!!!!!!! Its like the SOuthside equivalent of Blue on Western ave! A latenight bar were all forms of life stumble in and get their last drinks of the night. wow.................oh man!Hispanic Thugs...checkDungeons and dragons looking white dudes...checkHot chicks...check4 drunk Mexicans at the bar...check (that was us by the way)2 degos in suits ...check!I even saw 1 hipster!!!!!!!!! Bro thats a rarity this far south!Everyone in the late night pursuit of massive drunkedness!  this place is Legen........Wait for it...and I hope you're not lactose intolerant because the next word is....DAIRY!Shake & bake seal of approval!

4.description: Groucho's is the perfect place if you're, a) on a budget and b)looking to keep the party going after 2 a.m. The place is open until 5 a.m., I know because I've been there til about 4:30. You can't find a better deal on Wednesdays, $3 domestic pitchers! All you need is a $10 spot to make your day.As far as the food goes, the wings are pretty good and the pizza will satisfy any drunkard. The place can get crowded after 2 a.m. once all the other bars have shut down. Trust me, I've seen some things. You'll wake up asking yourself, "Did I really see that last night?!?!" Don't forget to tip the ladies, they do a good job over by derre.

1.description: Had this place once. Ordered 3 burritos, first they didn't have regular sized tortillas for them.. Alright not too big of a deal. I had literally given them list of what we wanted on the burritos. I get home literally not one of them has anything that we asked for. I return and explain that none of the burritos were prepared right and then one of the cashiers there has a real crappy attitude that I was complaining that nothing in my order was correct. The bummer is I can walk to this restaurant from my house but after the hassle I had on my first visit I'll never return.

0.description: The joint is fairly small however the food is fresh and home made and the service has been great! This little joint has great "salsas" which is hard to find in Mexican restaurants and the "Agua Frescas" are also great! I highly recommend checking this place out.
deana is awesome ..great cuts for the kids only 5-10$Cut and color 65$ Eyebrows wax 10

3.description: Been here a couple of times so far it's ok I just hope they don't disappoint later on, come here during week days if you show up on a Saturday... Good luck!

1.description: 5 stars for the paella. The service sucks but who the hell cares when the paella blows any other one ive ever tried out of the water. The mussels are really good too and have a great kick. The ceviche is delicious. Everything else is ok, but the Paella is the real star.

2.description: This is a really good mexican seafood place. Strangely, they have a few less items than their Pulaski and 54th counterpart. But otherwise its a quieter version of that restaurant. The ceviche del pescado is always fresh and never fishy. The service was a bit better at this one too. Probably because they're a little less busy.

5.description: I should of read the comments before I stepped foot in this place. Too late now, been waiting too long for our food. I hope the food is good since the service is horrid. To add injury to insult , the added a 15% tip on the bill.

6.description: I thought this place would be good but...The food was not fresh, the shrimp was really chewy and the drinks were not great.

7.description: If you are a fan of seafood this is a great place for "Mexican style seafood"They always start you off with a free little appetizer. Love that!!  The salsas are good and compliment the dishes they serve.My favorite is the "langostinos" A M A Z I N G!!  I have tried several other dishes from picking at my family's meals, but  my dish has remained the langostinos. They are very good and the sauce they come in is delicious.the reason for the 4 and not 5 stars is because the first  time i came here, i had the shrimp fajitas and the shrimp were over cooked. They were hard and chewy. not good. they did replace it and the second were better. by the time i got my 2nd dish my family were done eating..... : /My sister had a similar experience a few visits later.....This has been an issue 2 times in about 2 years of visiting this place.

8.description: Food great but servise bad especially with this short girl black hair she is the worse got an attitude with people like if she's doing it for free I been goin there for years and I hate her I was there yesterday told the owner hopefully I won't see that bitch again

9.description: This place is AWESOME. Every time I've been there its pretty empty which is great, I hate crowds. My best friend and I always order the ceviche and margarita's on the rocks. DELISH!!

0.description: I was not a big fan of this place until not long ago.  They always had ok food.Now, I am a fan, I don't know if they switched cooks but the food is excellent.  By far this is one of the best Mexican seafood places in Chicago, especially in the southside.  I have been to a couple of their other locations but this one on 82nd and Pulaski is the best.It is always a nice atmosphere in here and service varies but for the most part is good.Their langostinos, aguiachiles and molcajete are the best also try their ceviche.  It's great.Love coming here and I love the food!

4.description: Food was dry and lacking taste. The service was terrible. We asked for more tostadas and the server came back with a brand new bag of tostadas and handed it to me... Um sure let me do your job for you. Then we walked for the check and waited.... and waited...... Until we were told that we had to pay at the register......

3.description: I arrived back home in Chicago last night and as soon as I left Midway airport I headed to Harold's. This was my first time at this location and I will be back there from now on. It is clean and there is enough space inside for you to sit and eat or wait on your order. The chicken is cooked to order so everything is hot when you get it. Love it!

1.description: Chicken wings with Mild Sauce and fries?  I have no idea what's in that sauce, but its good.  I'll definitely have to have Harold's anytime I'm in Chi-Town.

2.description: One of the best locations for Harolds.Good portion sizes, goos specials and the have your food ready when you call it in! So many locations say they will have it ready in 20 minutes and of course it is not ready for another 45 minutes. Gotta get salt, pepper, and mild sauce on everything lol.

0.description: This Harold's is very courteous, clean, and fast.I've been to a few Harold's, but I have to say that this one is the best so far.  Their lunch specials are inexpensive and filling. I've been coming here since day one and it's the same exact people many years later. I like that in business, it exemplifies consistency. Hot sauce, black pepper, no bread. 3 wing special with fries. That's me.
